Leadership, lavoro in team, rispetto di ogni individualit√†, approfondimento continuo, trasparenza, impegno verso la comunit√†, integrit√†: questi sono i Valori di KPMG che danno vita a un ambiente aperto allo scambio di idee e di conoscenza, che permette ai nostri professionisti di esprimere tutto il loro potenziale.

KPMG S.p.A. garantisce le pari opportunit√†.
The chance to build a better future is right in front of you
Do Work That Matters - Your Role and Responsibilities

Do you want to do work that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG, you will have the opportunity to help clients, society, and your colleagues tackle and solve the most current and complex challenges.

The Digital Assurance Team is KPMG‚Äôs innovative team which brings together different skill sets to shape the digitalization of the future for assurance and audit services. You will have the opportunity to work alongside expert auditors ‚Äì through in-house courses and especially on-the-job training ‚Äì developing the ability to critically analyse the company processes used in financial reporting and the information processed by the companies‚Äô IT systems, identifying errors and interpreting the dynamics underlying financial performance.
Specifically, you will be tasked with:
The development of analytics solutions for audit teams (transactional analytics, dashboards for the analysis of accounting data, process mining, process KPIs, etc.)
The development of audit techniques based on the use of innovative technological solutions
Assistance to the audit teams in using the new solutions
The organization of communication initiatives to raise awareness of the project/solutions.
Come As You Are - Your Skills and Characteristics
This is the perfect opportunity for you if:
You have a business/accounting background with a degree in business subject
You have a strong interest in financial reporting and data analytics
You have a desire to learn and challenge yourself
You want to grow within an International Network
Your Future With Us - What You Will Find at KPMG
An inclusive and equitable work environment that respects, encourages, and values diversity.
A challenging and dynamic environment that encourages creativity and teamwork. [NL1]
Hybrid work arrangements to promote a healthy work-life balance.
Advanced training and development programs to stay current.
Initiatives focused on physical and mental well-being.
Together for Better ‚Äì Our Values and Commitment

Leadership, teamwork, respect for individuality, continuous learning, transparency, community engagement, integrity: these are the values of KPMG that create an environment open to the exchange of ideas and knowledge, allowing our professionals to express their full potential.

Thanks to our commitment to fostering an inclusive work environment, our network has obtained ISO 30415 certification, which attests to the compliance of our Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and UNI PdR 125 certification, which certifies gender equality. Within our Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - you will find a summary of all the actions we are taking on environmental, social, and governance (ESG) issues.

Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) no. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ‚ÄúGDPR‚Äù), as amended. For more information, please see KPMG‚Äôs privacy policy .
KPMG S.p.A. is an equal opportunity employer.

4235892468,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-visualization-specialist-at-prada-group-4235892468?position=19&pageNum=0&refId=vq8WS7zgmrGZDLe1HPBa5g%3D%3D&trackingId=XrVdF4odSmIaThJpyev00A%3D%3D,Data Visualization Specialist,Prada Group,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Job description:

The ideal candidate will work in the worldwide Data Analytics team based in Milan and will be responsible for managing and coordinating end-to-end data visualization projects. This includes collecting business requirements, designing the most appropriate and efficient data model, and implementing the final data visualization solution.
Design and Implement Data Solutions: Create efficient and effective data solutions for reporting and analysis, working with key stakeholders to build dashboards using enterprise tools like Power BI.
Collect Requirements:¬†Gather technical and business requirements from stakeholders, understand their needs, and support them in designing the optimal data visualization solution.

ETL and Data Manipulation: Build and deploy highly efficient and scalable ETL processes using big data and cloud technologies (e.g., Databricks), collaborating with other IT colleagues such as DWH owners and Data Architects.
Stakeholder Communication:¬†Periodically update main stakeholders about the progress and maintenance of solutions development.
+ 2 years in data analytics and BI roles.
Strong experience with Power BI, designing and implementing dashboards for both desktop and mobile use, and innovative and advanced data analysis tools for enterprises.
Master's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, Maths, or related STEM discipline.
Good knowledge of SQL or other data analysis programming languages.

Familiarity with data warehouse environments (Oracle, MS SQL Server) and cloud-based data platforms is a plus. Experience with Qlik Sense is a plus. Preferred experience with Agile project management.
Fluent in English and Italian, both written and spoken.
Preferred Experience in the fashion luxury sector would be a plus.

Casa di Cura Ambrosiana √® stata fondata nel 1967 da Fondazione Sacra Famiglia Onlus per rispondere alle esigenze medico-chirurgiche di pazienti portatori di handicap. Nel corso degli anni, oltre a mantenere la mission di cura verso la popolazione fragile, si √® notevolmente ampliata nelle competenze e nell‚Äôofferta, mettendosi al servizio dell‚Äôeterogenea utenza del territorio.
Casa di Cura Ambrosiana ricerca un/a OSS da inserire all'interno dell'ambulatorio di Endoscopia.
verificare il programma giornaliero e prepara le attrezzature, in collaborazione con l'Infermiere
accogliere il paziente, raccogliendo i dati anamnestici, verificando la corretta preparazione e informandolo sulla procedura
aiutare il paziente nella preparazione per l'esame e assistere il medico durante la procedura
supportare il paziente nella fase di recupero e fornisce indicazioni post-esame
gestire la la pulizia e la sterilizzazione delle attrezzature.
esperienza maturata nel ruolo o in attivit√† di sterilizzazione di strumenti
disponibilit√† full-time (dal luned√¨ al venerd√¨ dalle 8:30 alle 16:00).

4236568099,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-consultant-data-analytics-at-kpmg-italy-4236568099?position=26&pageNum=0&refId=vq8WS7zgmrGZDLe1HPBa5g%3D%3D&trackingId=dZVlb1KXrHAOWlDC1lpPTQ%3D%3D,Junior Consultant Data Analytics,KPMG Italy,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

Vuoi fare un lavoro che sia davvero significativo e di impatto? In KPMG avrai l‚Äôopportunit√† di aiutare i clienti, la societ√†, le colleghe e i colleghi ad affrontare e risolvere le sfide pi√π attuali e complesse. KPMG Advisory offre servizi di consulenza alle imprese per affiancarle nella trasformazione del business model, nel miglioramento e nella digitalizzazione dei processi, nell'analisi e nella gestione dei rischi, nonch√© supporto nelle operazioni di finanza straordinaria.
Nel particolare, entrerai a far parte del Team di Lighthouse.
La Lighthouse √® il centro di eccellenza di KPMG Advisory che offre soluzioni di Data & Analytics sul mercato.

Unendoti al team, svilupperai soluzioni innovative attingendo dalle nostre competenze globali. Combinerai informatica, matematica, statistica e business per creare analisi predittive, presentandole e comunicandole con professionalit√† e competenza. Opererai in un ambiente orientato all'innovazione tecnologica, occupandoti dell'ingegneria dei dati, con un forte focus sulla progettazione delle informazioni e visualizzazione dei dati. Abbiamo ricevuto riconoscimenti internazionali per quanto riguarda la nostra capacit√† di interpretare e gestire i dati.
Analisi di modelli analitici a supporto dei processi di business
Analisi, progettazione e implementazione di fonti di dati
Data Visualization, Advanced Analytics, Big Data
Progettare KPI e i framework di calcolo pi√π efficienti
Analizzare, progettare e implementare modelli di reporting e dashboard di monitoraggio
Analizzare processi aziendali e progettare modelli di supporto analitico
Implementare soluzioni analitiche, supportare il go-live e gestire la manutenzione delle applicazioni.
Come As You Are - Le tue competenze e caratteristiche
Questa opportunit√† √® perfetta per te se:
Possiedi una Laurea in economia, matematica, ingegneria matematica, statistica, ingegneria informatica, ingegneria gestionale o informatica
Hai sviluppato conoscenza in ambito dati e database (modelli dati entit√†/relazioni, DBMS)
Hai sviluppato la capacit√† di combinare competenze aziendali con competenze IT, inclusa la modellazione dei dati
Hai sviluppato interesse per la Data Visualization e Business Intelligence
Hai sviluppato Interesse per i tool ed i processi ETL (Informatica, Talend, Datastage)
Hai una buona padronanza della lingua inglese, preferibilmente con esperienze di studio e/o lavoro all'estero
Possiedi conoscenza di almeno uno dei seguenti database (Oracle, SQL Server, PostgreSQL) e hai sviluppato competenze in SQL
column2: la conoscenza di linguaggi di programmazione rappresenta un vantaggio.

column1: Your Future With Us - Cosa troverai in KPMG
Un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, equo e che rispetta, incoraggia e valorizza le diversit√†
Un contesto stimolante e dinamico che incentiva la creativit√† e il lavoro di squadra
Modalit√† di lavoro ibrida, per promuovere un sano equilibrio tra vita lavorativa e personale
Programmi di formazione e sviluppo avanzati per rimanere sempre aggiornati
Together for Better ‚Äì I nostri valori e il nostro impegno

Leadership, lavoro in team, rispetto di ogni individualit√†, approfondimento continuo, trasparenza, impegno verso la comunit√†, integrit√†: questi sono i Valori di KPMG che danno vita a un ambiente aperto allo scambio di idee e di conoscenza, che permette ai nostri professionisti di esprimere tutto il loro potenziale.

Grazie all‚Äôimpegno nel favorire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, il nostro Network ha ottenuto le certificazioni ISO 30415, che attesta la conformit√† del Sistema di Gestione per la Diversit√† e l‚ÄôInclusione, e UNI PdR 125, che certifica la parit√† di genere. All‚Äôinterno del nostro Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - trovi riassunte tutte le azioni che stiamo portando avanti su tematiche ambientali, sociali e di governance (ESG).

I tuoi dati saranno trattati nel pieno rispetto delle disposizioni del Regolamento (UE) n. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ""GDPR"") e successive modifiche. Per ulteriori informazioni, consultare l'informativa sulla privacy di KPMG.
KPMG Advisory S.p.A. garantisce le pari opportunit√†
At KPMG - no secrets with big data
We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

Do you want to pursue a profession that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG, you will have the opportunity to help clients, the company and colleagues address and solve the most current and complex challenges. KPMG Advisory offers consulting services to companies to assist them in business model transformation, process improvement and digitisation, risk analysis and management, and support in extraordinary finance transactions.
Specifically, you will join our Lighthouse team.
Lighthouse is the KPMG Advisory centre of excellence delivering an array of data & analytics solutions.

Alongside the team, you will develop innovative solutions by drawing on our global expertise,with access to shared knowledge from our centres of excellence Your experience in IT, mathematics and statistics along with your corporate expertise will allow you to design and implement predictive analytical solutions, integrating different factors and presenting them in a professional manner. In a business- and technological innovation-orientated environment, your work will embrace data science, data engineering and information visualisation.
Specifically, you will be tasked with:
data visualization , advanced analytics, Big Data
designing more efficient KPIs and computing frameworks
analysing, designing and implementing reporting models and dashboards
analysing corporate processes and designing analytical support models
implementing analytical solutions, supporting the launch and overseeing the maintenance of software.

4227246535,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/saint-laurent-client-advisor-at-saint-laurent-4227246535?position=37&pageNum=0&refId=vq8WS7zgmrGZDLe1HPBa5g%3D%3D&trackingId=J2t2dCy0nzVrw2dENxFqmw%3D%3D,SAINT LAURENT Client Advisor,Saint Laurent,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","

Founded in 1961, Yves Saint Laurent was the first couture house to introduce the concept of luxury pr√™t-√†-porter in a 1966 collection called ‚ÄòRive Gauche‚Äô, synonymous with youth and freedom. This shift represented a first critical step in the modernization of fashion and revolutionized the sociocultural landscape. In 1999, the luxury goods division of the Kering Group acquired Yves Saint Laurent and, under the creative direction of Anthony Vaccarello since April 2016, continues to position the house at the summit of the luxury universe. Today, Saint Laurent collections include women‚Äôs and men‚Äôs ready-to-wear, shoes, handbags, small leather goods, jewelry, scarves, ties and eyewear.
A Client Advisor contribute actively to the store sales and key indicators achievement.

They are providing a unique, memorable, sophisticated, and everlasting experience to all external and internal clients. They also support the management team and colleagues while consistently upholding our Maison values, image, and standards.
Provide an outstanding client and after-sale service to all visitors and clients
Show passion in connecting and reconnecting with clients, putting them at the center, identifying their needs and anticipating their future requests
Cultivate a robust client portfolio to secure a proactive and growing business
Drive performance to exceed individual sales and KPI goals by having a business mindset and an entrepreneurial approach
Know how to create personalized, versatile, and timeless silhouettes for the client and demonstrating your passion for the fashion culture
Show a transparent and genuine attitude with the client and create a unique connection with them
Communicate in a professional and authentic way, with clients and colleagues
Effectively use all the available tools to optimize business opportunities
Proactively support the front and back-of-house teams, their achievements and ultimately the overall team spirit
Adhere to all company policies and operational procedures and follow them
A preferred professional experience in providing a high quality service focused on Client expectations, i.e. in fashion & accessory retail, in customer service or in luxury hospitality
Have personal taste and passion for the fashion culture, like to create personalized looks
Have a natural business mindset and an entrepreneurial spirit
Open-minded and looking for a company valuing audacity and authenticity
Strong team spirit to achieve common goals
At ease with using tools and applications, learns fast with new technologies
Motivation to work in a fast-paced environment, able to multitask & prioritize
Proactive, enthusiastic, & with a problem-solving attitude
Excellent written, oral & listening skills, in English and local language
Embrace change and see it as an opportunity to grow and develop

Saint Laurent is committed to building a diverse workforce. We believe diversity in all its forms ‚Äì gender, age, nationality, culture, religious beliefs and sexual orientation ‚Äì enriches the workplace. It opens up opportunities for people to express their talent, both individually and collectively and it helps foster our ability to adapt to a changing world. As an Equal Opportunity Employer we welcome and consider applications from all qualified candidates.

Summary

ABOUT SAINT LAURENT

Founded in 1961, Yves Saint Laurent was the first couture house to introduce the concept of luxury pr√™t-√†-porter in a 1966 collection called ‚ÄòRive Gauche‚Äô, synonymous with youth and freedom. This shift represented a first critical step in the modernization of fashion and revolutionized the sociocultural landscape. In 1999, the luxury goods division of the Kering Group acquired Yves Saint Laurent and, under the creative direction of Anthony Vaccarello since April 2016, continues to position the house at the summit of the luxury universe. Today, Saint Laurent collections include women‚Äôs and men‚Äôs ready-to-wear, shoes, handbags, small leather goods, jewelry, scarves, ties and eyewear.

Job Description

PURPOSE OF THE POSITION:
column2:
A Client Advisor contribute actively to the store sales and key indicators achievement.

They are providing a unique, memorable, sophisticated, and everlasting experience to all external and internal clients. They also support the management team and colleagues while consistently upholding our Maison values, image, and standards.

MISSIONS &
column3:
RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Provide an outstanding client and after-sale service to all visitors and clients
  • Show passion in connecting and reconnecting with clients, putting them at the center, identifying their needs and anticipating their future requests
  • Cultivate a robust client portfolio to secure a proactive and growing business
  • Drive performance to exceed individual sales and KPI goals by having a business mindset and an entrepreneurial approach
  • Know how to create personalized, versatile, and timeless silhouettes for the client and demonstrating your passion for the fashion culture
  • Show a transparent and genuine attitude with the client and create a unique connection with them
  • Communicate in a professional and authentic way, with clients and colleagues
  • Effectively use all the available tools to optimize business opportunities
  • Proactively support the front and back-of-house teams, their achievements and ultimately the overall team spirit
  • Adhere to all company policies and operational procedures and follow them

PROFILE

  • A preferred professional experience in providing a high quality service focused on Client expectations, i.e. in fashion &
column4:
accessory retail, in customer service or in luxury hospitality
  • Have personal taste and passion for the fashion culture, like to create personalized looks
  • Have a natural business mindset and an entrepreneurial spirit
  • Open-minded and looking for a company valuing audacity and authenticity
  • Strong team spirit to achieve common goals
  • At ease with using tools and applications, learns fast with new technologies
  • Motivation to work in a fast-paced environment, able to multitask &
column5:
prioritize
  • Proactive, enthusiastic, &
column6:
with a problem-solving attitude
  • Excellent written, oral &
column7:
listening skills, in English and local language
  • Embrace change and see it as an opportunity to grow and develop

    • Saint Laurent is committed to building a diverse workforce. We believe diversity in all its forms ‚Äì gender, age, nationality, culture, religious beliefs and sexual orientation ‚Äì enriches the workplace. It opens up opportunities for people to express their talent, both individually and collectively and it helps foster our ability to adapt to a changing world. As an Equal Opportunity Employer we welcome and consider applications from all qualified candidates.

    Job Type

    Fixed Term (Fixed Term)

    Start Date

    2025-07-15

    Schedule

    Full time

    Organization

4221195286,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/e-commerce-omnichannel-data-analyst-at-versace-4221195286?position=38&pageNum=0&refId=vq8WS7zgmrGZDLe1HPBa5g%3D%3D&trackingId=GtnXBMbNfgaTSQlf3cSLAg%3D%3D,E-commerce & Omnichannel Data Analyst,Versace,Greater Milan Metropolitan Area,"Country: Italy
Versace is one of the most recognizable names in the world. The luxury House immediately became a leader in fashion and culture following its founding in 1978.

Versace is led by Emmanuel Gintzburger as CEO and the design team is under the leadership of the Chief Creative Officer, Dario Vitale. Donatella Versace remains the Chief Brand Ambassador for Versace since April 1st, 2025.
The E-commerce & Omnichannel Data Analyst will join the Data Analytics Team, reporting into the Global Ecommerce & Omnichannel Data Science & Business Analytics Manager.
This role is crucial in supporting the business through in-depth and insightful data analysis, generating reports and recommendations for top management and the E-commerce & Omnichannel team.
Analyze digital and omnichannel business and digital marketing performance, creating reports and dashboards to share results with a wide range of stakeholders.
Monitor web analytics and KPIs related to the e-Commerce channel to track performance, generate valuable insights, and identify areas for improvement.
Collaborate with multiple teams (Merchandising, Media, CRM, Regional teams) to consolidate findings, provide actionable insights, and drive data-informed decisions.
Manage and organize work, including collaboration with the digital agencies on the data visualization platforms.
Analyze key business KPIs using Versace's analytics tools (GA4, Adobe Analytics, OBIEE, etc.).
Proactively identify business challenges, develop data-driven solutions, and communicate recommendations effectively.
Leverage data analysis skills to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies that can inform business strategy and improve performance.
Build and maintain data models and datasets to support reporting and analysis needs.
Analyze large datasets using SQL and similar languages to derive actionable insights and build insightful dashboards and reports.
2+ years of experience in a similar role within the Fashion & Luxury industry or at a major consulting firm, demonstrating a strong understanding of the business and its unique challenges.
Demonstrated experience working with data as a Data Analyst, including data manipulation, cleaning, analysis, and visualization.
Passion for the fashion and luxury world.
University degree in Business, Management, Digital Marketing, Data Science, or a related field.
Data-oriented mindset with advanced Excel and BI skills. Exceptional analytical skills, accuracy, and attention to detail are essential.
Proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g., Domo, Looker Studio, Power BI, Tableau or similar).
Strong understanding of statistical concepts and methods
Excellent written and spoken English (will be tested during the interview process).
Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with a proactive approach and the ability to thrive in Versace's diverse and multicultural team.
Team player, highly organized, and flexible, with the ability to adapt to a fast-paced, ever-changing environment.

Diversity and inclusion are integral to Versace's DNA. We promote an inclusive environment where employees and customers from diverse backgrounds are welcomed, valued, and celebrated. We take pride in our commitment to diversity, equality, and inclusion, and will continue to uphold these principles wherever we do business. Our doors are open to all.
WE ARE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER M/D/F

City: Milan, Piazza Einaudi, 4

4232292934,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-it-cor-srl-4232292934?position=41&pageNum=0&refId=vq8WS7zgmrGZDLe1HPBa5g%3D%3D&trackingId=0J5lbDgGYyhO0VeFaNK7Sg%3D%3D,Data Analyst,IT.COR Srl,"Carpiano, Lombardy, Italy","IT.COR S.r.l., azienda di consulenza IT, √® alla ricerca di un/una Data Analyst. Ricechiamo una risorsa in grado di raccogliere, analizzare e interpretare grandi volumi di dati, per tradurli in insight utili a supporto delle decisioni aziendali.
Linguaggi di programmazione: Ottima conoscenza di SQL, Python, e R.
Analisi Dati: Esperienza avanzata con Excel e utilizzo di strumenti di Business Intelligence come Power BI, Tableau e Looker.
Database e Big Data: Esperienza con SQL e NoSQL, gestione di database relazionali e cloud (esperienza con AWS, Google BigQuery, Azure).
Statistica e Matematica: Conoscenza solida di analisi statistica, test A/B, regressione, e modelli predittivi.
Machine Learning (opzionale): Conoscenza di base dei modelli di apprendimento automatico (machine learning).
ETL e Data Pipeline: Esperienza con strumenti di data wrangling e pipeline di trasformazione dei dati.
Data Storytelling: Capacit√† di tradurre dati complessi in insight comprensibili per il business, presentando informazioni in modo chiaro ed efficace.
Problem Solving: Ottime capacit√† di identificare problemi aziendali e proporre soluzioni basate sui dati.
Interpretazione Dati: Abilit√† nell'analizzare KPI, metriche di business e trend, per fornire previsioni e raccomandazioni.
Certificazioni (opzionale): Certificazioni come Google Data Analytics, Microsoft Certified: Data Analyst Associate, e AWS Data Analytics sono considerate un plus.
Le ricerche sono rivolte a candidati di entrambi i sessi, in ottemperanza alla Legge 903/77.

4240143389,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-data-analyst-at-msx-international-4240143389?position=44&pageNum=0&refId=vq8WS7zgmrGZDLe1HPBa5g%3D%3D&trackingId=3Wc91n3sM6RRIi7SY%2Finwg%3D%3D,Junior Data Analyst,MSX International,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Company Description

MSX International Group‚ÄØis the leading global provider of outsourced business solutions for the automotive industry making business in more than 80 countries. MSXI‚Äôs deep industry expertise combined with advanced data analytics and custom software solutions improve the performance of automotive dealership networks by increasing revenue, reducing cost, and enhancing customer satisfaction.
Are you an automotive fan? Do you have experience in the world of data analysis and enjoy providing the best solutions for customers? MSXI has the job for you!
MSX is looking for a proactive and enthusiastic Junior Data Analyst to join our team in Rome or Milan.

As a Junior Data Analyst, you will support the data management and analysis processes within the organization. Your primary responsibilities will include collecting, organizing, and interpreting data to help guide decision-making processes.
Collaborate with teams to identify business needs and data requirements
Create reports, and conduct analyses regarding trainings
Applying the procedures in compliance with the company's standards and policies

We would love to welcome a new colleague passionate about the automotive field, oriented to teamwork and taking the good dose of initiative to achieve results. Our ideal Junior Data Analyst has a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in IT, Statistics or similar experience, as well as:
Advanced level user of Power BI, HTML, MS Office
Fully professional Italian and English knowledge
Experience of planning complex schedules of activities

Company Description

MSX International Group‚ÄØis the leading global provider of outsourced business solutions for the automotive industry making business in more than 80 countries. MSXI‚Äôs deep industry expertise combined with advanced data analytics and custom software solutions improve the performance of automotive dealership networks by increasing revenue, reducing cost, and enhancing customer satisfaction.

Job Description

Junior Data Analyst

40 hours per week, Monday-Friday

Rome / Milan, hybrid

Are you an automotive fan? Do you have experience in the world of data analysis and enjoy providing the best solutions for customers? MSXI has the job for you!

MSX is looking for a proactive and enthusiastic Junior Data Analyst to join our team in Rome or Milan.

The Role

As a Junior Data Analyst, you will support the data management and analysis processes within the organization. Your primary responsibilities will include collecting, organizing, and interpreting data to help guide decision-making processes.

Your Key Tasks Will Be

  • Collaborate with teams to identify business needs and data requirements
  • Create reports, and conduct analyses regarding trainings
  • Applying the procedures in compliance with the company's standards and policies

About You

We would love to welcome a new colleague passionate about the automotive field, oriented to teamwork and taking the good dose of initiative to achieve results. Our ideal Junior Data Analyst has a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in IT, Statistics or similar experience, as well as:

  • Experience in reporting, data analysis
  • Advanced level user of Power BI, HTML, MS Office
  • Experience with Learning Management Systems (Cornerstone)
  • Fully professional Italian and English knowledge
  • Great problem-solving and communication skills
  • Experience of planning complex schedules of activities

If you can demonstrate that you are familiar with data analysis and reporting and you are a team-player, we would like to hear from you!

4233903298,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-internship-at-kedrion-biopharma-4233903298?position=1&pageNum=2&refId=tJCtI%2BbcYxPNWl3sUl1IyA%3D%3D&trackingId=V68QeHtJ6VkrBC8mpMEMIQ%3D%3D,Business Intelligence Internship,Kedrion Biopharma,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Job description:

¬†We are looking for a motivated and talented intern to join our Business Intelligence team. The ideal candidate will have a strong passion for data analysis and the ability to transform complex information into valuable business insights on a global scale. Key responsibilities will include supporting project execution, participating in the analysis, development, and maintenance of Business Intelligence, Big Data, and Analytics solutions. The candidate will operate in line with requirements and the technical landscape, adopting best practices and adhering to external regulations.¬†Requirements:¬†‚Ä¢ Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, or related fields (also in progress).‚Ä¢ Basic knowledge of Business Intelligence tools.‚Ä¢ Analytical skills and attention to detail.‚Ä¢ Good communication skills and teamwork abilities.‚Ä¢ Proficiency in English.¬†Main Responsibilities:¬†‚Ä¢ Assist in the collection and management of data from various international business sources.‚Ä¢ Supporting data analysis using BI tools such as Power BI, Tableau, and SQL. Training to be provided where suitable.‚Ä¢ Creation of reports and dashboards to present analysis results.‚Ä¢ Collaboration with the team to understand business needs and provide data-driven solutions.‚Ä¢ Providing support in the maintenance and management of the company's Data Warehouse and ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes.‚Ä¢ Supporting the supervisor in gathering and evaluating business requirements to ensure they are correctly collected and technically feasible.‚Ä¢ Assisting the supervisor in regular maintenance of BI/Big Data and Analytics, in line with requirements and the technical landscape.‚Ä¢ Drafting and supporting documentation to accurately represent business processes and train end users on new solutions in conjunction with the supervisor.‚Ä¢ For the area of responsibility, supporting the supervisor in executing project activities to ensure initiatives are completed on time and within budget.‚Ä¢ Collaborating with business functions in reviewing technical documents to ensure alignment with business requirements.‚Ä¢ Assisting with the execution all testing phases, in line with test plans, to monitor the correct functioning of implemented applications.‚Ä¢ Support the provision of training to end users and day to day services to ensure smooth adoption of BI applications.‚Ä¢ Supporting IT support services and business end users in resolving complex issues to ensure they are resolved with minimal disruption.¬†What We Offer:¬†Opportunities for learning and professional growth in an international context.Dynamic and stimulating work environment.Chance to work on innovative and impactful global projects
This announcement is addressed to applicants of both sexes (L. 903/77 - D.Lgs n. 198/2006) and also to those belonging to Protected Categories (L.68/99).

4224392204,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/oss-endoscopia-at-fondazione-sacra-famiglia-onlus-4224392204?position=2&pageNum=2&refId=tJCtI%2BbcYxPNWl3sUl1IyA%3D%3D&trackingId=18KeU9vj81x0sZJUL%2F3R9A%3D%3D,OSS - Endoscopia,Fondazione Sacra Famiglia Onlus,"Cesano Boscone, Lombardy, Italy","Casa di Cura Ambrosiana √® una clinica privata accreditata con il Servizio Sanitario Regionale in grado di offrire prestazioni di ricovero e prestazioni ambulatoriali nelle principali specialit√†.

Casa di Cura Ambrosiana √® stata fondata nel 1967 da Fondazione Sacra Famiglia Onlus per rispondere alle esigenze medico-chirurgiche di pazienti portatori di handicap. 4130498632,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-subito-4130498632?position=4&pageNum=2&refId=tJCtI%2BbcYxPNWl3sUl1IyA%3D%3D&trackingId=mcW6x1naQMIS5DNqHwVh3A%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Subito,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","We‚Äôre Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

We‚Äôre all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they‚Äôre looking for in their local communities ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.
What You‚Äôll Do & Who You Are
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Subito‚Äôs team. Our mission is to turn data into insights, and get a clear understanding of the Italian market and marketplace industry.
The Data Analyst will be part of the Business Analytics team mainly supporting the Management Team, Finance, Marketing and Sales departments in the decision making process.
The Data Analyst will study user behaviour, evaluate strategic initiatives and new features. Above all, your work will impact the growth of our business.

Mash up and analyse different data sets to support the business with high-value insights (we have some data engineering heroes, so it‚Äôs more analysing than mashing up!) and structure presentations showing the findings to a variety of stakeholders
Formulate/test hypotheses to explain underlying reasons about business dynamics
Design clear, automated reports to democratise data access to the whole company
Work in a cross functional team, mostly focusing on the business insights generation in collaboration with colleagues of Marketing, Finance and Sales departments
Contribute both on short term analysis and long term initiatives, either local or global
Dig deep in our data lake and build Machine Learning models to make Subito a smarter product and enhance business understanding
4+ years of experience as Data Analyst / Data Scientist
Knowledge of one or more analytics languages, ideally Python
Data visualization and presentation skills to match a wide range of audiences
Prior experience in a digital company
Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP...)
Hands on experience on Data Science projects
Opportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisation
Benefits including stock purchase plan and annual bonus plans
Flexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, autonomy to set your own agenda, choice of phone and computer
Smart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.
‚ÄòWork from anywhere‚Äô weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!
Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more

For each working day, you will be eligible for a ‚Ç¨8 meal voucher., You can use our local provider Fitprime to maintain physical well-being., You will receive 250 euros on the welfare platform after the birth of your child

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don‚Äôt meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don‚Äôt meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

We‚Äôre Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

We‚Äôre all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever they‚Äôre looking for in their local communities ‚Äì whether it‚Äôs a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.

What You‚Äôll Do &
column2:
Who You Are

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Subito‚Äôs team. Our mission is to turn data into insights, and get a clear understanding of the Italian market and marketplace industry.

The Data Analyst will be part of the Business Analytics team mainly supporting the Management Team, Finance, Marketing and Sales departments in the decision making process.

The Data Analyst will study user behaviour, evaluate strategic initiatives and new features. Above all, your work will impact the growth of our business.

Your Typical Day

  • Mash up and analyse different data sets to support the business with high-value insights (we have some data engineering heroes, so it‚Äôs more analysing than mashing up!) and structure presentations showing the findings to a variety of stakeholders
  • Formulate/test hypotheses to explain underlying reasons about business dynamics
  • Design clear, automated reports to democratise data access to the whole company
  • Work in a cross functional team, mostly focusing on the business insights generation in collaboration with colleagues of Marketing, Finance and Sales departments
  • Contribute both on short term analysis and long term initiatives, either local or global
  • Dig deep in our data lake and build Machine Learning models to make Subito a smarter product and enhance business understanding

Skills Required

  • 4+ years of experience as Data Analyst / Data Scientist
  • Highly proficient with SQL
  • Knowledge of one or more analytics languages, ideally Python
  • Applied knowledge of statistical techniques
  • Data visualization and presentation skills to match a wide range of audiences

Plus

  • Good English proficiency level
  • Prior experience in a digital company
  • Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP...)
  • Hands on experience on Data Science projects

Benefits

  • Competitive compensation package
  • Opportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisation
  • Benefits including stock purchase plan and annual bonus plans
  • Flexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, autonomy to set your own agenda, choice of phone and computer
  • Smart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.
  • ‚ÄòWork from anywhere‚Äô weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!
  • Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more

For each working day, you will be eligible for a ‚Ç¨8 meal voucher., You can use our local provider Fitprime to maintain physical well-being., You will receive 250 euros on the welfare platform after the birth of your child

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don‚Äôt meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don‚Äôt meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

4230791789,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/stage-fraud-data-analyst-at-leroy-merlin-4230791789?position=7&pageNum=2&refId=tJCtI%2BbcYxPNWl3sUl1IyA%3D%3D&trackingId=KLAVMhIbpiX1eeghvGDcGQ%3D%3D,Stage Fraud Data Analyst,Leroy Merlin,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","üîé Chi siamo?

Leroy Merlin fa parte del gruppo internazionale Adeo e ha una missione chiara: aiutare le persone a realizzare i loro progetti di casa e di vita, offrendo soluzioni innovative e ad alto impatto positivo. La nostra strategia √® omnicanale, il nostro focus sono le persone.
Vogliamo costruire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, collaborativo e stimolante, dove il miglioramento continuo √® il motore della crescita personale e professionale.
‚úÖ Formazione e sviluppo: affronterai un percorso strutturato tra attivit√† pratiche on the job e approfondimenti teorici in aula.
‚úÖ Mentorship e supporto: avrai il supporto di tutor aziendali che ti guideranno passo dopo passo, aiutandoti a sviluppare competenze chiave.
‚úÖ Strumenti digitali: ti forniremo PC e smartphone aziendale per lavorare in modo smart e digitale.
‚úÖ Ambiente dinamico e flessibile: dopo la fase di inserimento, potrai accedere alla nostra policy di smart working ibrido, alternando giornate in sede e da remoto.
‚úÖ Mensa aziendale: perch√© anche il benessere passa dal buon cibo!

Sar√† un‚Äôesperienza unica all‚Äôinterno del team Finance, con l‚Äôobiettivo di contribuire attivamente all'analisi dei dati per identificare e prevenire le frodi. Il ruolo offre l‚Äôopportunit√† di lavorare a stretto contatto con Data Scientists e analisti esperti, al fine di acquisire competenze pratiche in un ambiente dinamico e stimolante.
üîπCreazione di reportistica e dashboard automatizzati con tool di data visualization per il monitoraggio del dato (PowerBI e Looker)
üîπSupporto all‚Äôanalisi dei dati per identificare schemi e possibili frodi
üîπSupporto allo sviluppo e implementazione di modelli di rilevamento frodi, e monitoring continuo delle anomalie
üîπCollaborazione con altri dipartimenti per migliorare i processi di prevenzione
üîπOpportunit√† di interagire con le altre Business Units italiane del gruppo ADEO: Bricocenter e Tecnomat
üéì Laurea triennale/magistrale in discipline quantitative (es. Statistica, Matematica, Informatica, Ingegneria Gestionale)
üíªBuona conoscenza di Excel/Gsheet (funzioni principali e tabelle pivot) e PPT/Gslide
üß© Conoscenza e/o interesse per linguaggi di programmazione (SQL) e Power BI/Looker
ü§ñ Conoscenza e/o interesse nell‚Äôutilizzo di tecnologie AI
üåçOttima conoscenza della lingua inglese e/o francese
üéØ Attitudine al problem solving e proattivit√†

üåç Crediamo che la diversit√† sia una risorsa fondamentale per il nostro successo. Accogliamo con favore le candidature di tutte le persone, indipendentemente da genere, et√†, background e abilit√†.
üëâ Inviaci la tua candidatura e inizia il tuo percorso con noi!

4217848552,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/digital-growth-communication-strategist-at-mediaset-4217848552?position=8&pageNum=2&refId=tJCtI%2BbcYxPNWl3sUl1IyA%3D%3D&trackingId=fnusBNLu4GVAjse%2FNCD90Q%3D%3D,Digital Growth & Communication Strategist,Mediaset,"Cologno Monzese, Lombardy, Italy","All‚Äôinterno di Publitalia80, nel team dedicato alla piattaforma digitale Mediaset AdManager, stiamo cercando un/a digital-first marketer con approccio strategico e mindset da growth hacker, capace di guidare le attivit√† di lead generation, ottimizzare il funnel di conversione e monitorare i KPI, integrando comunicazione multicanale e sviluppo di partnership strategiche.
Cosa farai ‚Äì Focus su crescita, dati e attivazione
Pianificare e implementare strategie di lead generation attraverso campagne digitali, inbound marketing, eventi e altre iniziative mirate.
Gestire e monitorare l'intero funnel di conversione, assicurandosi che ogni fase sia ottimizzata per migliorare i tassi di conversione.
Monitorare e analizzare i KPI principali (es. CPL, ROI, conversion rate, CAC) per valutare l'efficacia delle attivit√† di marketing e identificare aree di miglioramento.
Collaborare con il team Sales per assicurare un flusso continuo di opportunit√† qualificate e migliorare la gestione dei contatti.
Sviluppare e coordinare campagne di comunicazione multicanale (offline e online), garantendo coerenza del brand e massimizzando l‚Äôimpatto su diversi touchpoint.
Creare, in collaborazione con agenzie esterne, contenuti di valore (articoli, blog post, video, materiali promozionali, social media) per migliorare il posizionamento dell'azienda.
Gestire la presenza aziendale sui media tradizionali, digitali e social, mantenendo una narrativa forte e coerente.
Lavorare a stretto contatto con agenzie creative, PR e partner media per amplificare la visibilit√† dei messaggi chiave.
Identificare e sviluppare relazioni strategiche con partner chiave (es. fornitori, associazioni, piattaforme) per ampliare le opportunit√† di mercato.
Monitorare il ROI delle partnership e ottimizzare gli accordi per garantire risultati misurabili.
Chi sei ‚Äì Hard skills + digital mindset
Esperienza: 3/5 anni in ruoli analoghi nel digital marketing e/o marketing&communication, preferibilmente in contesti B2B rivolti a SMB
Competenze analitiche: Capacit√† di interpretare dati e KPI per orientare strategie e decisioni.
Capacit√† strategiche: Esperienza nella creazione di piani di marketing cross-mediali e nel posizionamento di brand.

Conoscenza digitale: Padronanza delle piattaforme di marketing automation, strumenti di tracciamento (es. Google Analytics, CRM) e gestione campagne (es. Google Ads, Meta Ads). Conoscena approfondita di CRM quali ad esempio Salesforce, Dynamics sales.
Lingue: Ottima conoscenza della lingua italiana e inglese, Spagnolo nice to have

All‚Äôinterno di Publitalia80, nel team dedicato alla piattaforma digitale Mediaset AdManager, stiamo cercando un/a digital-first marketer con approccio strategico e mindset da growth hacker, capace di guidare le attivit√† di lead generation, ottimizzare il funnel di conversione e monitorare i KPI, integrando comunicazione multicanale e sviluppo di partnership strategiche.


Cosa farai ‚Äì Focus su crescita, dati e attivazione

Lead Generation &
column2:
Funnel Optimization

  • Pianificare e implementare strategie di lead generation attraverso campagne digitali, inbound marketing, eventi e altre iniziative mirate.
  • Gestire e monitorare l'intero funnel di conversione, assicurandosi che ogni fase sia ottimizzata per migliorare i tassi di conversione.
  • Monitorare e analizzare i KPI principali (es. CPL, ROI, conversion rate, CAC) per valutare l'efficacia delle attivit√† di marketing e identificare aree di miglioramento.
  • Collaborare con il team Sales per assicurare un flusso continuo di opportunit√† qualificate e migliorare la gestione dei contatti.


Data-Driven Communication

  • Sviluppare e coordinare campagne di comunicazione multicanale (offline e online), garantendo coerenza del brand e massimizzando l‚Äôimpatto su diversi touchpoint.
  • Creare, in collaborazione con agenzie esterne, contenuti di valore (articoli, blog post, video, materiali promozionali, social media) per migliorare il posizionamento dell'azienda.
  • Gestire la presenza aziendale sui media tradizionali, digitali e social, mantenendo una narrativa forte e coerente.
  • Lavorare a stretto contatto con agenzie creative, PR e partner media per amplificare la visibilit√† dei messaggi chiave.


Strategic Partnerships &
column3:
Ecosystem Growth

  • Identificare e sviluppare relazioni strategiche con partner chiave (es. fornitori, associazioni, piattaforme) per ampliare le opportunit√† di mercato.
  • Monitorare il ROI delle partnership e ottimizzare gli accordi per garantire risultati misurabili.


Chi sei ‚Äì Hard skills + digital mindset

  • Esperienza: 3/5 anni in ruoli analoghi nel digital marketing e/o marketing&
column4:
communication, preferibilmente in contesti B2B rivolti a SMB
  • Competenze analitiche: Capacit√† di interpretare dati e KPI per orientare strategie e decisioni.
  • Capacit√† strategiche: Esperienza nella creazione di piani di marketing cross-mediali e nel posizionamento di brand.
  • Conoscenza digitale: Padronanza delle piattaforme di marketing automation, strumenti di tracciamento (es. Google Analytics, CRM) e gestione campagne (es. Google Ads, Meta Ads). Conoscena approfondita di CRM quali ad esempio Salesforce, Dynamics sales.
  • Lingue: Ottima conoscenza della lingua italiana e inglese, Spagnolo nice to have

4239548692,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/digital-analytics-consultant-intern-milan-at-fifty-five-4239548692?position=5&pageNum=5&refId=547IUzW2rteAK93iperoLg%3D%3D&trackingId=5HsXZz4wvFUXT%2Baxo%2F8Y%2Bg%3D%3D,Digital Analytics Consultant Intern - Milan,fifty-five,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","About The Company

Rapid shifts in technology have dramatically changed the way people interact and engage with brands. fifty-five is a new kind of data company that helps brands leverage data to improve marketing, media, and customer experience through a combination of specialized consultancy and technology services.
As the strategic data pillar of The Brandtech Group, we offer services that combine strategy consulting, cloud services, media consulting and customer experience.

We are made up of over +400 digital experts. Digital consultants, tracking and media specialists, engineers and data scientists all work in close collaboration to provide senior-level marketing consultancy and technical support to our clients, in every type of industry, all around the world.

As a partner to advertisers from data collection to activation and exploitation, we help organizations become truly omnichannel entities that control the efficiency of their digital ecosystem and its synergies with the physical world.
Headquartered in Paris, we operate across 3 time zones from our 10 offices, located in Paris, London, Geneva, Milan, Shanghai, Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Taipei, Singapore and New York.

We are looking for a Digital Analytics Consultant Intern to join our new Milan-based consulting team. This is a varied role which spans across website architecture, UX analysis, media advisory and digital strategy. As a Consultant intern at 55, you will be working on marketing analytics and marketing activations as opposed to setting up and optimising campaigns, so we therefore are seeking applicants with some prior experience in marketing or web analytics.

Working as part of a small, collaborative team, you will play a key role in delivering fifty-five's data-led projects to multiple, big brand clients across industries such as luxury, automotive, retail and beauty. These projects will be driven by client objectives relating to data collection, customer acquisition, onsite conversion optimisation and media-mix optimisation and you will be required to promote a customer-centric vision of digital marketing, based on the systematic and methodical use of data to support decisions.

You will report to the Head of office and work alongside other Consultants and technical experts such as Tracking Specialists, Cloud Engineers and Innovation Experts. Led by the Senior Consultant, you will contribute to the timely & professional delivery of our projects. Examples of the sort of project work you will be part of delivering within the first year of your role include but are not limited to
column2: the creation and monitoring of complex dashboards aimed at aggregating findings from numerous data sources
column3: the evaluation of client's existing marketing channel mix and the recommendation of the most suitable attribution model
column4: the implementation of cookie consent management solutions to obtain users consent for data collection, martech audience review and architecture recommendation. This is an exciting, hands-on role within a company that puts collaboration and knowledge sharing at the heart of everything we do.

column1: Within your first year at fifty-five, you will be taking on the following core tasks and responsibilities, amongst others:
Delivering high quality outcomes for a variety of projects in the Ad Tech and Web Analytics space, working in a client-facing position, supported by a team of technical specialists
Meeting client's requirements within the agreed deadlines, keeping track of the necessary tasks for each project and liaising with the relevant owners internally and externally
column2: foreseeing and escalating issues / risks as appropriate

column1: Developing a sharp, operational expertise regarding web analytics and media-buy topics

Progressing in your journey at fifty-five, you will be given the opportunity to grow in your role through first-hand exposure to multiple disciplines and, if interested, you might be selected to take a specialist path.
Understanding of how clients use digital data in their businesses
Analytical mindset, keen to apply data to challenges
Fluent or native in italian & english are mandatory
Detail oriented, proactive and self-motivated, good organisation is paramount
Curious and eager to learn, able to challenge and recommend solutions to problems
Flexible, versatile and works well under pressure
Collaborative, works well in a team, understands that the sum of our parts is better than the individual
Strong interest in new marketing technologies & the digital industry
Interest in working in a small, growing team
If this sounds like you, please get in touch! We look forward to meeting you.
In return, we are pleased to offer you the following benefits:
Being part of a multicultural, dynamic and fast-growing team
Continuous (and certified) training on the digital ecosystem and technologies (initial training for all new employees, followed by recurring training sessions)
The flexibility to work remotely for part of the week - this will continue post Covid

fifty-five encourages diversity and is committed to guaranteeing equal treatment of all applications, regardless of gender, age, origin, sexual orientation, state of health or political or religious opinion.

Headquartered in Paris, we operate across 3 time zones from our 10 offices, located in Paris, London, Geneva, Milan, Shanghai, Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Taipei, Singapore and New York.

Working as part of a small, collaborative team, you will play a key role in delivering fifty-five's data-led projects to multiple, big brand clients across industries such as luxury, automotive, retail and beauty. These projects will be driven by client objectives relating to data collection, customer acquisition, onsite conversion optimisation and media-mix optimisation and you will be required to promote a customer-centric vision of digital marketing, based on the systematic and methodical use of data to support decisions.

You will report to the Head of office and work alongside other Consultants and technical experts such as Tracking Specialists, Cloud Engineers and Innovation Experts. Led by the Senior Consultant, you will contribute to the timely &

4238757068,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-intern-at-ab-inbev-4238757068?position=8&pageNum=5&refId=547IUzW2rteAK93iperoLg%3D%3D&trackingId=iFk67HCS1HB%2F4RpBMgzpiA%3D%3D,Data Analyst Intern,AB InBev,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Seniority Level:

We are seeking a motivated and curious Data Analyst Intern to join our Operations team and help us build and enhance reporting, dashboards, and analytical tools across our logistics and supply chain operations. You‚Äôll work closely with regional leaders in Commercial, Sales and Logistics to support visibility, identify inefficiencies, and enable data-driven decisions in a dynamic, multinational environment.
Support the design, development, and automation of operational reports and KPIs across countries
Analyze logistics performance data (e.g., transportation, warehousing, order fulfillment)
Create dashboards (Power BI or Excel-based) that provide actionable insights for the operations team
Partner with supply chain, planning, and logistics stakeholders to gather requirements and deliver solutions
Support ad hoc analysis and deep dives into operational bottlenecks or cost drivers
Identify opportunities to streamline data processes and improve data accuracy
Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs student in Engineering, Business Analytics, Statistics, Data Science, or related field
Solid skills in Excel (advanced functions, pivot tables, etc.)
Familiarity with Power BI or other dashboarding tools will help a lot
Basic knowledge of SQL is a big plus
Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate in an international team
Proactive attitude, willingness to learn, and ability to work independently

Seniority Level:

Role Overview

We are seeking a motivated and curious Data Analyst Intern to join our Operations team and help us build and enhance reporting, dashboards, and analytical tools across our logistics and supply chain operations. You‚Äôll work closely with regional leaders in Commercial, Sales and Logistics to support visibility, identify inefficiencies, and enable data-driven decisions in a dynamic, multinational environment.

Key Responsibilities

  • Support the design, development, and automation of operational reports and KPIs across countries
  • Analyze logistics performance data (e.g., transportation, warehousing, order fulfillment)
  • Create dashboards (Power BI or Excel-based) that provide actionable insights for the operations team
  • Partner with supply chain, planning, and logistics stakeholders to gather requirements and deliver solutions
  • Support ad hoc analysis and deep dives into operational bottlenecks or cost drivers
  • Identify opportunities to streamline data processes and improve data accuracy

What We‚Äôre Looking For

  • Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs student in Engineering, Business Analytics, Statistics, Data Science, or related field
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving mindset
  • Solid skills in Excel (advanced functions, pivot tables, etc.)
  • Familiarity with Power BI or other dashboarding tools will help a lot
  • Basic knowledge of SQL is a big plus
  • Strong communication skills and ability to collaborate in an international team
  • Proactive attitude, willingness to learn, and ability to work independently

4233369181,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-bracco-4233369181?position=9&pageNum=5&refId=547IUzW2rteAK93iperoLg%3D%3D&trackingId=rPnm%2BfoiuHVLdnnaFvecig%3D%3D,DATA ANALYST,Bracco,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Bracco is an international Group active in the healthcare sector and a leader in diagnostic imaging. The Group‚Äôs main products are contrast agents sold in over 100 countries, both directly and indirectly through branches, joint ventures and license and distribution agreements.
Are you passionate about leveraging data to drive innovation and impact?
We are looking for a Data Analyst based in Milan. In this role, you'll contribute in shaping data-driven strategies and optimizing operations across our organization.
What is the main purpose of this job?
As Data Analyst, you will join the Transformation & Performance Improvement team.

You'll oversee the development and implementation of data analytics strategies to align with organizational goals. Your expertise in data analysis and visualization will support decision-making processes and continuous improvement initiatives.
You'll be responsible for ensuring data accuracy, identifying trends, and optimizing efficiency through insightful data analysis.
Develop and implement data analytics strategies aligned with organizational goals.
Utilize advanced data analytics tools such as Power BI to create insightful dashboards for effective visualization.
Define key metrics and KPIs to measure business performance and support decision-making processes.
Conduct in-depth analysis of raw data to identify trends, patterns, and outliers.
Collaborate closely with internal teams to enhance data-driven decision-making capabilities.
Provide support to production sites in Italy by understanding their data needs and offering data analysis expertise.
Communicate complex analytical findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders effectively.
Willingness to travel primarily within Italy to provide on-site support to production sites.
Degree in Management Engineering, Statistics, or related field.
Proven experience as Data Analyst with a focus on Power BI usage.
Strong proficiency in Python for data cleaning, data visualization and analysis.
Minimum 3-5 years of work experience, preferably in industrial sectors.
Experience in pharma, chemical or food industry is considered a plus.
Knowledge of Continuous Improvement and Operational Excellence principles is considered a plus.
If you meet the requirements of this opportunity and would like to join an international group working to improve patients' lives, apply now!
At Bracco, we believe in the values of diversity and inclusion. We respect and celebrate the diversity of our people and their experiences, ensuring a fair opportunity for all.

Bracco is an international Group active in the healthcare sector and a leader in diagnostic imaging. The Group‚Äôs main products are contrast agents sold in over 100 countries, both directly and indirectly through branches, joint ventures and license and distribution agreements.

Are you passionate about leveraging data to drive innovation and impact?

We are looking for a Data Analyst based in Milan. In this role, you'll contribute in shaping data-driven strategies and optimizing operations across our organization.


What is the main purpose of this job?

As Data Analyst, you will join the Transformation &
column2:
Performance Improvement team.

You'll oversee the development and implementation of data analytics strategies to align with organizational goals. Your expertise in data analysis and visualization will support decision-making processes and continuous improvement initiatives.

You'll be responsible for ensuring data accuracy, identifying trends, and optimizing efficiency through insightful data analysis.


Responsibilities

  • Develop and implement data analytics strategies aligned with organizational goals.
  • Utilize advanced data analytics tools such as Power BI to create insightful dashboards for effective visualization.
  • Define key metrics and KPIs to measure business performance and support decision-making processes.
  • Conduct in-depth analysis of raw data to identify trends, patterns, and outliers.
  • Collaborate closely with internal teams to enhance data-driven decision-making capabilities.
  • Provide support to production sites in Italy by understanding their data needs and offering data analysis expertise.
  • Communicate complex analytical findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders effectively.


Travel

  • Willingness to travel primarily within Italy to provide on-site support to production sites.


Your Profile

  • Degree in Management Engineering, Statistics, or related field.
  • Proven experience as Data Analyst with a focus on Power BI usage.
  • Strong proficiency in Python for data cleaning, data visualization and analysis.
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
  • Minimum 3-5 years of work experience, preferably in industrial sectors.
  • Experience in pharma, chemical or food industry is considered a plus.
  • Knowledge of Continuous Improvement and Operational Excellence principles is considered a plus.
  • Fluent English and Italian.


If you meet the requirements of this opportunity and would like to join an international group working to improve patients' lives, apply now!

At Bracco, we believe in the values of diversity and inclusion. We respect and celebrate the diversity of our people and their experiences, ensuring a fair opportunity for all.

We are #Bracco #JoinUs

4231818496,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/graduate-program-2025-data-science-analytics-at-nexi-group-4231818496?position=2&pageNum=7&refId=k4hSbUEjEHsw8dKwjEoj1A%3D%3D&trackingId=182LDYnX9y7j8o3RgczMwQ%3D%3D,Graduate Program 2025 - Data Science & Analytics,Nexi Group,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Are you looking to kick off your career journey?
Do you like the idea of joining the European PayTech?
If so, you are at the right place!

Our graduate program offers you the chance to create your unique career path within our diverse international team, operating in more than 25 countries. Rotate among different departments, learn from experienced professionals, and make a difference by working on real business cases.
Our Graduate Program is more than a learning path - it's a journey where you will work on real business cases and have a direct impact on business results.
Permanent position in one of the business departments from the start of your employment.
Two rotations between different business departments during the 12-month program.
Project Management and Communication training path after the first six months.
Continuous learning and skill improvement through structured training sessions at our Digital PayTech University.
Opportunity to develop business ideas, implement them, and build your network of stakeholders within a group of highly skilled business leaders from all over Europe.
Exciting Opportunities in Data Science and Analytics

As part of our Data Science and Analytics team, you will contribute to data-driven decision-making in the Paytech industry. You'll work in positions such as Data Scientist, Data Engineer, and BI Data Engineer.

In this department, you'll analyse large datasets, transform data into insights, develop predictive models, and create data visualisations to support business strategies. This role offers the opportunity to work with cutting-edge tools and technologies, enhancing your analytical skills and significantly impacting our company's success.

As part of our selection process, the top candidates will be invited to participate in an exciting hackathon at our office location. This is a fantastic opportunity to showcase your skills, collaborate with peers, and potentially secure a spot on our team. Stay tuned for more details!
What makes you stand out as the ideal participant for this program?
If you see yourself in the description that follows, you should definitely take the first step and apply!
You have a master's degree in Engineering, STEM or Economics & Business, graduated within the last 12 months or will graduate in 2025.
You are a career starter with no more than one year of working experience.
You are fluent in English and in the local language of the country you are applying for (any additional language is beneficial).

You can easily imagine working in an international environment and actively collaborating with colleagues from all over Europe (if you have study or work-related international experience from abroad, that will be considered a beneficial qualification).
You are committed to your work, have an exciting university career with proven great results, enjoy learning new things, feel confident to own projects by yourself and like being part of a team.
For you, formal training is a starting point - you always look for more and want to make a difference in everything you work on.
Don't miss out on this amazing opportunity. Apply today and discover what's in it for you!
We are committed to creating a diverse culture where talents from all walks of life can feel like they truly belong. By applying to our Graduate Program, you're one step closer to joining us.
We're excited to learn more about you!

Are you looking to kick off your career journey?

Do you like the idea of joining the European PayTech?


If so, you are at the right place!


Our graduate program offers you the chance to create your unique career path within our diverse international team, operating in more than 25 countries. Rotate among different departments, learn from experienced professionals, and make a difference by working on real business cases.


About the program

Our Graduate Program is more than a learning path - it's a journey where you will work on real business cases and have a direct impact on business results.


What can you expect?

  • Permanent position in one of the business departments from the start of your employment.
  • Two rotations between different business departments during the 12-month program.
  • Project Management and Communication training path after the first six months.
  • Continuous learning and skill improvement through structured training sessions at our Digital PayTech University.
  • Opportunity to develop business ideas, implement them, and build your network of stakeholders within a group of highly skilled business leaders from all over Europe.


Exciting Opportunities in Data Science and Analytics

As part of our Data Science and Analytics team, you will contribute to data-driven decision-making in the Paytech industry. You'll work in positions such as Data Scientist, Data Engineer, and BI Data Engineer.


In this department, you'll analyse large datasets, transform data into insights, develop predictive models, and create data visualisations to support business strategies. This role offers the opportunity to work with cutting-edge tools and technologies, enhancing your analytical skills and significantly impacting our company's success.


As part of our selection process, the top candidates will be invited to participate in an exciting hackathon at our office location. This is a fantastic opportunity to showcase your skills, collaborate with peers, and potentially secure a spot on our team. Stay tuned for more details!


What makes you stand out as the ideal participant for this program?

If you see yourself in the description that follows, you should definitely take the first step and apply!

  • You have a master's degree in Engineering, STEM or Economics &
column2:
Business, graduated within the last 12 months or will graduate in 2025.
  • You are a career starter with no more than one year of working experience.
  • You are fluent in English and in the local language of the country you are applying for (any additional language is beneficial).
  • You can easily imagine working in an international environment and actively collaborating with colleagues from all over Europe (if you have study or work-related international experience from abroad, that will be considered a beneficial qualification).
  • You are committed to your work, have an exciting university career with proven great results, enjoy learning new things, feel confident to own projects by yourself and like being part of a team.
  • For you, formal training is a starting point - you always look for more and want to make a difference in everything you work on.


    • Apply Now!

    Don't miss out on this amazing opportunity. Apply today and discover what's in it for you!


    We are committed to creating a diverse culture where talents from all walks of life can feel like they truly belong. By applying to our Graduate Program, you're one step closer to joining us.


    We're excited to learn more about you!

Il nostro cliente √® il leader italiano nel settore assicurativo in ambito sanitario.

La societ√† si distingue per la costruzione di soluzioni assicurative personalizzate che vengono affiancate a moderne e dettagliate tecniche di analisi dati e risk management.
All‚Äôinterno della BU Market Analysis, stiamo ricercando un Data Analyst a diretto riporto dell'UW Lead.

Inserita in un processo di totale revisione dei tool di reportistica, la figura sar√† responsabile della creazione di nuove dashboard e monitoraggio di quelle esistenti (linee di business, prodotti assicurativi, princing, rischio, etc.).
La risorsa collaborer√† quindi con il team Underwriting (UW) e funger√† da punto di contatto con il team IT per tutte le tematiche correlate al mondo Data.

Parallelamente, saranno inoltre necessarie attivit√† di manutenzione periodica delle dashboard esistenti e di analisi ad hoc (nuovi clienti/progetti, mercato, etc.).
Di cosa hai bisogno per avere successo

Ricerchiamo inoltre ottime competenze lato programmazione in SaS e gestione DB, oltre a buona padronanza di Power BI e R (o Python).
Salary package e inquadramento saranno funzione dell‚Äôesperienza effettiva e dei valori di partenza.
Sede di lavoro: Milano centro, con buona flessibilit√† lato smart working.
Se sei interessato a questa opportunit√†, clicca su ""Candidarsi ora"" per inviare una copia aggiornata del tuo CV.
Se questa opportunit√† non √® in linea con le tue aspettative, ma sei alla ricerca di un nuovo lavoro, visita il nostro sito Internet per scoprirne di nuove.

La tua nuova azienda

Parallelamente, saranno inoltre necessarie attivit√† di manutenzione periodica delle dashboard esistenti e di analisi ad hoc (nuovi clienti/progetti, mercato, etc.).

Cosa avrai in cambio


Salary package e inquadramento saranno funzione dell‚Äôesperienza effettiva e dei valori di partenza.

Cosa devi fare ora

4233952543,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/intern-research-data-intelligence-at-colliers-4233952543?position=4&pageNum=7&refId=k4hSbUEjEHsw8dKwjEoj1A%3D%3D&trackingId=uM%2B%2BpNzMWI96jzwtCvCUxg%3D%3D,Intern Research & Data Intelligence,Colliers,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Company Description

At Colliers, we help leaders succeed by helping them build amazing workplaces, businesses, and communities around the world. We do this by thinking differently, sharing innovative ideas, and offering a unique and collaborative workplace where you can succeed.
BE creative. BE the expert. BE a team player. Be all that and more at Colliers International.

Colliers is a listed real estate advisor active in 66 countries with more than 18,000 employees. We contribute to a better society by solving real estate issues and accelerating the sustainability transition in the built environment. In 2025 we will be completely climate neutral.

We connect global market developments and data with the needs of property owners, property investors, and property tenants. This enables us to understand the sector of tomorrow and to provide forward-looking advice. These insights help us add value to all phases of the real estate cycle and build long-lasting customer relationships. We offer creative solutions that are not only attractive today, but also remain relevant and sustainable later on.
In Italy, we work with 170 professionals in an organization where entrepreneurship, expertise, and doing the right thing are important. Together we shape the future of real estate.
Is Data Intelligence & Research your passion? Do you feel ready to analyse the real estate market and macro-economic trends?

The resource in the Data Intelligence & Research Department will have a cross-team role. This is a resource with enthusiasm, a propensity for team working, strong analytical and communication skills, an aptitude for analysis and technology, and good language skills.
As the Intern Data Researcher you will be in charge of:
Cross-support all activities of the research team
Collecting and analysing property market data through the management of datasets
Develop market outputs through the production of market maps and reports
Supporting the data analytics teasm in the automation of database research
Degree in urban planning, economics, statistics, and similar disciplines.
Researching, collecting, reporting and detailing abilities
Native Italian speaker and proficient in English
Familiar with Office Package especially with Excel and Power Point
Availability to travel across the main Italian cities.
