4226946416,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-yuki-4226946416?position=23&pageNum=0&refId=uBzQIyMvvb911aqzyKDxLw%3D%3D&trackingId=dAP9BgboqyIwH1UzEZ%2FFng%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Yuki,"Antwerp, Flemish Region, Belgium","Yuki & The Yuki Way

Hi there, welcome to Yuki! As a vibrant, international IT scale-up, we support accountants, businesses, and entrepreneurs in handling their accounting more efficiently, simply, and enjoyably. And to make that possible? Well, we‚Äôre looking for kick-ass colleagues to complete our ambitious, cheerful, and lively team of top professionals!
Come on, now: that sounds like something for you, right?

Yuki is on a journey to enhance its analytics efforts and transform into a more data-driven organization. Our commitment to this goal has led us to implement a variety of advanced cloud data platforms and reporting tools to enhance our analytics capabilities. While acquiring the right technology is a significant step, the true success of our analytic initiatives depends on having the right people in place. That‚Äôs why we need you! By unlocking the power of our data, you'll help shape business strategies and drive growth, innovation, and success.
Drive Data-Backed Decisions: Partner with product, marketing, sales, and customer success teams to identify key business questions and provide actionable insights.
Product & Customer Analytics: Analyze user behavior and product engagement metrics (activation, retention, churn, expansion) to help shape product strategy and improve user experience.

Report and Dashboard Development: Create and refine reports and dashboards that while remaining user-friendly, aiding the business in making informed decisions. Work in collaboration with stakeholders throughout the company to fully understand their requirements.

Data Delivery: Link and integrate various data sources, such as sales, marketing, product, and finance data, to extract and present new insights. Ensure all reported metrics come from a single source of truth.

Data Landscape Development: Oversee the evolution of our data landscape by mapping data processes and keeping guides up-to-date, ensuring all team members can navigate our evolving data environment efficiently.

Initiative in Systems and Technology Implementation: Take a proactive role in implementing new systems and technologies, ensuring our data strategies remain cutting-edge and align with organizational goals.

For this position, we're looking for someone who isn't afraid to dive deep into data, turning those numbers into actionable insights and identifying trends and anomalies to help us reach our business objectives!
The desire to work on Data and/or Business Analytics.
Analytically strong, this is evident from your experiences.
Experience with complex information systems and reporting environments.
Knowledge of, and experience with, transforming and analyzing data (e.g. in data warehouses with SQL).
Knowledge of and experience with setting up reports and data visualization tools (e.g. Power BI).
Strong communication skills in English, both written and spoken (Dutch is a nice-to-have).
Very Important: What's in It for You
At Yuki, we believe in empowering our team so they can empower our users. Here‚Äôs what we offer:
Competitive Package: A one-year contract with attractive additional benefits such as healthy lunches and lifestyle coaches.
Development Budget: Benefit from a generous training budget available from day one
Flexible Work-Life Balance: Hybrid working is supported - but we also encourage you to come to the office
Plenty of Opportunities: Be part of the global Visma-group in an established enterprise with a scale-up mentality
Cool Events: Participate in numerous events focused on networking, learning, and sports
Be Part of the Yuki Family: Immerse yourself in our diverse, international team (with offices in Rotterdam, Antwerp, and Barcelona)
Atmosphere! For us, it's all about atmosphere, from team building to Friday drinks. Expect a dynamic buzz combined with competitive ping pong!
What Does the Application Process Look Like?
Apply: Apply now! We will contact you as soon as possible.
Get to Know Us: Meet us through our Talent Acquisition Team.
Business Case: Prepare and work on our business case.
Second Interview: Discuss the business case at our office with the CFO and Senior Data Analyst.
Third Interview: Meet our HR Manager
Offer: If we see a match‚Äîyou'll receive an offer!

4183871626,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-data-consultant-at-capco-4183871626?position=29&pageNum=0&refId=uBzQIyMvvb911aqzyKDxLw%3D%3D&trackingId=Ydno9TFDfdsCsp9UGcVGpQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst / Data Consultant,Capco,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Data Analyst / Data consultant
Are you interested in expanding your consulting exposure? Do you want to move away from an operations role and make an impact on the business?
Do you often feel like processes and ways of working could be better or more efficient?
Capco is a global management consultancy specialising in driving transformation across investment banking, securities services, and insurance.
We have the people, the vision, and the passion.

We are going through a significant growth journey, and now is a very good time to join us as we expand geographically, increase headcount and disrupt the consulting market across Central Europa with entrepreneurial and agile thinking.
In your role as a Consultant at Capco, you play a key role in the delivery of projects and gain wider exposure to our wider Investment Banking business.
You will work closely with senior clients to deliver large-scale change initiatives for leading global banks.
Fitting that description, you will also need to be a supremely motivated person and able to work in a team where clients become colleagues too.
We Are Looking For Talent With The Following
Leverage your existing analytical skills and expertise to help clients meet their challenges
Take part in strategic data transformation projects and value creation through use of data
Enable data-driven decisions through advanced analytics, visualisation, quality data and dedicated datasets
Engage data using analytical tools and languages to perform data manipulation and analysis
Be involved with managing, cleansing, abstracting and aggregating data
Support the importance of data processes, data integrity and cleanliness, and the strategic use of data
Work with or act as project manager to scope and analyse the area of analysis
Professional experience of minimum 2 years in a data related position, with a preference for roles within the financial industry or a consultancy firm
Bachelor or Master degree in a relevant field
Excellent analytical, reporting and presentation skills
Good knowledge of SQL, Python and preferably one visualisation tool (Tableau, PowerBI...)
Being able to work and liaise with various stakeholders, ranging from business to technical stakeholders
You are a creative problem solver with a hands-on approach
Fluency in French or Dutch AND excellent knowledge of English
The opportunity to join a growing, thought leading, global team of data professionals

An attractive remuneration package, reflecting your experience, including a company car or a mobility budget, net allowances, end-of-year bonuses, health insurance, a mobile phone and subscription, laptop and meal vouchers

Organised individual learning tracks with access to leading online skills development platforms, to onsite and online teachers and to our global experts. Our learning materials cover all areas of data (Governance, Management, Manipulation, Decision science, Engineering)
A shared objective to achieve a good work-life balance
A flat, non-hierarchical structure that will enable you to work with senior partners and directly with clients

4220082802,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-fsma-4220082802?position=30&pageNum=0&refId=uBzQIyMvvb911aqzyKDxLw%3D%3D&trackingId=gygHT8ammVrmPj%2BDMPzSfA%3D%3D,Data Analyst,FSMA,"Brussels Region, Belgium","Would you like to contribute as a data analyst to better consumer protection and to increasing public trust in the financial sector?
Come and join our FSMA team and become a data analyst at the ‚ÄòData analytics expertise centre‚Äô

The ‚ÄòData analytics expertise centre‚Äô occupies a key role in developing and rolling out data-driven supervision at the FSMA. As a data analyst, you will conduct project-based data analyses, provide advice and support for the implementation of innovative projects in various supervisory areas, and search for new data-driven applications that can support supervision.
You will be working on various innovative projects that help the different supervisory areas work in a data-driven manner.
You will be involved in conducting analyses as part of financial supervision, for which you will make use of external or internal data (MiFIR database, EMIR, textual data etc.).
You will assist the operational supervisory services in developing and implementing risk models and will thereby contribute to a risk-based approach to supervision.
You will search for new applications of data-driven supervision at the FSMA, and to this end will be in contact with various supervisory areas.
WHAT KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS DO YOU BRING?
A Master‚Äôs degree in a highly data-driven field (e.g. master in economics, business engineer, actuarial sciences, applied sciences, statistics or a similar discipline)
column2: a doctorate is an asset.

column1: Preferably several years of professional experience as a data analyst or in the academic world.
Strong data processing skills and practical experience with R and/or Python.
Affinity and experience with Natural Language Processing (NLP) is a plus.
An explicit interest in financial markets and products, as well as in the various new developments in those areas.
Strong adaptability and interpersonal skills. Ability to work on a team and to show initiative.
Strong analytical skills and a capacity for synthesis. Ability to communicate in a logical, structured manner both verbally and in writing.
Goal-orientedness, assertiveness and persuasive powers of argumentation.
Affinity with the tasks in the public interest entrusted to the FSMA.
Solid competence in Dutch and a good knowledge of French and English.
A full-time job with a permanent contract.
The chance to do your bit for consumer protection.

A competitive salary package with many fringe benefits (e.g. group and hospitalization insurance, full reimbursement of the cost of commuting to/from work, budget-friendly company dining room, contribution to your mobile phone and internet subscriptions, additional non-statutory holidays, bank holidays, etc.).
A wide range of opportunities for learning and development.
Good work/life balance (teleworking a few days a week).
Offices within easy reach of Brussels city centre.
Please note that each member of the FSMA staff is subject to a strict code of ethics and is bound by the obligation of professional secrecy.

Would you like to contribute as a data analyst to better consumer protection and to increasing public trust in the financial sector?


Come and join our FSMA team and become a data analyst at the ‚ÄòData analytics expertise centre‚Äô


WHERE WILL YOU BE WORKING?


The ‚ÄòData analytics expertise centre‚Äô occupies a key role in developing and rolling out data-driven supervision at the FSMA. As a data analyst, you will conduct project-based data analyses, provide advice and support for the implementation of innovative projects in various supervisory areas, and search for new data-driven applications that can support supervision.


WHAT WILL YOUR JOB ENTAIL?


  • You will be working on various innovative projects that help the different supervisory areas work in a data-driven manner.
  • You will be involved in conducting analyses as part of financial supervision, for which you will make use of external or internal data (MiFIR database, EMIR, textual data etc.).
  • You will assist the operational supervisory services in developing and implementing risk models and will thereby contribute to a risk-based approach to supervision.
  • You will search for new applications of data-driven supervision at the FSMA, and to this end will be in contact with various supervisory areas.


WHAT KNOWLEDGE, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS DO YOU BRING?


  • A Master‚Äôs degree in a highly data-driven field (e.g. master in economics, business engineer, actuarial sciences, applied sciences, statistics or a similar discipline)
column2:
a doctorate is an asset.
  • Preferably several years of professional experience as a data analyst or in the academic world.
  • Strong data processing skills and practical experience with R and/or Python.
  • Affinity and experience with Natural Language Processing (NLP) is a plus.
  • An explicit interest in financial markets and products, as well as in the various new developments in those areas.
  • Strong adaptability and interpersonal skills. Ability to work on a team and to show initiative.
  • Strong analytical skills and a capacity for synthesis. Ability to communicate in a logical, structured manner both verbally and in writing.

    • WHAT DO WE OFFER YOU?


    • A full-time job with a permanent contract.
    • The chance to do your bit for consumer protection.
    • A competitive salary package with many fringe benefits (e.g. group and hospitalization insurance, full reimbursement of the cost of commuting to/from work, budget-friendly company dining room, contribution to your mobile phone and internet subscriptions, additional non-statutory holidays, bank holidays, etc.).

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

Join Partenamut, Belgium's first free, French-speaking mutual insurance company, and embark on a professional and personal journey where people are at the heart of everything. Here, we are ready to build the mutuality of tomorrow even more attentive and innovative. Every day, we support more than 1.3 million customers in proactively managing their health, but above all, we form a collaborative and supportive team. Your talents and individuality are freely expressed to achieve our common goals.

We believe in human-centred fulfilment, innovation, solidarity and diversity. If you're passionate about innovation and people, if you're prepared to go the extra mile for our customers while remaining whole, and if you like to challenge yourself at work while enjoying your free time, we look forward to meeting you so that together we can build the health and well-being of tomorrow.

As an experienced Data Analyst, you play a pivotal role in advancing our organization's data-driven initiatives by leveraging her/his proven expertise to provide actionable insights and support informed decision-making within business teams.

You support the business with their data requests, and structure findings into low maintenance and easy-to-read listings, tables or charts/dashboarding in line with the information needs of your customers and GDPR regulations.
You analyze data requirements by assessing data availability, quality, comprehension at project start to determine whether data is suitable for the need and how complex it is.
You support the data products owners with the data explorations.

Through a defined collaboration model, you support business in increasing data literacy : data comprehension, best practices for dashboard creation, data story-telling and best practices in data exploration.
You identify ways to increase adoption of the solutions you developed and stakeholder satisfaction.

You play an important role in the future implementation of the data catalogue by validating the accuracy and usefulness of the data. You are equally expected to provide feedback on how to improve the catalog.
You participate in delivery of projects and continuous improvement initiatives as part of cross functional squad.
Your Profile As a Data Analyst
You have a Bachelor or Master in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science or Information Management.‚ÄØ
You have proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst (minimum 5 years).
You have technical expertise regarding data models, database design development and data mining techniques.
You have knowledge and experience with databases (SQL, etc) and reporting packages (Tableau, Power BI etc). Programming in Python is a plus.‚ÄØ
You have strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and present findings, disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.‚ÄØ
You have a strong work ethic and a skillset to juggle several different information requests with ease and composure.‚ÄØ
You are fluent in French and English (verbal & written).
A full-time open-ended contract with flexible working hours and the possibility of remote working up to 3 days a week.
An exciting position with real prospects in a fast-growing company.
In-depth training in the mutual insurance sector on arrival and regular training throughout your career.
An attractive salary with numerous non-statutory benefits that can be adapted to suit your needs.
Up to 46 days of leave per year.
Please note that no application sent by an external consulting agency will be accepted unless the agency has been expressly authorized by Partenamut for this search.
Vous voulez participer au succ√®s de Partenamut ?
Click on ""apply"" to access our online application form.

4237568508,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-analyst-at-cream-consulting-4237568508?position=34&pageNum=0&refId=uBzQIyMvvb911aqzyKDxLw%3D%3D&trackingId=AUZL9YjrmvF6eCPoJOB5PQ%3D%3D,Business Intelligence Analyst,Cream Consulting,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Permanent position only

We could be a Cream Factory, a cooking blog or even a detective agency‚Ä¶but in reality, we are a consulting company in Business & Technology active in large organizations and industry leaders in Banking, Insurance, Telecom, Energy, Pharmaceutical & Transport.
WHAT IS A BUSINESS INTELLIGENCE ANALYST AT CREAM?

As Jean, Business Analyst Business Intelligence, translate the BI needs of the business teams in specifications for the IT department, for both small demands or as part of larger projects (contributions or BI project).
Act as person of contact between Business Engineering Teams and the Development Team
Define the business specifications for BI needs

Participation in (or management of) BI projects, or on the BI tracks of other projects for the engineering activities (requirement definition, impact analysis, process definition), while representing the BI vision (and BI target architecture) that has been defined
Collaboration with data delivery experts to deliver on projects
Understand business requirements and build a functional analysis which covers needs of the business according to our BI reference architecture
HOW DO WE IMAGINE OUR FUTURE CONSULTANT?
You have a Master degree in Computer Sciences or equivalent by experience
You have good knowledge in BI techniques and tools (BO, SAS, Cognos...)
You have a cultural openness and adaptability, you are rigorous, customer oriented, and you have high communication skills and analytical skills
You are polyvalent and can adapt easily to quickly changing environment
You are capable to think out of the box and maintain in the meantime a pragmatic approach
You are able to work with autonomy while being also a great team player
You are fluent in French and English
column2: a good knowledge of Dutch is also required

THE LITTLE THING THAT CAN MAKE THE DIFFERENCE,

Description:

  • Create and manage BI and analytics solutions that turn data into knowledge and translate business needs to technical specifications

  • Create tools to store data (e.g. OLAP cubes)
  • Conduct unit testing and troubleshooting
  • Evaluate and improve existing BI systems
  • Collaborate with teams to integrate systems
  • Develop and execute database queries and conduct analyses
  • Create visualizations and reports for requested projects
  • Develop and update technical documentation


Profile:

  • Proven experience as a BI Developer or Data Scientist
  • Industry experience is preferred
  • Background in data warehouse design (e.g. dimensional modeling) and data mining
  • In-depth understanding of database management systems, online analytical processing (OLAP) and ETL (Extract, transform, load) framework
  • Familiarity with BI technologies (e.g. Microsoft Power BI, Oracle BI)
  • Knowledge of SQL queries, SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) and SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)
  • Proven abilities to take initiative and be innovative
  • Analytical mind with a problem-solving aptitude
  • BSc/BA in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant

4165278033,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-analytics-lead-at-semetis-4165278033?position=40&pageNum=0&refId=uBzQIyMvvb911aqzyKDxLw%3D%3D&trackingId=xP7f9goJ%2Fvp7tcfyTXEOJw%3D%3D,Business Intelligence & Analytics Lead,Semetis,Brussels Metropolitan Area,"üìÑ Type: Full-time | üìä Experience: Mid-Senior (4-7 years experience)

At Semetis, we turn data into business growth. We are looking for a Business Intelligence & Analytics Lead to bridge the gap between raw data, marketing intelligence, and strategic decision-making. You will be at the heart of our strategic department, ensuring insights drive real marketing and business impact.
Translate complex data into actionable insights for marketing and business decisions.
Scope and optimize analytics, measurement, and dashboarding projects for top clients.
Work closely with consultants and leadership to define and refine key business KPIs.
Ensure data quality, build meaningful reports, and provide strategic recommendations.
Coach and train teams, fostering a strong data-driven culture at Semetis.
4-7 years experience in analytics, data insights, measurement, or BI.
Expertise in web analytics (GA4, Adobe Analytics, Piwik Pro) and dashboarding (Looker, Power BI, Tableau).
Understanding of business KPIs, ensuring analytics drive marketing and revenue growth.
Strong autonomy and ownership, able to take initiative and drive projects forward.
Some SQL knowledge (or willingness to learn) and familiarity with cloud solutions (Google Cloud, AWS, Azure).
Critical thinker, able to assess what analytics services should and shouldn‚Äôt be offered.

At Semetis, we do more than analyse data‚Äîwe turn it into a competitive advantage. As Belgium‚Äôs leading digital agency, we are known for our expertise, innovation, and strong market presence. We are on a mission to push the boundaries of marketing intelligence, shaping the way brands make data-driven decisions.

This is a role with real business impact. You will work closely with leadership, ensuring that analytics isn‚Äôt just a reporting tool but a driver of strategic growth. We operate in a fast-moving, entrepreneurial environment where bold ideas, innovation, and experimentation are encouraged. Unlike traditional agencies, Semetis fosters a culture of autonomy, giving you the space to take ownership and make a tangible difference.
If you are passionate about turning analytics into actionable business impact, we would love to hear from you.
Full job description & application details here.
Ready to make an impact? Let‚Äôs talk.

4233360682,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-data-analyst-at-dataroots-a-talan-company-4233360682?position=41&pageNum=0&refId=uBzQIyMvvb911aqzyKDxLw%3D%3D&trackingId=buTYo7p3IrsPSLf8Ixtidg%3D%3D,Junior Data Analyst,"dataroots, a Talan company",Louvain Metropolitan Area,"ü§ñ The Job

As a Junior Data Analyst at Dataroots, you'll embark on a journey to become a key player in a team bridging the gap between business and data teams. Under the guidance of experienced data consultants, you'll gain hands-on experience in translating business needs into tangible data and AI-driven solutions. You'll learn to gather business requirements from clients, identify and assess the necessary data, and build or collaborate to build and deploy effective data solutions.

During a training period, we'll equip you with the skills you need to become a proficient Data Analyst. You'll learn to embrace a role that will extend beyond technical expertise as you translate complex outcomes into business impact, presenting results to stakeholders in clear and understandable terms. Along the way, you'll contribute to developing the right capabilities and governance structures within organisations, ensuring that data solutions deliver sustainable long-term value.
Assist clients in bridging the gap between business and data teams
Help translate business needs into concrete data and AI-driven requirements
Gather business requirements from clients and identify relevant data sources
Build and deploy effective data models
Crunch the numbers, deep dive into the data, spot opportunities, understand what is going on to support the decision making
Translate technical outcomes into business impact and present results to stakeholders
Contribute to developing data governance frameworks and capabilities within organisations
üéâ What you can expect at Dataroots?

Dataroots, a vibrant and dynamic data consulting company founded in 2016, stands out with its unique expertise in the data realm. We are committed to nurturing a culture that prioritises team well-being, diversity, knowledge sharing, and outstanding customer experiences, which has fuelled our sustained and robust growth. As a Data Analyst at Dataroots, you'll be an essential part of our mission, playing a key role in developing and implementing data-driven solutions for our clients.
You have worked for 1,5 - 2 years in the data field in a professional setting.
You are excited about the potential of data, AI, and digital to solve real-world problems.
You have either a business degree and a technical affinity or a technical degree and a business affinity.
You are curious and possess a healthy dose of drive and ambition.
You have a good overview of the (big-)data ecosystem and know how different components fit in a data engineering or machine learning solution.
You have a first experience (+-1,5-2 years) with data visualisation tools like PowerBI or Tableau, as well as programming languages such as SQL, Python, and/or dbt, in a work project.
You understand how to collect and identify business requirements and translate these into functional requirements and acceptance criteria.
You are developing your technical ability and soft skills to align both technical and business stakeholders and drive change.
You have a can-do attitude, you take ownership of the project to ensure timely delivery & scalable solution through strong project management capabilities.
You know how to build storylines and translate complex solutions into clear & understandable content and context and you are constantly developing your skills in this area.
You speak English fluently and either Dutch or French.
Competitive salary package with benefits including a company car & fuel card or mobility budget, hospitalisation insurance, group insurance, high-end laptop, and smartphone.
Personal & team training budget for continuous professional development.
Innovation budget for involvement in exciting open-source projects.
Team Buildings, gatherings, and sports initiatives to foster team spirit.

4238222842,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/csrd-analyst-data-analyst-at-acensi-4238222842?position=43&pageNum=0&refId=uBzQIyMvvb911aqzyKDxLw%3D%3D&trackingId=jpaVi8XfboVz51WYXF94ew%3D%3D,CSRD Analyst - Data Analyst,ACENSI,Brussels Metropolitan Area,"ACENSI is looking for a CSRD Analyst for one of their client based in Brussels :
Our client is part of the 1st wave of the implementation of the Corporate Sustainability Reporting Directive (CSRD) and the company published it‚Äôs first CSRD-compliant report in March 2025.
In 2025 the Sustainability reporting team is focusing on improving and stabilizing the reporting processes, governance and data quality.

As part of this team, the consultant will support the Group Sustainability reporting manager in autonomously leading three key streams. The consultant will work closely with stakeholders from various business departments (Finance, Controlling, HR, Sustainability, Infrastructure, Asset Management, IT), with the external auditors and with the external consultants that act as advisors.
- The consultant will be part of the Group Sustainability reporting team, under the coordination of the project manager and the project lead
- The consultant will have a Group transversal role, acting as a connector across the two main entities of the company.
1. PM and ESRS data technical expert for the digital stream :
Support the IT/data team in modelling the data in accordance with the quantitative datapoints from Environment (E1, E4, E5) , Social (S1, S2) and Governance (G1)
Contribute to definition of standard operating procedures and related documentation
Together with the project team, drive consensus on proposed solutions across business and IT
Ensure full compliance with the ESRS guidance when the data engineers are modelling the data in the data pipelines
Remain up to date with the ESRS simplification coming from the Omnibus that can impact the data modelling
Stakeholders engagement: ensure that all the interested parties and consulted/informed and kept updated with the progress of the stream
column2: discover synergies with other ongoing digital initiatives

column1: Collaborate with the auditors in the context of the limited assurance activities
2. Drive the connectivity project and Taxonomy improvements :
Enhance and create new internal documentation for the Taxonomy methodology of retrieving Turnover/CAPEX/OPEX
Lead implementation and create a Group-wide methodology for retrieving CAPEX/OPEX linked to sustainability actions (MDR-A from ESRS2) across E1, E4, E5 and S1, S2
Lead implementation and create a Group-wide methodology for the phased-in disclosure requirements related to anticipated financial effects (For example, E1-9).
3. Lead improvements for governance-related matters for the 2025 audit :
In collaboration mode with the Group Risk Management team and other stakeholders create a uniform inventory of (ESG) Group policies
Support the Group-wide implementation of a due diligence process
Direct experience and knowledge of ESG reporting frameworks such as ESRS. GRI, SASB, TCFD
Good knowledge of French and Dutch, fluency in English. German is a plus
Previous experience with external (ESG or financial) assurance (experience in a consultancy company is preferred)
Previous experience with implementing digital/IT projects, specifically for ESG is a plus
A Master degree, preferably in the fields of finance, environmental science, engineering, economics, sustainability management or similar
Analytical and problem-solving skills and ability to process data, analyze information, think critically
Detail-oriented with excellent organizational and project management/ time management skills to handle reporting requirements
Excellent communication skills and the ability to convey complex sustainability information effectively
Reliable, well organised, analytical and result driven with high standards or ethics and professionalism
Collaborative team player, but also with high levels of autonomy and accountability for your own work
A genuine passion for sustainability and a desire to drive positive change.
Location: Brussels, with occasionally travel to Berlin
Important: if the consultant will work in Belgium, for non-EU candidates, please present candidates who comply with the following criteria:
Possess a work permit allowing the individual to work in Belgium.
Hold a valid residence permit confirming the right of residence in Belgium.

4237572867,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-governance-analyst-at-euroclear-4237572867?position=46&pageNum=0&refId=uBzQIyMvvb911aqzyKDxLw%3D%3D&trackingId=EIdmqTdhUP6gRuR5z7F3Rg%3D%3D,Data Governance Analyst,Euroclear,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Job Opportunity: Security Analyst ‚Äì Data Governance Tribe (CISO Division)
Location: Brussels, Belgium | Hybrid Work model 8 days per month in the office

At Euroclear, we power the world‚Äôs financial markets by delivering secure, efficient, and reliable infrastructure. Security is not just a function here‚Äîit‚Äôs embedded in everything we do. As part of our dedication to safeguarding critical financial services, we‚Äôre looking for a Security Analyst to join our Data Protection Governance team within the CISO (Cyber Information Security Office) Division.

As a Security Analyst in the Data Governance Tribe, you will help shape and carry out our cybersecurity standards, contribute to developing new security policies, and ensure our data protection systems are resilient, inclusive, and future-ready. You‚Äôll collaborate closely with internal Audit, Risk, and Business units to maintain a safe and secure digital ecosystem.

We believe in teams with varied strengths and value outstanding perspectives. This role is open to candidates from all backgrounds who are passionate about cybersecurity and eager to make a tangible impact.
Provide expert analysis and support for security architecture, operations, and controls
Evaluate and improve data protection technologies and governance frameworks
Conduct risk assessments and participate in investigations, forensic analysis, and incident responses
Design and implement security monitoring solutions and data loss prevention strategies
Collaborate across teams to ensure flawless integration of security into new technologies and projects
Support the evolution of cloud and email security solutions
We‚Äôre looking for a blend of skills and experience. If you have some or all of the following, we‚Äôd love to hear from you:
Solid understanding of infrastructure or application security domains
Experience with Microsoft 365, Exchange Online, SharePoint, Teams, OneDrive, Intune, Azure Information Protection, or similar tools
Knowledge of McAfee ePO, endpoint protection, secure email gateways, CASB/DLP tools, and SIEM solutions
Technical knowledge in networking, system administration (Windows, Active Directory), and vulnerability assessment
Comfort with scripting or programming (PowerShell, Python, SQL, etc.)
Familiarity with standards like CISM, CISSP, ISO/IEC 27001/02, SOX, NIST, GDPR
Critical thinking and analytical mindset with a solution-oriented approach
Good communication skills‚Äîable to tailor messages to both technical and non-technical audiences
A collaborative spirit‚Äîable to work across cultures, disciplines, and geographies
A passion for continuous learning and adapting in a fast-paced environment
Drive, curiosity, and a hands-on mentality
Flexibility: We support work-life balance through hybrid work models and adaptable schedules.
Purposeful: Join a team that plays a crucial role in protecting the global financial ecosystem.
Growth: We offer continuous learning opportunities and clear paths for career advancement.
Are you ready to help shape the future of digital trust and security at Euroclear? Apply now and bring your whole self to work

Embark on your new adventure at Euroclear, and work at the heart of the global capital markets. We connect over 2,000 financial institutions across the globe. As an open and resilient infrastructure, we contribute to the stability of the financial markets. We help clients cut through complexity, lower costs, and mitigate risks of financial transactions. At Euroclear, we have the clear ambition to use our key role to facilitate and accelerate a sustainable global financial system.
Work closely with inspiring, supportive and engaged colleagues from more than 80 different countries.
Practice your talents in a highly professional international environment.
Join a learning and development environment with an emphasis on knowledge sharing and training.
Find your own optimal balance within our hybrid working model, where you can connect at the office and also benefit from remote working.
Great Place to Work for All

We are committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates diversity and strives to be a Great Place to Work for All. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment, regardless of any aspect that makes them unique (including race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, pregnancy, disability, ‚Ä¶). If you need any specific accommodation due to disability or any other reason, you can let the recruiter know during your application process.

As a global critical financial infrastructure, the protection of Euroclear information and assets is fundamental to the companys‚Äô business. Security is at the core of our services, firmly embedded in the management systems and processes of the company. You will be joining our Chief Information Security Office (CISO) in charge of putting in place the required controls to adequately and effectively protect our information assets.

Job Opportunity: Security Analyst ‚Äì Data Governance Tribe (CISO Division)

Location: Brussels, Belgium | Hybrid Work model 8 days per month in the office


Who We Are


At Euroclear, we power the world‚Äôs financial markets by delivering secure, efficient, and reliable infrastructure. Security is not just a function here‚Äîit‚Äôs embedded in everything we do. As part of our dedication to safeguarding critical financial services, we‚Äôre looking for a Security Analyst to join our Data Protection Governance team within the CISO (Cyber Information Security Office) Division.


About the Role


As a Security Analyst in the Data Governance Tribe, you will help shape and carry out our cybersecurity standards, contribute to developing new security policies, and ensure our data protection systems are resilient, inclusive, and future-ready. You‚Äôll collaborate closely with internal Audit, Risk, and Business units to maintain a safe and secure digital ecosystem.


We believe in teams with varied strengths and value outstanding perspectives. This role is open to candidates from all backgrounds who are passionate about cybersecurity and eager to make a tangible impact.


Your Mission


In this role, you will:


  • Provide expert analysis and support for security architecture, operations, and controls
  • Evaluate and improve data protection technologies and governance frameworks
  • Conduct risk assessments and participate in investigations, forensic analysis, and incident responses
  • Design and implement security monitoring solutions and data loss prevention strategies
  • Collaborate across teams to ensure flawless integration of security into new technologies and projects
  • Support the evolution of cloud and email security solutions

What You Bring


We‚Äôre looking for a blend of skills and experience. If you have some or all of the following, we‚Äôd love to hear from you:


  • Solid understanding of infrastructure or application security domains
  • Experience with Microsoft 365, Exchange Online, SharePoint, Teams, OneDrive, Intune, Azure Information Protection, or similar tools
  • Knowledge of McAfee ePO, endpoint protection, secure email gateways, CASB/DLP tools, and SIEM solutions
  • Technical knowledge in networking, system administration (Windows, Active Directory), and vulnerability assessment
  • Comfort with scripting or programming (PowerShell, Python, SQL, etc.)
  • Familiarity with standards like CISM, CISSP, ISO/IEC 27001/02, SOX, NIST, GDPR

Your Superpowers


  • Critical thinking and analytical mindset with a solution-oriented approach
  • Good communication skills‚Äîable to tailor messages to both technical and non-technical audiences
  • A collaborative spirit‚Äîable to work across cultures, disciplines, and geographies
  • A passion for continuous learning and adapting in a fast-paced environment
  • Drive, curiosity, and a hands-on mentality

Why Join Us?


  • Flexibility: We support work-life balance through hybrid work models and adaptable schedules.
  • Purposeful: Join a team that plays a crucial role in protecting the global financial ecosystem.
  • Growth: We offer continuous learning opportunities and clear paths for career advancement.

Your Next Step


Are you ready to help shape the future of digital trust and security at Euroclear? Apply now and bring your whole self to work


Why join us


Embark on your new adventure at Euroclear, and work at the heart of the global capital markets. We connect over 2,000 financial institutions across the globe. As an open and resilient infrastructure, we contribute to the stability of the financial markets. We help clients cut through complexity, lower costs, and mitigate risks of financial transactions. At Euroclear, we have the clear ambition to use our key role to facilitate and accelerate a sustainable global financial system.


What We Offer


  • Work closely with inspiring, supportive and engaged colleagues from more than 80 different countries.
  • Practice your talents in a highly professional international environment.
  • Join a learning and development environment with an emphasis on knowledge sharing and training.
  • Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits.

New ways of working


Find your own optimal balance within our hybrid working model, where you can connect at the office and also benefit from remote working.


Great Place to Work for All


We are committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates diversity and strives to be a Great Place to Work for All. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment, regardless of any aspect that makes them unique (including race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, pregnancy, disability, ‚Ä¶). If you need any specific accommodation due to disability or any other reason, you can let the recruiter know during your application process.


About the team


As a global critical financial infrastructure, the protection of Euroclear information and assets is fundamental to the companys‚Äô business. Security is at the core of our services, firmly embedded in the management systems and processes of the company. You will be joining our Chief Information Security Office (CISO) in charge of putting in place the required controls to adequately and effectively protect our information assets.

Opzetten van Power BI dashboards om datakwaliteit te monitoren
Samenwerken met stakeholders en verschillende teams rond data kwaliteit en dataplatformen

Identificeren van oorzaken van datakwaliteitsproblemen en implementeren van oplossingen.
Op de hoogte blijven van de nieuwste technologie√´n en best practices binnen data-analyse en datakwaliteit

Je bent communicatief sterk en gewend om met business stakeholders samen te werken

Je hebt een sterke kennis van SQL

4236560004,https://www.linkedin.com/jobs/view/bi-data-analyst-for-an-ecommerce-company-363-at-remotivate-4236560004?position=48&pageNum=0&refId=uBzQIyMvvb911aqzyKDxLw%3D%3D&trackingId=H4uhSTFVT4wy6IXDkqkwGA%3D%3D,BI Data Analyst for an Ecommerce Company [363],Remotivate,European Union,"About the Company:

The CGK Linens is a fast-growing e-commerce company selling across Amazon and other platforms. They thrive in a fast-paced, results-driven environment where data is at the heart of their decision-making. As they scale, they‚Äôre looking for a sharp and proactive BI Data Analyst to lead their data operations and elevate their business intelligence capabilities.

We are seeking a highly analytical and communicative BI Data Analyst with hands-on experience working with Amazon Seller Central data. You will play a critical role in shaping the company‚Äôs data strategy and reporting infrastructure. This is a high-impact role where you‚Äôll bridge technical and non-technical teams, ensuring data is clean, accurate, and actionable.
This is a Full-Time remote role.
We are looking for a BI Data Analyst specifically with these requirements:
3+ years of experience in a BI/Data Analyst or similar role
Experience with Amazon Seller Central data is a strong plus
Proficiency in SQL, Google Sheets/Excel, and data visualization tools (Power BI or Tableau)
Experience working with APIs, ETL pipelines, and data integration tools
Excellent communication skills ‚Äì able to explain complex data to non-technical stakeholders
Comfortable working in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment
Highly organized with strong attention to detail
Your responsibility will include (but not limited to):
Owning and managing the company‚Äôs end-to-end data analytics efforts
Cleaning, structuring, and maintaining data from Amazon and other platforms
Building dashboards and creating insightful visualizations in Tableau or Power BI
Translating business needs into technical requirements and data-driven solutions
Collaborating with cross-functional teams ‚Äì including marketing, operations, and finance
Ensuring data accuracy and consistency across reporting
Identifying trends and patterns to uncover growth opportunities
Proactively recommending actionable insights that drive results
Be part of a company that values autonomy, ownership, and results
Opportunity to shape and lead the BI strategy in a fast-growing company
Work alongside a strategic, cross-functional team
This Position Is Perfect For You If‚Ä¶
You thrive on structuring and analyzing data.
You enjoy working with complex datasets, especially from platforms like Amazon Seller Central, and take pride in cleaning, organizing, and transforming raw data into meaningful insights.
You‚Äôre skilled at building clear, actionable dashboards using tools like Power BI or Tableau, helping teams make informed decisions at a glance.
You take ownership of your work, double-check your outputs, and are always thinking ahead, identifying opportunities, fixing data gaps, and suggesting better ways to report.
Our hiring process is made up of four parts, so please be aware that you will need to dedicate time for a questionnaire, a video, and two 1-on-1 interviews.
Thank you for taking the time to consider this position. I look forward to hearing from you soon

About the Company:

The CGK Linens is a fast-growing e-commerce company selling across Amazon and other platforms. They thrive in a fast-paced, results-driven environment where data is at the heart of their decision-making. As they scale, they‚Äôre looking for a sharp and proactive BI Data Analyst to lead their data operations and elevate their business intelligence capabilities.


About the Role:

We are seeking a highly analytical and communicative BI Data Analyst with hands-on experience working with Amazon Seller Central data. You will play a critical role in shaping the company‚Äôs data strategy and reporting infrastructure. This is a high-impact role where you‚Äôll bridge technical and non-technical teams, ensuring data is clean, accurate, and actionable.

This is a Full-Time remote role.


We are looking for a BI Data Analyst specifically with these requirements:

  • 3+ years of experience in a BI/Data Analyst or similar role
  • Experience with Amazon Seller Central data is a strong plus
  • Proficiency in SQL, Google Sheets/Excel, and data visualization tools (Power BI or Tableau)
  • Experience working with APIs, ETL pipelines, and data integration tools
  • Excellent communication skills ‚Äì able to explain complex data to non-technical stakeholders
  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment
  • Highly organized with strong attention to detail


Your responsibility will include (but not limited to):

  • Owning and managing the company‚Äôs end-to-end data analytics efforts
  • Cleaning, structuring, and maintaining data from Amazon and other platforms
  • Building dashboards and creating insightful visualizations in Tableau or Power BI
  • Translating business needs into technical requirements and data-driven solutions
  • Collaborating with cross-functional teams ‚Äì including marketing, operations, and finance
  • Ensuring data accuracy and consistency across reporting
  • Identifying trends and patterns to uncover growth opportunities
  • Proactively recommending actionable insights that drive results


Growth Opportunities/Perks:

  • Location-independent role ‚Äì work from anywhere
  • Be part of a company that values autonomy, ownership, and results
  • Opportunity to shape and lead the BI strategy in a fast-growing company
  • Work alongside a strategic, cross-functional team


This Position Is Perfect For You If‚Ä¶


You thrive on structuring and analyzing data.

You enjoy working with complex datasets, especially from platforms like Amazon Seller Central, and take pride in cleaning, organizing, and transforming raw data into meaningful insights.


You're a visual storyteller.

You‚Äôre skilled at building clear, actionable dashboards using tools like Power BI or Tableau, helping teams make informed decisions at a glance.


You‚Äôre proactive and detail-oriented.

You take ownership of your work, double-check your outputs, and are always thinking ahead, identifying opportunities, fixing data gaps, and suggesting better ways to report.



Our hiring process is made up of four parts, so please be aware that you will need to dedicate time for a questionnaire, a video, and two 1-on-1 interviews.


Thank you for taking the time to consider this position. I look forward to hearing from you soon

4223481194,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-reporting-analyst-at-recurv-4223481194?position=50&pageNum=0&refId=uBzQIyMvvb911aqzyKDxLw%3D%3D&trackingId=TO1JdusWEUQC0%2FtqRMKvSQ%3D%3D,Data Reporting Analyst,recurv,Brussels Metropolitan Area,"Freelance Opportunity: Data Reporting Specialist

Are you passionate about transforming data into insights that drive real business decisions? We‚Äôre looking for a data-savvy professional with strong Qlik experience to help shape the future of reporting and analytics in an evolving environment. You‚Äôll collaborate across departments, build meaningful dashboards, and contribute to smarter decision-making at every level of the organization.
Develop insightful dashboards and reports using Qlik tailored to business priorities.
Translate stakeholder input into structured data solutions and reporting frameworks.
Validate data outputs to ensure quality, reliability, and user trust.
Guide users in the adoption and value of reporting products.
Document your work to ensure transparency and consistency across the BI landscape.
Apply ITIL and SDLC concepts in a pragmatic, real-world manner.
Hands-on experience with Qlik (Sense, View or equivalent).
Strong communication skills‚Äîcomfortable working with both business and technical stakeholders.
Fluent in English, with a solid command of Dutch or French.
Structured yet flexible, with the ability to work on multiple initiatives in a dynamic setting.
Enthusiastic, self-driven, and not afraid to take initiative.
Be part of a broader transformation toward a data-driven way of working
Contribute directly to how data supports decision-making across teams
Work in a forward-thinking environment that values initiative and learning
Enjoy a mix of structure and flexibility in your day-to-day tasks
See the tangible impact of your work through visible results
Collaborate closely with both business and IT stakeholders
Benefit from growth opportunities in a supportive and evolving context

Freelance Opportunity: Data Reporting Specialist


Are you passionate about transforming data into insights that drive real business decisions? We‚Äôre looking for a data-savvy professional with strong Qlik experience to help shape the future of reporting and analytics in an evolving environment. You‚Äôll collaborate across departments, build meaningful dashboards, and contribute to smarter decision-making at every level of the organization.


Your Role:

  • Develop insightful dashboards and reports using Qlik tailored to business priorities.
  • Translate stakeholder input into structured data solutions and reporting frameworks.
  • Validate data outputs to ensure quality, reliability, and user trust.
  • Guide users in the adoption and value of reporting products.
  • Document your work to ensure transparency and consistency across the BI landscape.
  • Apply ITIL and SDLC concepts in a pragmatic, real-world manner.


Your Profile:

  • Hands-on experience with Qlik (Sense, View or equivalent).
  • Strong communication skills‚Äîcomfortable working with both business and technical stakeholders.
  • Fluent in English, with a solid command of Dutch or French.
  • Structured yet flexible, with the ability to work on multiple initiatives in a dynamic setting.
  • Enthusiastic, self-driven, and not afraid to take initiative.


For you:

  • Be part of a broader transformation toward a data-driven way of working
  • Contribute directly to how data supports decision-making across teams
  • Work in a forward-thinking environment that values initiative and learning
  • Enjoy a mix of structure and flexibility in your day-to-day tasks
  • See the tangible impact of your work through visible results
  • Collaborate closely with both business and IT stakeholders
  • Benefit from growth opportunities in a supportive and evolving context


Interested? buna@recurv.be

4226657199,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-reporting-analyst-at-bakker-partners-4226657199?position=52&pageNum=0&refId=uBzQIyMvvb911aqzyKDxLw%3D%3D&trackingId=b65e6YkjA80hV0qZJM5C7A%3D%3D,Business Reporting Analyst,Bakker & Partners,"Zaventem, Flemish Region, Belgium","For our client, a renowned international company based in the Zaventem / Diegem region, we are currently looking for a Business Reporting Analyst.

The Business reporting analyst supports the finance department as well as the senior management and management team, by structuring the business information related to the different business processes throughout the organization. He/she has the objective to coordinate and structure the different data streams to present the information in a logical, transparent, well defined and efficient way. The performance controller has accountability for the reporting environment and in this sense has to make a proper analysis of the environment and make recommendations for improvements and implement them.

She/he is responsible for the management reporting set-up within the controlling department and supports the financial reporting process from a corporate point of view in terms of providing the right data sets needed to fulfill the corporate requirements
The business reporting analyst is keen on searching to optimize the reporting process in terms of preparation and availability/access to it.
Transforming the available information streams into usable business steering information by means of transparent, structured and easy to understand management reporting

Set-up of specific standard reports in a logic presentation and including description of reporting and definition of variables, starting with a clear analysis of the reporting needs and considering corporate reporting requirements
Search for synergies within the department to streamline information delivery, optimize the reporting processes to avoid possible errors.

Assist in defining and describing the different fields used within reporting and setting up a KPI library in a structured and well-defined way. By doing this, supporting the data quality process and assuring that correct data usage is embedded within the department and organization
You hold a University degree in Economics, Finance or Management.
You have at least 5 years of hands-on experience in business analysis, data analysis or corporate reporting.
Experience with Power BI, SAP BPC and/or SAS are assets.
You feel comfortable in complex and fast paced international environment.
You have experience in analyzing information needs of the business/finance and translation them in useful and fancy reporting.
You can handle situations that require analytical thinking, interpretation and judgment to continuously optimize solutions.
You are IT-savvy and are an experienced user of reporting tools.
You have strong planning & organization skills.
You are stress resistant and are able to meet tight deadlines.

Our client offers a challenging and exciting role that will allow you to make your mark. You will get the opportunity to join an ambitious company that enjoys a solid reputation in its market. The context is one of finance and business transformation, allowing people with a sense of initiative to have a real impact on the business.

For our client, a renowned international company based in the Zaventem / Diegem region, we are currently looking for a Business Reporting Analyst.


Role


The Business reporting analyst supports the finance department as well as the senior management and management team, by structuring the business information related to the different business processes throughout the organization. He/she has the objective to coordinate and structure the different data streams to present the information in a logical, transparent, well defined and efficient way. The performance controller has accountability for the reporting environment and in this sense has to make a proper analysis of the environment and make recommendations for improvements and implement them.



Key responsibilities


  • She/he is responsible for the management reporting set-up within the controlling department and supports the financial reporting process from a corporate point of view in terms of providing the right data sets needed to fulfill the corporate requirements
  • The business reporting analyst is keen on searching to optimize the reporting process in terms of preparation and availability/access to it.
  • Transforming the available information streams into usable business steering information by means of transparent, structured and easy to understand management reporting
  • Set-up of specific standard reports in a logic presentation and including description of reporting and definition of variables, starting with a clear analysis of the reporting needs and considering corporate reporting requirements
  • Search for synergies within the department to streamline information delivery, optimize the reporting processes to avoid possible errors.
  • Assist in defining and describing the different fields used within reporting and setting up a KPI library in a structured and well-defined way. By doing this, supporting the data quality process and assuring that correct data usage is embedded within the department and organization



Requirements for the role


  • You hold a University degree in Economics, Finance or Management.
  • You have at least 5 years of hands-on experience in business analysis, data analysis or corporate reporting.
  • Experience with Power BI, SAP BPC and/or SAS are assets.
  • You feel comfortable in complex and fast paced international environment.
  • You have experience in analyzing information needs of the business/finance and translation them in useful and fancy reporting.
  • You can handle situations that require analytical thinking, interpretation and judgment to continuously optimize solutions.
  • You are IT-savvy and are an experienced user of reporting tools.
  • You have strong planning &
column2:
organization skills.
  • You are stress resistant and are able to meet tight deadlines.



    • Offer


    Our client offers a challenging and exciting role that will allow you to make your mark. You will get the opportunity to join an ambitious company that enjoys a solid reputation in its market. The context is one of finance and business transformation, allowing people with a sense of initiative to have a real impact on the business.

4237573861,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-data-analyst-at-iogp-europe-4237573861?position=53&pageNum=0&refId=uBzQIyMvvb911aqzyKDxLw%3D%3D&trackingId=vZUKC%2BElGAu6BrgM72oBVw%3D%3D,Junior Data Analyst,IOGP Europe,Brussels Metropolitan Area,"IOGP Europe is recruiting a person who is currently pursuing or has recently completed a degree in data science, statistics, environmental studies or a related field who is highly motivated and interested in the energy industry.
This person will work closely with the all teams to analyze and visualize data, helping to make it more impactful while identifying underlying trends and patterns.
Support policy, outreach and communication teams with relevant data to support advocacy towards external stakeholders.
Analyze and visualize data to identify trends and patterns.
Collect and organize datasets from reliable industry, governmental and EU/international institutional (Eurostat, IEA, OECD, World Bank etc.) sources.
Collaborate with team members to ensure data accuracy and relevance.
Prepare and format sections of the annual statistical report.
Monitor emerging trends in energy production, imports, and emissions.
Coordinate with the IOGP Secretariat in London to ensure alignment in data analysis
Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in Data Science, Statistics, Environmental Studies, Energy Engineering, or a related field.
Languages: Fluent in English. Knowledge of other European languages is an asset.
Proficient in data analysis tools such as Excel, Python, or similar software.
Knowledge of data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) is a plus.
Strong research and analytical skills with attention to detail.
Interest in energy and environmental topics, including oil and gas, CCS, hydrogen, and GHG emissions.
Ability to communicate findings effectively in written and verbal formats.
Analytical and quantitative skills, including strong skills in data processing.
Interaction with IOGP Europe member companies and organizations
CIP allowance of ‚Ç¨1,700 per month + a social advantages: ticket restaurant, Mobib monthly subscription pass, telephone plan, laptop, free access to fitness room in the office
Very enjoyable international and young team ambience
If you think that you want be part of this passionate and friendly team, please send your resume with a cover letter to show your motivations to: recruitment-europe@iogp.org by 6th June 2025.

IOGP Europe is recruiting a person who is currently pursuing or has recently completed a degree in data science, statistics, environmental studies or a related field who is highly motivated and interested in the energy industry.


This person will work closely with the all teams to analyze and visualize data, helping to make it more impactful while identifying underlying trends and patterns.


Key responsibilities mix:

  • Support policy, outreach and communication teams with relevant data to support advocacy towards external stakeholders.
  • Analyze and visualize data to identify trends and patterns.
  • Collect and organize datasets from reliable industry, governmental and EU/international institutional (Eurostat, IEA, OECD, World Bank etc.) sources.
  • Collaborate with team members to ensure data accuracy and relevance.
  • Prepare and format sections of the annual statistical report.
  • Monitor emerging trends in energy production, imports, and emissions.
  • Coordinate with the IOGP Secretariat in London to ensure alignment in data analysis


Qualifications:

  • Currently pursuing or recently completed a degree in Data Science, Statistics, Environmental Studies, Energy Engineering, or a related field.
  • Languages: Fluent in English. Knowledge of other European languages is an asset.
  • Skills:
  • Proficient in data analysis tools such as Excel, Python, or similar software.
  • Knowledge of data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) is a plus.
  • Strong research and analytical skills with attention to detail.
  • Interest in energy and environmental topics, including oil and gas, CCS, hydrogen, and GHG emissions.
  • Ability to communicate findings effectively in written and verbal formats.
  • Analytical and quantitative skills, including strong skills in data processing.
column2:
What we offer

  • Experience in EU-oriented advocacy work
  • Interaction with IOGP Europe member companies and organizations
  • Room for initiative and growth
  • CIP allowance of ‚Ç¨1,700 per month + a social advantages: ticket restaurant, Mobib monthly subscription pass, telephone plan, laptop, free access to fitness room in the office
column3: • Very enjoyable international and young team ambience

Je werkt nauw samen met verschillende business stakeholders om een correcte maandafsluiting te garanderen, voert ad-hocanalyses uit en beheert tools voor prestatiemanagement.

Samenwerken met andere analisten ter ondersteuning van meerdere verkoopkanalen
Deelnemen aan projecten die de brug slaan tussen business en IT
2 tot 3 jaar ervaring in data-analyse met tools zoals Qlik, Power BI, Tableau of gelijkaardig
Sterk analytisch denkvermogen en oog voor detail
Ervaring met sales- of commissiedata is een pluspunt

Functieomschrijving / Rol:

We zijn op zoek naar een Data Analyst ‚Äì Sales Performance Management binnen de Customer Operations Steering Tribe. In deze rol ondersteun je het beheer en de optimalisatie van commissiesystemen voor zowel interne als externe verkoopspartners. Je werkt nauw samen met verschillende business stakeholders om een correcte maandafsluiting te garanderen, voert ad-hocanalyses uit en beheert tools voor prestatiemanagement.


Verantwoordelijkheden:

  • Onderhouden en verbeteren van systemen voor commissiecalculatie op basis van sales- en HR-data
  • Uitvoeren van maandelijkse afsluitingen en zorgen voor een correcte gegevensoverdracht naar HR en Fusion
  • Ondersteunen van business stakeholders bij vragen over commissieplannen
  • Uitvoeren van ad-hocanalyses en testen van datastromen
  • Werken met de Varicent-tool voor prestatiemanagement binnen sales
  • Samenwerken met andere analisten ter ondersteuning van meerdere verkoopkanalen
  • Deelnemen aan projecten die de brug slaan tussen business en IT


Vereisten &
column2:
Kwalificaties:

  • 2 tot 3 jaar ervaring in data-analyse met tools zoals Qlik, Power BI, Tableau of gelijkaardig
  • Sterk analytisch denkvermogen en oog voor detail
  • Ervaring met sales- of commissiedata is een pluspunt
  • Vloeiend in het Nederlands en Engels


Vereiste vaardigheden:

  • Data-analyse en rapportering (Qlik, Power BI, Tableau, ‚Ä¶)
  • SQL en datamodellering
  • Sterke communicatieve en interpersoonlijke vaardigheden
  • Vermogen om nauw samen te werken met business stakeholders
  • Kritisch denkvermogen en gestructureerde probleemoplossing


Aanvullende troeven:

  • Ervaring met Varicent of gelijkaardige tools voor prestatiebeheer binnen sales
  • Vaardig in het maken van presentaties en PowerPoint
  • Ervaring binnen telecom of vergelijkbare sectoren
  • Ervaring met coaching of mentoring

Devoteam is a leading consulting firm focused on digital transformation. We help our clients leverage technology to achieve their business goals.

Our¬†longstanding partnerships with leaders like AWS, Google Cloud, Microsoft, and ServiceNow¬†amplify our capabilities, allowing us to deliver top-tier expertise and award-winning services. We complement these partnerships with in-depth Cyber, Data & AI, Software development and multi cloud expertise.¬†
For¬†30 years, we have always been guiding our customers on the next tech wave. Devoteam has guided organizations through the Internet and cloud. The next revolution? AI.
With¬†11,000 tech natives working in 25+ countries, we bring you highly skilled IT experts across Europe
At Devoteam,¬†tech is in our DNA, and it‚Äôs the people we empower with tech. Now, with responsible AI, we‚Äôre ready to unlock a future where technology drives positive change.
If you like these keywords, you‚Äôll love this role:

Dreaming about exploring the data understanding how the business works? Do you enjoy telling a story around data? Do you enjoy figuring out how to calculate the needed KPI? We are currently looking for an Azure Data Analyst who can support our customers by telling a story around data by creating reports and dashboards.

Do you have experience with Power BI or with a similar reporting tool? Are you also interested in supporting our Azure Data Engineer team computing the right data set? Are you attracted by new technologies and new methodologies? You‚Äôre a good candidate to be our future colleague!

As an Azure Data Analyst, you will be a crucial part of our key projects for our data solutions. You will be in front of the customer understanding their need, creating the correct report and guiding our Azure Data Engineer to prepare properly the needed data.
For this position, we‚Äôre looking for all seniority levels.¬†
[Must-have] Hands-on experience with Power BI, SQL Server Reporting Services or Tableau
[Must-have] Hands-on experience with MS SQL querying language (T-SQL)
[Must-have] Hands-on experience modeling a datawarehouse/datamart in Star Schema
[Must-have] Knowledge about modeling techniques like data vault, Merise/3NF
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience creating Azure resources for a data cloud solution.
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience building data pipeline with some Azure data tools (Azure Data Factory, Synapse, Azure Data Lake‚Ä¶)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with the DataBricks environment (Delta Live Table, Workflows, SQL Warehouse)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with MS SQL Server suite (SSIS, SSAS)
[Nice-to-have] Hands-on experience with Python and PySpark
[Nice-to-have] You‚Äôre ready to drive change and bring creative tech ideas to life.
[Nice-to-have] You‚Äôre either proficient in Dutch or French (or you want to learn) and fluent in English.
[Bonus-points] Azure certified (or willing to obtain). Certifications in scope: PL-300, DP-203

If you do not feel fully confident that you meet the requirements above, please don‚Äôt worry. Just apply. Together we‚Äôll discover what you can bring to the table, in which role you would fit best and how you could potentially grow at Devoteam.
As a digital native you will have a positive impact at top organizations in Belgium.
Direct access to the Microsoft organization and programs thanks to our global partnership.
Prepare to inspire and be inspired by other Devoteamers in tech communities.
We enable local and international collaboration and exchange with other tech leaders and specialists, knowledge sharing, peer-to-peer coaching.
A personalized career plan with training offers in soft- & hard skills and certifications aligned to your needs & expertise.
Our servant leadership supports opportunities to grow your personal brand through blogs, keynote sessions, and more.
#techies in our minds, #creatives in our hearts, #change in our DNA.

Cutting-edge Technology: Embrace the latest advancements in IT and digital technologies as we constantly innovate to stay ahead of the competition. Our commitment to adopting state-of-the-art tools and methodologies ensures that you'll work on projects at the forefront of the industry.

Entrepreneur mindset: We value our people over processes. You will develop and grow in an agile and ambitious company where it‚Äôs okay to take risks, make mistakes and change plans to find transformative solutions. At the same time, you will learn from the best, building relationships and skills that will last your entire career.

Endless Learning Opportunities: We value personal and professional growth. Through workshops, conferences, and certifications, we offer the resources needed to expand your skill set and reach new heights in your career.
Connect with amazing people: You will become part of a network of +10,000 Devoteamers spread over 20 countries.

Collaborative Culture: Teamwork is at the heart of our organisation. You'll be working side by side with a diverse group of IT experts who share your passion for excellence and will inspire you to think outside the box.

Impactful Projects: Tackle real-world challenges that matter! From revolutionising business processes to developing innovative solutions, you'll have the chance to make a genuine and positive impact on our clients and the community.
Work-Life Balance: We believe in a healthy work-life balance, ensuring that you have time to unwind, pursue your hobbies, and spend quality time with loved ones.

Inspiring and eco-friendly workplace: We just moved to an amazing new building. We believe an inspiring workspace fuels creativity and fosters a positive work culture, allowing our employees to reach their full potential. The Wings building is also designed with eco-friendly features and energy-efficient systems. By reducing our ecological footprint, we are contributing to a greener future and aligning our business practices with our environmental values. The building is also very easily accessible by public transportation.¬†

Competitive package: We offer a competitive salary package with additional benefits like a company car, smartphone, medical insurance, pension plan, net allowance, laptop, meal vouchers, etc. We review our salary grid twice a year to ensure we are in line with the market.
At Devoteam, we combine strong values ‚Äì respect, frankness, ambition, entrepreneurship & collaboration - with a fun environment that empowers you to innovate and succeed.
>>> Does all this sound compelling to you? Go for it and click that apply button!
