4111248361,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-clinical-data-analyst-be-at-cluepoints-4111248361?position=58&pageNum=0&refId=uBzQIyMvvb911aqzyKDxLw%3D%3D&trackingId=ipvkjAJEdPu3JPHBvyT7gQ%3D%3D,Junior Clinical Data Analyst (BE),CluePoints,"Louvain-la-Neuve, Walloon Region, Belgium","CluePoints is an innovative, fast-growing company and the premier provider of Risk-Based Monitoring and Data Quality Oversight solutions to clinical research organizations. Our products enable both risk planning and operational risk monitoring, and utilize advanced statistical algorithms to determine the quality of clinical trial data both during and following study execution. CluePoints is seeking outstanding candidates with strong data analytics aptitude and a passion for delivery excellence, to help drive customer success and broad adoption of the CluePoints solution.
Perform the technical configuration of the CluePoints solution for clinical studies based on customer requirements
Perform analyses using the CluePoints Central Monitoring Platform ‚Äì diagnosing and explaining anomalies identified in the clinical study data
Summarize findings and support the communication of results to customers (both written report and oral presentation)
Participate in the continuous improvement and development of our product solutions and operational processes
Provide consultation and related operational support to customers as needed, with the help of more senior Data Analysts and/or the CluePoints Project Lead
Ensure that appropriate documentation is produced and maintained for each study
Assist Business Development and Quality Assurance teams in responding to client questions and requests (e.g., RFP responses, audits, etc.)
College degree, preferably in a scientific or technical discipline
0-2 years of experience in a clinical research environment.
Experience with one or more programming languages (preferably SAS)
At least one first experience in clinical trials (data management or CRA)
Aptitude for mathematical and statistical concepts
Excellent English oral and written communication skills
Experience and ability to work well in a team environment
Ability to thrive in a fast-moving environment, under time and resource constraints
High degree of accuracy and attention to detail
Experience with CDISC databases is a plus
Top Reasons to Work with Us
Flexibility is part of our DNA
Hybrid role (2-3 days per week at the office)
Our offices provide a fun atmosphere: PS4, foosball, and our newly added dartboard
Many activities are organized during the year such as team lunches, happy hours, team buildings, holiday parties and many other celebrations!

At CluePoints, learning, training and personal growth are part of the game: you‚Äôll have access to online training materials, certifications sponsored by the company, personal growth plans, and career paths to explore new opportunities.
You‚Äôll work with a fast-growing, multi-disciplinary and international team representing over 20 different nationalities, in an English-speaking working environment.
You‚Äôll have a challenging and rewarding job in an ambitious and fast-paced technology scale-up that has received many national and international awards.
Last but not least, we offer competitive salary and benefits !

CluePoints is an innovative, fast-growing company and the premier provider of Risk-Based Monitoring and Data Quality Oversight solutions to clinical research organizations. Our products enable both risk planning and operational risk monitoring, and utilize advanced statistical algorithms to determine the quality of clinical trial data both during and following study execution. CluePoints is seeking outstanding candidates with strong data analytics aptitude and a passion for delivery excellence, to help drive customer success and broad adoption of the CluePoints solution.


Responsibilities:

  • Perform the technical configuration of the CluePoints solution for clinical studies based on customer requirements
  • Perform analyses using the CluePoints Central Monitoring Platform ‚Äì diagnosing and explaining anomalies identified in the clinical study data
  • Summarize findings and support the communication of results to customers (both written report and oral presentation)
  • Participate in the continuous improvement and development of our product solutions and operational processes
  • Provide consultation and related operational support to customers as needed, with the help of more senior Data Analysts and/or the CluePoints Project Lead
  • Ensure that appropriate documentation is produced and maintained for each study
  • Assist Business Development and Quality Assurance teams in responding to client questions and requests (e.g., RFP responses, audits, etc.)


Qualifications:

  • College degree, preferably in a scientific or technical discipline
  • 0-2 years of experience in a clinical research environment.
  • Experience with one or more programming languages (preferably SAS)
  • At least one first experience in clinical trials (data management or CRA)
  • Aptitude for mathematical and statistical concepts
  • Excellent English oral and written communication skills
  • Experience and ability to work well in a team environment
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-moving environment, under time and resource constraints
  • High degree of accuracy and attention to detail
  • Experience with CDISC databases is a plus





Top Reasons to Work with Us

Flexibility is part of our DNA

  • Hybrid role (2-3 days per week at the office)
  • Our offices provide a fun atmosphere: PS4, foosball, and our newly added dartboard
  • Many activities are organized during the year such as team lunches, happy hours, team buildings, holiday parties and many other celebrations!
  • At CluePoints, learning, training and personal growth are part of the game: you‚Äôll have access to online training materials, certifications sponsored by the company, personal growth plans, and career paths to explore new opportunities.
  • You‚Äôll work with a fast-growing, multi-disciplinary and international team representing over 20 different nationalities, in an English-speaking working environment.
  • You‚Äôll have a challenging and rewarding job in an ambitious and fast-paced technology scale-up that has received many national and international awards.
  • Last but not least, we offer competitive salary and benefits !

Key Skills: Data analysis | Business intelligence | SQL | Snowflake | Tableau | Data visualization | Documentation | Stakeholder collaboration |
Gather and document both functional and non-functional business requirements from stakeholders.
Assist with managing the feature backlog.
Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure alignment on data needs and project objectives.

Support the validation and testing of Tableau or Microsoft Power BI dashboards and visualizations to ensure they meet design standards and requirements. Collaborate with the BI team to refine data presentations for better usability and clarity.
2-3 years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a similar field.
Basic proficiency in Snowflake and SQL for querying and exploring data.
Familiarity with Tableau or other BI tools for dashboard creation and data visualization.
Strong attention to detail, excellent documentation skills, and a willingness to learn.
Good communication skills and the ability to work effectively in a team.

Senior Data Analyst


Location: Europe (Remote)

Contract: 6 months +

Start: ASAP

Key Skills: Data analysis | Business intelligence | SQL | Snowflake | Tableau | Data visualization | Documentation | Stakeholder collaboration |


Responsibilities:


  • Gather and document both functional and non-functional business requirements from stakeholders.
  • Assist with managing the feature backlog.
  • Create and maintain data models.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to ensure alignment on data needs and project objectives.
  • Support the validation and testing of Tableau or Microsoft Power BI dashboards and visualizations to ensure they meet design standards and requirements. Collaborate with the BI team to refine data presentations for better usability and clarity.


Requirements


  • 2-3 years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a similar field.
  • Basic proficiency in Snowflake and SQL for querying and exploring data.
  • Familiarity with Tableau or other BI tools for dashboard creation and data visualization.
  • Strong attention to detail, excellent documentation skills, and a willingness to learn.
  • Good communication skills and the ability to work effectively in a team.

Then we have exciting opportunities for you!

We are looking for multiple freelance professionals for different projects. Your personal passion, interests and experience will be decisive in setting the right accents and determining your personal journey.
Have experience in one or more of the following: data modelling, data warehousing, databases, ETL/ELT. Experience in data warehouse automation is considered as a plus.

Knowledge of advanced data analysis tools and programming languages such as Python, R, SQL, or Microsoft Azure services such as Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Databricks, and Azure Blob Storage.
You can turn the organisation's data into impactful reporting and clear insights that provide interpretation and lead to business process improvements.
Creating data mappings, implementing standards, clean up data and implementing reference datasets.

Deep experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data, as well as a deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and the ability to translate this into business implications for our clients.
Bachelor's or Master‚Äôs degree in computer science, Computer Engineering, Business engineering, business management or equivalent experience (5+ years).
Dutch or French speaking with a strong knowledge of English.
You are located in Belgium & able to work on-site/remote depending on the client‚Äôs needs.
You will work at a variety of large enterprises depending on your interest and your preferred way of working. At Brainbridge we cover the IT landscape from A to Z.

Brainbridge IT Staffing, part of Brainbridge Workforce Solutions, provides flexible IT Staffing solutions. Our goal is to be the highest rated talent sourcing partner for every client and professional. Throughout the years we built long lasting relationships where we made a difference. We are specialized in freelance IT talent: from juniors with minimal work experience to senior experts with highly specific IT expertise.
Is your passion IT? Are you dynamic, result driven and have you a ‚Äúcan do‚Äù attitude? Join our Brainbridge success story and support our growth with your enthusiasm!
Looking forward to welcome you to the world of Brainbridge!

  • Creating data mappings, implementing standards, clean up data and implementing reference datasets.
  • Deep experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data, as well as a deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and the ability to translate this into business implications for our clients.


Your Requirements:


  • Bachelor's or Master‚Äôs degree in computer science, Computer Engineering, Business engineering, business management or equivalent experience (5+ years).
  • Dutch or French speaking with a strong knowledge of English.

4235865730,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/senior-data-analyst-at-schneider-electric-4235865730?position=4&pageNum=2&refId=XTj7OieJ279rQr0uCXBNeg%3D%3D&trackingId=qY1ixrBQCO5jElHA6RzvPA%3D%3D,Senior Data Analyst,Schneider Electric,"Ukkel, Brussels Region, Belgium","üìçLocation: Brussels or Hoofddorp.

Are you passionate about transforming data into strategic insights? We're looking for a¬†Senior Data Analyst / Pricing Analyst¬†to join our BeNe cluster and play a pivotal role in shaping data-driven decisions across the business. As a key link between raw data and business strategy, you'll ensure continuity and readiness for the future by delivering insights that matter. Your visualizations and analyses will directly influence pricing strategies and operational decisions.
Analyze, clean, and manage large datasets from multiple sources.
Design and implement pricing tools and processes.
Conduct gap analyses between local and global data sources.
Build and maintain data models, databases, and reporting systems.
Deliver actionable insights through trend and anomaly detection.
Recommend improvements to data systems and processes.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align data solutions with business needs.
Ensure data governance and alignment with the Unify framework.
Standardize data requirements in collaboration with Data Officers and Consumers.
Support the SE Data Intelligence Portal and ensure data accuracy.
Create and manage dashboards, reports, and analytical tools independently.
3+ years of experience in data analytics and Tableau, ideally in pricing.
Languages: fluent in English, French or Dutch is a plus.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Economics, Statistics, Marketing, or a related field.
Advanced skills in Tableau, Excel, PowerPoint, and SQL.
Strong analytical mindset and attention to detail.
Ability to manage multiple priorities and work cross-functionally.
Experience with database management and data warehousing is a plus.
Familiarity with ETL tools like Amazon Glue is a plus.
You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled.
Looking to make an IMPACT with your career?

When you are thinking about joining a new team, culture matters. At Schneider Electric, our values and behaviors are the foundation for creating a great culture to support business success. We believe that our¬† IMPACT values - Inclusion, Mastery, Purpose, Action, Curiosity, Teamwork - starts with us.

IMPACT is also your invitation to join Schneider Electric where you can contribute to turning sustainability ambition into actions, no matter what role you play. It is a call to connect your career with the ambition of achieving a more resilient, efficient, and sustainable world.
We are looking for IMPACT Makers

4234421319,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analysis-modelling-internship-at-entso-e-4234421319?position=5&pageNum=2&refId=XTj7OieJ279rQr0uCXBNeg%3D%3D&trackingId=hbpXwcp8IM2FYL2DNqvCvQ%3D%3D,Data Analysis & Modelling Internship,ENTSO-E,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","About ENTSO-E

ENTSO-E is the European Network of Transmission System Operators for Electricity. We coordinate the cross-border system operations, system development and electricity market activities of the 40 electricity transmission system operators (TSOs) which cover 36 countries. The ENTSO-E Secretariat in Brussels provides support on technical, market and policy developments for all European TSOs in their cooperation with each other, in their joint fulfilment of their legal mandates, and in the intensive interactions with EU decision-makers, regulatory agencies, associations representing network users and other stakeholders.

If you are interested in having an active role in the energy transition, you should consider joining ENTSO-E. We are a dynamic European association working on important and exciting projects of the electricity sector with the commitment to support the efforts towards a carbon-neutral power system. At ENTSO-E, you will contribute to building the world‚Äôs largest integrated electricity market ‚Äì impacting not only those in the energy sector but also Europe‚Äôs overall economy, today and in the future!

We are looking for a motivated student with engineering and power systems background to join the Flexibility team of the Market and Operations Section of ENTSO-E. The intern will enhance and apply her/his knowledge by contributing to the Probabilistic Risk Assessment, performing contingency assessment on power system models. This is a great opportunity for a student interested in developing technical skills as well as project management and collaborative competencies.
Preferred starting date is September 2025, for a duration of 6 months.
The successful candidate is expected to:
Contribute to the analysis and simulation of power system models.
Analyse and interpret simulation results, in collaboration with ENTSO-E experts.
Support the team in developing reports based on the collected data and analysis.
Contribute in meetings and discussions with insights and recommendations based on the analysis of simulation results.
Specific responsibilities may be finetuned together with the student.
The ideal candidate should have the following:
Studying towards a university degree in Electrical Engineering, Power Systems, applied physics or a related field.
Genuine interest on technical matters and innovative skills.
Previous experience in the energy sector (e.g. previous internships) and/ or demonstrated interest in the energy sector, would be considered an asset.
Be familiar with Python, Power Factory and/or PSSE and power system modelling.
Ability to organize own work and establish priorities.
Excellent writing and presentation skills in English.
Be eligible to reside in EU (meaning EU citizen or valid residence card).
Be a full-time student. The internship must be issued by your university as part of your studies.
Have a personal (also provided by university) health insurance valid for Belgium during the period of the internship.
Be able to sign an internship agreement with the university.
Agree on exact length of the internship and schedule (full time or part time).
We offer an internship position fully integrated in our team where the student will have the opportunity to:
Enhance technical skills and apply them in truly exciting projects.
Contribute to building the world‚Äôs largest integrated electricity market ‚Äì impacting not only those in the energy sector but also Europe‚Äôs overall economy, today and in the future.
Gain valuable experience in a truly multi-cultural environment, with colleagues from over 33 different nationalities.
Build and expand their professional network.
Receive to 700‚Ç¨ / month cost reimbursement for living & commuting expenses.
Please submit your application on the ENTSO-E career website, consisting of your curriculum vitae and a cover letter written in English before 2 June 2025.
ENTSO-E is an equal opportunities employer and does not discriminate on the grounds of age, disability, marital status, gender, sexual orientation, race, religion or political beliefs.

About ENTSO-E

ENTSO-E is the European Network of Transmission System Operators for Electricity. We coordinate the cross-border system operations, system development and electricity market activities of the 40 electricity transmission system operators (TSOs) which cover 36 countries. The ENTSO-E Secretariat in Brussels provides support on technical, market and policy developments for all European TSOs in their cooperation with each other, in their joint fulfilment of their legal mandates, and in the intensive interactions with EU decision-makers, regulatory agencies, associations representing network users and other stakeholders.


If you are interested in having an active role in the energy transition, you should consider joining ENTSO-E. We are a dynamic European association working on important and exciting projects of the electricity sector with the commitment to support the efforts towards a carbon-neutral power system. At ENTSO-E, you will contribute to building the world‚Äôs largest integrated electricity market ‚Äì impacting not only those in the energy sector but also Europe‚Äôs overall economy, today and in the future!


Job description

We are looking for a motivated student with engineering and power systems background to join the Flexibility team of the Market and Operations Section of ENTSO-E. The intern will enhance and apply her/his knowledge by contributing to the Probabilistic Risk Assessment, performing contingency assessment on power system models. This is a great opportunity for a student interested in developing technical skills as well as project management and collaborative competencies.


Preferred starting date is September 2025, for a duration of 6 months.


Key objectives of the internship:

The successful candidate is expected to:

  • Contribute to the analysis and simulation of power system models.
  • Analyse and interpret simulation results, in collaboration with ENTSO-E experts.
  • Support the team in developing reports based on the collected data and analysis.
  • Contribute in meetings and discussions with insights and recommendations based on the analysis of simulation results.


Specific responsibilities may be finetuned together with the student.


Your profile

The ideal candidate should have the following:

  • Studying towards a university degree in Electrical Engineering, Power Systems, applied physics or a related field.
  • Genuine interest on technical matters and innovative skills.
  • Previous experience in the energy sector (e.g. previous internships) and/ or demonstrated interest in the energy sector, would be considered an asset.
  • Be familiar with Python, Power Factory and/or PSSE and power system modelling.
  • Ability to organize own work and establish priorities.
  • Excellent writing and presentation skills in English.


Requirements

The candidate should:

  • Be eligible to reside in EU (meaning EU citizen or valid residence card).
  • Be a full-time student. The internship must be issued by your university as part of your studies.
  • Have a personal (also provided by university) health insurance valid for Belgium during the period of the internship.
  • Be able to sign an internship agreement with the university.
  • Agree on exact length of the internship and schedule (full time or part time).


Our offer

We offer an internship position fully integrated in our team where the student will have the opportunity to:

  • Enhance technical skills and apply them in truly exciting projects.
  • Contribute to building the world‚Äôs largest integrated electricity market ‚Äì impacting not only those in the energy sector but also Europe‚Äôs overall economy, today and in the future.
  • Gain valuable experience in a truly multi-cultural environment, with colleagues from over 33 different nationalities.
  • Build and expand their professional network.
  • Receive to 700‚Ç¨ / month cost reimbursement for living &
column2:
commuting expenses.


Application process

Please submit your application on the ENTSO-E career website, consisting of your curriculum vitae and a cover letter written in English before 2 June 2025.


ENTSO-E is an equal opportunities employer and does not discriminate on the grounds of age, disability, marital status, gender, sexual orientation, race, religion or political beliefs.

Sopra Steria offers tailored, end-to-end corporate technology and software solutions to help clients make bold choices and deliver results. Successfully so! With more than 56.000 colleagues in 30 countries, we rank as Europe‚Äôs leading digital solutions provider. As a PowerBI consultant, you will help our clients solve complex BI issues. You collect data from different sources,build sustainble datamodels, optimize datasets for reporting and develop user-friendly PowerBI dashboards. Based on your own expertise and the Sopra Steria BI methodology, you increase the quality of reporting and visualization at our customers. In addition, your input will contribute to the vision and development of our Data Visualization team.

Understanding data is important. With the Sopra Steria solution for Data visualization, we help organizations do just that. We do this by visualizing information and data. We make abstract information accessible and understandable. Based on the right insights, we can then make data driven decisions about next actions Microsoft technologies such as PowerBI, Fabric, Azure, ... hold no secrets for us.

Within our Data Visualization team we want to help each other and keep learning from each other. We do this by working closely together within the team. So are you looking for new challenges with great colleagues and a steep learning curve? Then the Data Visualization team at Sorpa Steria is the right place for you.

We‚Äôre seeking passionate colleagues who are eager to push the boundaries in digital transformation and technology consulting. At Sopra Steria, you‚Äôll have the opportunity to grow your skills in a constructive, collaborative team environment, working on impactful projects that drive change for our clients. If you thrive on challenge and meet (most of) the qualifications below, we look forward to your application!
You‚Äôll have knowledge and experience of the following:
You have at least 3 year of experience with data visualization and can demonstrate this with a demo or portfolio
You have at least 3 year demonstrable experience with PowerBI
You have experience with performance tuning of PowerBI solutions
You dare to be creative, but do not lose sight of the details
Knowledge of best practices and visual design principles
You act as an expert and coach people
You communicate fluently, both with your colleagues and the customer
A good knowledge of data modeling and dimensional modeling concepts..
Knowledge of HTML/CSS and programming languages such as javascript, python, C# is also a plus
Adding your dashboards or portfolio in the application is a plus
Knowledge of exernal tools like Tabular editor are a plus
You are proficient in English, knowledge of Dutch and/or French is a plus

As a member of one of Europe‚Äôs largest digital solutions providers, you‚Äôll benefit from extensive career development opportunities, both local and international. At the Sopra Steria Academy, you‚Äôll be part of a dynamic network of 56,000 professionals at all stages of their careers. With a wide array of offices to explore, you can find your ideal location and take the next step in your career.

You‚Äôll become a part of a major Tech player in Europe recognised for its consulting, digital services, and software development. On top of that, you‚Äôll join our Data & AI team, where we‚ÄØsupport enterprises‚ÄØand institutions to become more data driven, and assist our‚ÄØclients to increase business efficiency‚ÄØand create‚ÄØimpact with‚ÄØdata. We offer‚ÄØa complete‚ÄØportfolio of Services and Solutions to unburden‚ÄØorganisations in every step‚ÄØof their‚ÄØtransition: from defining‚ÄØand executing‚ÄØthe data strategy‚ÄØand governance, over setting up data platforms, to visualizing dashboards‚ÄØand applying‚ÄØthe latest‚ÄØdata science and artificial‚ÄØintelligence methodologies. ‚ÄØ

Our employees are known for making bold choices and delivering results. Work among high-level professionals at the forefront of corporate software solutions and innovation at Europe‚Äôs Leading Digital Service Provider.
We offer a generous employee benefits package that includes:
A variety of perks, such as mobility options (including a company car), insurance coverage, meal vouchers, eco-cheques, and more.
Continuous learning opportunities through the Sopra Steria Academy to support your career development.
The opportunity to connect with fellow Sopra Steria colleagues at various team events.

Stuur je cv en korte motivatie naar luc@bimona.be of solliciteer via LinkedIn.

4223540080,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/young-graduate-business-analyst-data-analytics-team-at-bearingpoint-4223540080?position=4&pageNum=5&refId=7nsk2q21%2B305DrVzkdu9rw%3D%3D&trackingId=1o1XAKGX6Syb2KdTHFT6DA%3D%3D,Young Graduate Business Analyst - Data & Analytics Team,BearingPoint,"Brussels Region, Belgium","Working on innovative solutions to address emerging business challenges, you will have the opportunity to make a difference in genuine partnership with market-leading clients, impacting the way people work and live in the future.
We are offering you an interesting and challenging position as
Collaborate on the design and implementation of effective data management frameworks.
Work closely with market-leading clients to understand their unique data governance needs.
Assist in developing and executing comprehensive data governance solutions.
Contribute to the development and optimization of data models, structures, and workflows.
Implement and operate data governance tools, ensuring their efficiency.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver customer-focused outcomes.
Demonstrate strong analytical and programming skills when needed.
Recent MSc or MA graduate in Computer Science, Information Management, Business Engineering, or a related field.
Proficient in English, with a good command in French and/or Dutch.
Keen interest and basic knowledge in data management and data governance.
Familiarity with data models, structures, and workflows.
Exposure to at least one data governance tool is advantageous.
Team player with a customer-success-oriented approach.
Programming skills are considered a plus.
An enriching career within a leading European Business Consulting firm with a people-centric approach.
The possibility to work on several international projects within an easy-going team.
Cross-level collaborations with our data experts, eager to share their knowledge.
Excellent growth opportunities while having access to high-quality trainings and tailor-made coaching.
An individual support from a Development Manager.

An attractive salary package (mobile phone and laptop, company car with international energy card or a mobility budget allowance, meal vouchers, hospitalization coverage and group insurance, performance-related bonus).
Apply and become part of a quality-driven practice excelling in Data Governance!

Working on innovative solutions to address emerging business challenges, you will have the opportunity to make a difference in genuine partnership with market-leading clients, impacting the way people work and live in the future.


We are offering you an interesting and challenging position as


A Young Graduate Business Analyst


Main responsibilities:


  • Collaborate on the design and implementation of effective data management frameworks.
  • Work closely with market-leading clients to understand their unique data governance needs.
  • Assist in developing and executing comprehensive data governance solutions.
  • Contribute to the development and optimization of data models, structures, and workflows.
  • Implement and operate data governance tools, ensuring their efficiency.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver customer-focused outcomes.
  • Demonstrate strong analytical and programming skills when needed.


Ideal profile:


  • Recent MSc or MA graduate in Computer Science, Information Management, Business Engineering, or a related field.
  • Proficient in English, with a good command in French and/or Dutch.
  • Keen interest and basic knowledge in data management and data governance.
  • Familiarity with data models, structures, and workflows.
  • Exposure to at least one data governance tool is advantageous.
  • Proactive mindset and entrepreneurial spirit.
  • Effective communication and presentation skills.
  • Team player with a customer-success-oriented approach.
  • Programming skills are considered a plus.

BearingPoint offers you:


  • An enriching career within a leading European Business Consulting firm with a people-centric approach.
  • The possibility to work on several international projects within an easy-going team.
  • Cross-level collaborations with our data experts, eager to share their knowledge.
  • Excellent growth opportunities while having access to high-quality trainings and tailor-made coaching.
  • An individual support from a Development Manager.
  • An attractive salary package (mobile phone and laptop, company car with international energy card or a mobility budget allowance, meal vouchers, hospitalization coverage and group insurance, performance-related bonus).

Apply and become part of a quality-driven practice excelling in Data Governance!

4235860826,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-engineer-at-twenty8-4235860826?position=6&pageNum=5&refId=7nsk2q21%2B305DrVzkdu9rw%3D%3D&trackingId=FnWbcKfOJ76MSVoqGUxLnw%3D%3D,Data Engineer,twenty8,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","Twenty8 is an independent firm delivering IT services to international organizations, with a focus on supporting digital transformation, business development, and customer-centric solutions.
We collaborate closely with European Union public institutions and agencies, helping skilled professionals navigate and grow in their international careers.

We are currently seeking an experienced Data Engineer with extensive experience in data governance and AI compliance environments to support a prestigious European Institution in Brussels. üîçüá™üá∫
Design and implement data governance frameworks including data quality monitoring, data lineage tracking, metadata management and GDPR compliance
Ensure secure and ethical data practices, with a strong focus on data access control, logging, encryption, and adherence to EU data protection regulations
Develop systems for real-time data observability to monitor pipelines, detect anomalies, and ensure robust and reliable data operations
Build and maintain a centralised data catalogue, promoting transparency, consistency, and accessibility of data assets across the organisation
Support AI governance initiatives, ensuring compliance with the AI Act, developing ethical guidelines, and managing AI-related risks
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, provide technical documentation, deliver trainings, and actively promote best practices in data and AI governance.
8+ years of experience in data engineering
Proven experience in data governance and management, including data quality, metadata, lineage, and GDPR compliance
Strong technical skills in SQL, NoSQL, ETL tools, and knowledge of data warehouse architecture and modelling
Experience with data observability tools and risk management techniques, including monitoring, logging, and anomaly detection.
University degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering or relevant fields
Ability to work in multicultural and international settings.
This is a hybrid role, requiring on-site presence at the Brussels office only 1 day per week. üìç
If your skills and experience align with this role, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!
Submit your CV today and embark on an exciting journey with us! üì©

At bpost, we don't just offer jobs ‚Äì we offer careers.

As a purpose-driven company, bpost is committed to building an inclusive and engaging environment, powered by our people. We connect individuals and communities through innovative logistics and communication solutions.
We are currently looking for a Commercial Analyst to strengthen our team and contribute to the development of future-oriented products and services.

As a Commercial Analyst, you will support the Marketing Manager and Product Owners with strategic insights and data-driven analysis. You will play a key role in optimizing our product portfolio and business development efforts by providing in-depth knowledge of market dynamics, pricing trends, customer segments, and competitive intelligence.
Conduct in-depth market analysis, including demand trends by segment, technology shifts, and market share evolution.
Build and maintain the market and pricing modeling
Provide robust data support for business case development in coordination with Product Owners, the Marketing Manager, and Finance.
Monitor and analyze the CRM-based sales pipeline, ensuring accurate and up-to-date tracking.
Contribute to strategic planning and budget preparation through market and sales data gathering and analysis.
Lead margin analysis to support portfolio optimization and profitability improvements.
Identify high-potential prospects by leveraging field interviews and industry intelligence.
Analyze customer satisfaction surveys following product launches.
Collaborate cross-functionally with teams including Commercial Excellence, Finance, Operations, and Customer Support to generate actionable business insights.
.Master in science degree in economics or equivalent experience.
Previous experience in commercial analytics roles
Good understanding on the basic financial computations of profit, operational margin, churn.
Ability to synthesize data from multiple sources into actionable insights.
Fluent in French or Dutch, very good knowledge of English.
A phone subscription and company car
20 days of statutory leave and 7 additional extra-legal days off
End-of-year and performance-based bonuses, plus double holiday pay

bpost is Belgium‚Äôs leading postal operator and, as part of bpostgroup, we are a growing parcel & omni-commerce logistics partner worldwide. With a strong commitment to social and environmental sustainability, we aim to be a trusted guide in a changing world.
Become part of #thebiggestteamofBelgium with a unique atmosphere and culture.
Enjoy a dynamic work environment with a flexible hybrid model.
Have access to continuous learning and development opportunities.
Directly impact decision-making in an international success story.
Thrive in a leadership culture focused on vision, innovation, and empowerment.

Commercial Analyst

At bpost, we don't just offer jobs ‚Äì we offer careers.

As a purpose-driven company, bpost is committed to building an inclusive and engaging environment, powered by our people. We connect individuals and communities through innovative logistics and communication solutions.

We are currently looking for a Commercial Analyst to strengthen our team and contribute to the development of future-oriented products and services.

Your Mission

As a Commercial Analyst, you will support the Marketing Manager and Product Owners with strategic insights and data-driven analysis. You will play a key role in optimizing our product portfolio and business development efforts by providing in-depth knowledge of market dynamics, pricing trends, customer segments, and competitive intelligence.

Your Responsibilities

  • Conduct in-depth market analysis, including demand trends by segment, technology shifts, and market share evolution.
  • Build and maintain the market and pricing modeling
  • Provide robust data support for business case development in coordination with Product Owners, the Marketing Manager, and Finance.
  • Monitor and analyze the CRM-based sales pipeline, ensuring accurate and up-to-date tracking.
  • Contribute to strategic planning and budget preparation through market and sales data gathering and analysis.
  • Lead margin analysis to support portfolio optimization and profitability improvements.
  • Identify high-potential prospects by leveraging field interviews and industry intelligence.
  • Analyze customer satisfaction surveys following product launches.
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with teams including Commercial Excellence, Finance, Operations, and Customer Support to generate actionable business insights.

Your Profile

  • .Master in science degree in economics or equivalent experience.
  • Previous experience in commercial analytics roles
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Good understanding on the basic financial computations of profit, operational margin, churn.
  • Ability to synthesize data from multiple sources into actionable insights.
  • Strong collaboration and communication skills.
  • Fluent in French or Dutch, very good knowledge of English.

Our Offer

  • Competitive monthly salary.
  • Meal vouchers
  • Hospitalization, group, and disability insurances
  • A phone subscription and company car
  • 20 days of statutory leave and 7 additional extra-legal days off
  • End-of-year and performance-based bonuses, plus double holiday pay
  • Benefits from over 100 bpost partners

About Bpost

4237569406,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/solver-data-engineering-specialist-at-exsolv%C3%A6-4237569406?position=1&pageNum=7&refId=kdPGII0vDovmSl1BimLD2w%3D%3D&trackingId=jfjHmMcQzwz9IhD0zuy3CQ%3D%3D,Solver - Data Engineering Specialist,Exsolv√¶,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","About Exsolv√¶:

Exsolv√¶ is a Brussels-based consultancy at the forefront of Data and Artificial Intelligence innovation. We specialize in providing expert Consultancy, Audit, and Solution Development services to empower our partners in overcoming unique challenges. Our holistic approach fosters collaboration across diverse domains, including Data Engineering, Advanced Analytics, and AI.
At Exsolv√¶, our ""Solvers"" are passionate professionals equipped with cutting-edge tools, a culture of continuous learning, and an unwavering commitment to delivering high-impact solutions.
We are seeking a Data Engineering Specialist with expertise in Azure technologies to join our expert team.

As a Data Engineering Specialist with a focus on Azure, you will design and implement cloud-native data solutions that enable clients to unlock the full potential of their data assets. You will collaborate with multidisciplinary teams, utilizing advanced Azure technologies to build scalable, efficient data pipelines, data models, and analytics workflows.
Educational Background: Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, or a related field.
Languages: Written & Spoken Fluency in English AND French or Dutch
Experience: On-Premise AND Cloud hands on Data Engineering experience
Azure Expertise: Extensive experience with Azure Data Factory, Synapse Analytics, Data Lake Storage, and Azure Databricks.
Programming Skills: Proficiency in Python and SQL, with experience in big data tools like Apache Spark.
Cloud Proficiency: Hands-on experience with Azure DevOps, CI/CD pipelines, and infrastructure as code tools (e.g., Terraform, Bicep).
ETL/ELT Development: Demonstrated expertise in building and optimizing ETL/ELT pipelines for complex datasets.
Soft Skills: Strong communication and collaboration skills to engage with clients and cross-functional teams.
Familiarity with MLOps pipelines and integration with Azure Machine Learning.
Knowledge of Power BI for creating interactive dashboards and visualizations.
Microsoft Certified: Azure Data Engineer Associate or equivalent certifications.
Client Engagement: Collaborate with clients to assess their data needs and recommend Azure-based solutions to streamline data processing and storage.
Data Ecosystem Implementation: Design and implement solutions leveraging Azure Synapse Analytics, Data Factory, Databricks, Data Lake Storage, and related tools.
Pipeline Optimization: Develop and maintain robust ETL/ELT pipelines to ensure efficient data ingestion and transformation.
Data Modeling and Warehousing: Design and optimize scalable data models and data warehousing solutions using Azure SQL and Synapse Analytics.
Big Data Integration: Work with big data tools like Apache Spark within Azure environments to manage and process large datasets.
Cloud Deployment: Implement and manage data solutions on Azure with an emphasis on security, scalability, and performance.
Microsoft Fabric: Utilize Microsoft Fabric to integrate and optimize analytics workflows for seamless data experiences.
Stay updated on advancements in Azure technologies, big data tools, and Microsoft Fabric.
Explore innovative methodologies to enhance the efficiency and security of data engineering practices.
Lead Azure-based projects from design to deployment, ensuring alignment with client objectives and timely delivery.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Data Scientists and Solution Architects, to implement end-to-end data solutions.
Conduct workshops to empower client teams in adopting and managing Azure-based data platforms.
Provide ongoing support to ensure the scalability and performance of deployed systems.
Impactful Projects: Engage in transformative Azure-based data initiatives across industries like finance, healthcare, and manufacturing.
Continuous Learning: Access the latest tools, certifications, and training opportunities to remain at the cutting edge of Azure technologies.
Collaborative Culture: Be part of a team that values collective intelligence and mutual support.
Hybrid Flexibility: Enjoy a balanced work model with opportunities for remote and in-office collaboration.
Competitive Compensation: Benefit from an attractive salary, performance-based bonuses, and comprehensive benefits.
Apply Today, if you are a driven professional with a passion for Azure technologies and a keen interest in leveraging Microsoft Fabric to revolutionize data solutions, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

About Exsolv√¶:

Exsolv√¶ is a Brussels-based consultancy at the forefront of Data and Artificial Intelligence innovation. We specialize in providing expert Consultancy, Audit, and Solution Development services to empower our partners in overcoming unique challenges. Our holistic approach fosters collaboration across diverse domains, including Data Engineering, Advanced Analytics, and AI.


At Exsolv√¶, our ""Solvers"" are passionate professionals equipped with cutting-edge tools, a culture of continuous learning, and an unwavering commitment to delivering high-impact solutions.


We are seeking a Data Engineering Specialist with expertise in Azure technologies to join our expert team.


Your Role:

As a Data Engineering Specialist with a focus on Azure, you will design and implement cloud-native data solutions that enable clients to unlock the full potential of their data assets. You will collaborate with multidisciplinary teams, utilizing advanced Azure technologies to build scalable, efficient data pipelines, data models, and analytics workflows.


What We‚Äôre Looking For:


Required Skills and Qualifications

  • Educational Background: Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, or a related field.
  • Languages: Written &
column2:
Spoken Fluency in English AND French or Dutch
  • Seniority: 3-7 years of work experience
  • Experience: On-Premise AND Cloud hands on Data Engineering experience
  • Azure Expertise: Extensive experience with Azure Data Factory, Synapse Analytics, Data Lake Storage, and Azure Databricks.
  • Programming Skills: Proficiency in Python and SQL, with experience in big data tools like Apache Spark.
  • Cloud Proficiency: Hands-on experience with Azure DevOps, CI/CD pipelines, and infrastructure as code tools (e.g., Terraform, Bicep).
  • ETL/ELT Development: Demonstrated expertise in building and optimizing ETL/ELT pipelines for complex datasets.
  • Soft Skills: Strong communication and collaboration skills to engage with clients and cross-functional teams.


    • Preferred Skills

    • Familiarity with MLOps pipelines and integration with Azure Machine Learning.
    • Knowledge of Power BI for creating interactive dashboards and visualizations.
    • Microsoft Certified: Azure Data Engineer Associate or equivalent certifications.


    What You‚Äôll Do:


    Core Expertise

    • Client Engagement: Collaborate with clients to assess their data needs and recommend Azure-based solutions to streamline data processing and storage.
    • Data Ecosystem Implementation: Design and implement solutions leveraging Azure Synapse Analytics, Data Factory, Databricks, Data Lake Storage, and related tools.
    • Pipeline Optimization: Develop and maintain robust ETL/ELT pipelines to ensure efficient data ingestion and transformation.


    Technical Implementation

    • Data Modeling and Warehousing: Design and optimize scalable data models and data warehousing solutions using Azure SQL and Synapse Analytics.
    • Big Data Integration: Work with big data tools like Apache Spark within Azure environments to manage and process large datasets.
    • Cloud Deployment: Implement and manage data solutions on Azure with an emphasis on security, scalability, and performance.
    • Microsoft Fabric: Utilize Microsoft Fabric to integrate and optimize analytics workflows for seamless data experiences.


    Research and Innovation

    • Stay updated on advancements in Azure technologies, big data tools, and Microsoft Fabric.
    • Explore innovative methodologies to enhance the efficiency and security of data engineering practices.


    Project Management

    • Lead Azure-based projects from design to deployment, ensuring alignment with client objectives and timely delivery.
    • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Data Scientists and Solution Architects, to implement end-to-end data solutions.


    Training and Support

    • Conduct workshops to empower client teams in adopting and managing Azure-based data platforms.
    • Provide ongoing support to ensure the scalability and performance of deployed systems.


    Why Join Us?

    • Impactful Projects: Engage in transformative Azure-based data initiatives across industries like finance, healthcare, and manufacturing.
    • Continuous Learning: Access the latest tools, certifications, and training opportunities to remain at the cutting edge of Azure technologies.
    • Collaborative Culture: Be part of a team that values collective intelligence and mutual support.
    • Hybrid Flexibility: Enjoy a balanced work model with opportunities for remote and in-office collaboration.
    • Competitive Compensation: Benefit from an attractive salary, performance-based bonuses, and comprehensive benefits.


    Apply Today, if you are a driven professional with a passion for Azure technologies and a keen interest in leveraging Microsoft Fabric to revolutionize data solutions, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

Start date: 01.07.2025 or as soon as possible

The Football Technologies Assistant supports the Football Operations team in overseeing the correct use and implementation of the various football technologies, with a particular focus on VAR and player tracking for the relevant UEFA competitions. The position-holder collaborates to help the unit achieve its project objectives with the appropriate level of service and quality.
Supporting project management and coordinating the delivery of football technology services at the various UEFA competitions
Supporting the analysis and development of tracking and event data projects using Python or similar tools, including data processing, cleaning and transformation
column2: quality assurance checks and generating insightful analyses and reports

column1: Ensuring the correct implementation of video and data services for team analysts
Recording, reporting, monitoring and filing incidents involving football technologies
From 1 to 3 years' experience in a technical or data-related role in the sports industry
Bachelor's degree, ideally in data science, data analytics or equivalent
Any other European language would be an asset
Proficient in Python for data cleaning, analysis and visualisation

Job information

Division/Unit: Football/Football Operations

Contract type: Maximum-term contract

Start date: 01.07.2025 or as soon as possible

End date: 30.06.2027

Application deadline: 02.06.2025

Main goal

The Football Technologies Assistant supports the Football Operations team in overseeing the correct use and implementation of the various football technologies, with a particular focus on VAR and player tracking for the relevant UEFA competitions. The position-holder collaborates to help the unit achieve its project objectives with the appropriate level of service and quality.

Key Responsibilities

  • Supporting project management and coordinating the delivery of football technology services at the various UEFA competitions
  • Supporting the analysis and development of tracking and event data projects using Python or similar tools, including data processing, cleaning and transformation

quality assurance checks and generating insightful analyses and reports

    • Any other European language would be an asset

    Other requirements:

Data Engineer

Z√ºrich/Fribourg


Bist du ein erfahrener Data Engineer mit einer Leidenschaft f√ºr Daten und technische Innovation? Wir von Scigility unterst√ºtzen Unternehmen mit Strategie, Expertise und Umsetzung, eine datengetriebene Kultur zu etablieren. Bei Scigility setzen wir auf Zusammenarbeit und modernste Technologien. Wenn du bereit bist, dein Wissen einzubringen und innovative Datenprodukte zu gestalten, dann werde Teil unseres dynamischen Teams!



So schaffst du Mehrwert

M√∂chtest du Teil eines interdisziplin√§ren Teams sein, deine Ideen einbringen und Verantwortung √ºbernehmen? Als Data Engineer entwickelst du skalierbare Datenpipelines, optimierst Datenarchitekturen und erm√∂glichst Kunden, datengetriebene Entscheidungen zu treffen.


Deine Hauptaufgaben:

  • Bereitschaft, vor Ort beim Kunden zu arbeiten

Optionale Superkr√§fte:

4234993558,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/digital-analytics-intern-6-months-at-mcm-worldwide-4234993558?position=15&pageNum=0&refId=TzNJypx31wjv8ugzn5AoVA%3D%3D&trackingId=Wjaq6w5C5fiLB0MuTWPrtw%3D%3D,Digital Analytics Intern (6-months),MCM WORLDWIDE,"Zug, Switzerland","ABOUT MCM (MODERN CREATION M√úNCHEN):

MCM is a luxury lifestyle goods and fashion house founded in 1976 with an attitude defined by the cultural Zeitgeist and its German heritage with a focus on functional innovation, including the use of cutting-edge techniques. Today, through its association with music, art, travel and technology, MCM embodies the bold, rebellious and aspirational. Always with an eye on the disruptive, the driving force behind MCM centers on revolutionizing classic design with futuristic materials. Appealing to the 21st Century Global Nomad generation - dreamers, creatives and digital natives - MCM‚Äôs millennial and Gen Z audience is genderless, ageless, empowered and unconstrained by rules and boundaries.
MCM is currently distributed online and in 650 stores worldwide including Munich, Berlin, Zurich, London, Paris, New York, Hong Kong, Shanghai, Beijing, Seoul, Tokyo, Middle East and more.

With a highly collaborative workforce working from offices and stores around the world, MCM established a multinational/multicultural organization. To uphold the culture & value of MCM, we intend to fulfil our corporate social responsibility by implementing the following values and to comply with high degree of legitimacy and ethical standards.

Our employees make the best efforts to become high-performing individuals who reflect the diversity of the communities in which we work and live. MCM‚Äôs commitment to diversity and inclusion includes recruiting and retaining employees from diverse backgrounds and experiences, creating awareness of diversity issues and benefits, and fostering a supportive environment where inclusivity is expected and prioritized. We have zero tolerance in any form of harassment, insultation, ostracization or groundless defamation of any other person.

As a Digital Analytics Intern at MCM, you'll work closely with the Head of Data Excellence to analyze digital data and help enhance MCM's online presence, marketing strategies, and user experience. In collaboration with the marketing, product, and data teams, you will track and evaluate key performance indicators (KPIs), generate actionable insights, and contribute to the optimization of digital campaigns. Your work will directly support MCM in making data-driven decisions that shape the future of the brand‚Äôs digital engagement.
Collect, analyze, and interpret data from various digital sources (e.g. Google Analytics 4, social media, CRM systems and others).
Assist in tracking and reporting website performance in terms of traffic, engagement and conversion.
Collaborate with teams to implement tagging and tracking solutions using tools like Google Tag Manager.
Create dashboards and visual reports to communicate insights effectively.
Monitor and identify trends, patterns, and opportunities to enhance digital performance.
Assist in competitor and industry benchmarking analysis.
Support A/B testing initiatives and provide recommendations based on findings.
Currently pursuing a degree in Marketing, Business Analytics, Data Science, Statistics or a related field.
Basic understanding of Digital Analytics tools such as Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager or Adobe Analytics (preferred but not required).
Good proficiency in Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets
Basic experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Looker Studio, Tableau, Power BI).
Detail-oriented with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
Strong communication skills and ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
Knowledge of SQL, Python, or R is a plus but not required.
Knowledge and experience of foundational web technologies (e.g. HTML5, CSS, JavaScript) is a plus but not required.
Hands-on experience with real-world digital analytics projects.
Exposure to industry-leading analytics tools and best practices.
Mentorship and networking opportunities within the industry.
A chance to contribute to meaningful digital strategy decisions.
Sound like your kind of challenge? Step into the future with MCM and apply now!

4235364632,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/digital-marketplace-coordinator-napapijri-at-napapijri-4235364632?position=19&pageNum=0&refId=TzNJypx31wjv8ugzn5AoVA%3D%3D&trackingId=3kYC1zsA9d29NEOepZaf5w%3D%3D,Digital Marketplace Coordinator (Napapijri),Napapijri,"Stabio, Ticino, Switzerland","Napapijri is looking for an exceptional Digital Marketplace Coordinator to join our Digital Strategic Account team based in Stabio, Switzerland.

For over 30 years, Napapijri has pioneered the future of fashion. From our Italian beginnings, innovating outdoor apparel in the shadow of Monte Bianco, to tackling nature‚Äôs most challenging environments on polar expeditions, our desire to lead the way is what makes us who we are. As a premium outdoor lifestyle brand, we provide an urban outdoor aesthetic combined with functionality and comfort for an eco-conscious consumer.

You as a Digital Marketplace Coordinator will be responsible for the end-to-end catalogue onboarding and maintenance process for some of our primary Digital Marketplaces (Zalando, Aboutyou, Veepee). You will also be supporting sales campaign order entry management and off-price deals execution.

You will be fundamental in getting Napapijri products available to sell on external platforms in timely manner, actively overseeing sample and imagery flows as well as identifying optimisation opportunities. You will make the difference by working closely with internal and external partners, building strong business relationships.

Furthermore, in this role you will be key supporting Napapijri HQ salesforce during sales campaign through sales order entry, materials preparation and ad hoc reporting. Finally, you will also support Digital off-price business execution from operational activities to order management.
How You Will Make a Difference
Holistically manage the assortments onboarding process throughout the entire lifecycle of products (onboarding, offboarding, seasonal retagging, etc.)
Overseeing the sample and imagery process for Digital Accounts across both concession and wholesale model
Optimize the assortments visibility across different Marketplace platforms.

Build a strong and close collaboration with all relevant counterparts/stakeholders within the organization as well as external stakeholders to enable a fast and smooth product onboarding flow to maximize the inventory window.
Improve existing processes, tools, reporting and implement new ones in support of the day-to-day business.
Napapijri HQ Sales team support during sales campaign. From reporting to order entry management
Support on off price business management, from stocklist generation to shipments execution
You should be comfortable prioritizing your own workload, detailed oriented and have a passion for optimization, with:
Analytical and commercial mindset, great attention to detail.
Strong MS Office proficiency (especially MS Excel), familiarity with BI systems is a plus (IBM Cognos, SAP Business Objects).
Strong organisational skills, proactive attitude, ability to work cross-functionally in fast-paced environments.
2-3 year experience in digital operations, business analysis, planning or sales support roles would be preferrable.

A formal education and subsequent University bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in business management or engineering are nice to have, but we are most interested in your overall experience, professional achievements and motivation.

VF is a global apparel company connecting people to the lifestyles they cherish through our family of iconic brands. At the heart of our journey lies our purpose: We power movements of sustainable and active lifestyles for the betterment of people and our planet. This is our purpose. It‚Äôs the reason we come to work every day. Our purpose unites us and leads us to pursue our goals, together. This is our calling. Learn more at vfc.com

We‚Äôre in the business of unleashing human potential, driven by the ideas, energy and commitment of our people. That‚Äôs why we offer comprehensive benefits that encourage mental, physical and financial well-being for all VF associates. When it comes to benefits, we‚Äôre the total package.
A supportive feedback-based culture where respect and integrity guide us in what we do
An inclusive international environment where people of diverse backgrounds, lifestyles and nationalities love working together
Be part of an iconic lifestyle brand in a multi brand, multi countries organization
On site gym offering health and well-being initiatives
A discount card with 50% on all VF brands
Break out areas offering complimentary hot drinks

As a purpose-led, performance driven company, we strive to foster a culture of belonging based on respect, connection, openness and authenticity. We are committed to building and maintaining a workplace that celebrates the diversity of our associates, allowing them to bring their authentic selves to work every day.
As an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer, VF is committed to support disadvantaged groups whilst providing equal opportunities for both VF associates and applicants alike.
If you like what you have read and want to join our team then we would like to hear from you!

Napapijri is looking for an exceptional Digital Marketplace Coordinator to join our Digital Strategic Account team based in Stabio, Switzerland.

For over 30 years, Napapijri has pioneered the future of fashion. From our Italian beginnings, innovating outdoor apparel in the shadow of Monte Bianco, to tackling nature‚Äôs most challenging environments on polar expeditions, our desire to lead the way is what makes us who we are. As a premium outdoor lifestyle brand, we provide an urban outdoor aesthetic combined with functionality and comfort for an eco-conscious consumer.

Let‚Äôs Talk About The Role

You as a Digital Marketplace Coordinator will be responsible for the end-to-end catalogue onboarding and maintenance process for some of our primary Digital Marketplaces (Zalando, Aboutyou, Veepee). You will also be supporting sales campaign order entry management and off-price deals execution.

You will be fundamental in getting Napapijri products available to sell on external platforms in timely manner, actively overseeing sample and imagery flows as well as identifying optimisation opportunities. You will make the difference by working closely with internal and external partners, building strong business relationships.

Furthermore, in this role you will be key supporting Napapijri HQ salesforce during sales campaign through sales order entry, materials preparation and ad hoc reporting. Finally, you will also support Digital off-price business execution from operational activities to order management.

How You Will Make a Difference

You will achieve this by:

  • Holistically manage the assortments onboarding process throughout the entire lifecycle of products (onboarding, offboarding, seasonal retagging, etc.)
  • Overseeing the sample and imagery process for Digital Accounts across both concession and wholesale model
  • Optimize the assortments visibility across different Marketplace platforms.
  • Build a strong and close collaboration with all relevant counterparts/stakeholders within the organization as well as external stakeholders to enable a fast and smooth product onboarding flow to maximize the inventory window.
  • Improve existing processes, tools, reporting and implement new ones in support of the day-to-day business.
  • Napapijri HQ Sales team support during sales campaign. From reporting to order entry management
  • Support on off price business management, from stocklist generation to shipments execution

Skills For Success

You should be comfortable prioritizing your own workload, detailed oriented and have a passion for optimization, with:

  • Analytical and commercial mindset, great attention to detail.
  • Strong MS Office proficiency (especially MS Excel), familiarity with BI systems is a plus (IBM Cognos, SAP Business Objects).
  • Strong organisational skills, proactive attitude, ability to work cross-functionally in fast-paced environments.
  • 2-3 year experience in digital operations, business analysis, planning or sales support roles would be preferrable.

A formal education and subsequent University bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in business management or engineering are nice to have, but we are most interested in your overall experience, professional achievements and motivation.

VF is a global apparel company connecting people to the lifestyles they cherish through our family of iconic brands. At the heart of our journey lies our purpose: We power movements of sustainable and active lifestyles for the betterment of people and our planet. This is our purpose. It‚Äôs the reason we come to work every day. Our purpose unites us and leads us to pursue our goals, together. This is our calling. Learn more at vfc.com

What‚Äôs In It For You

We‚Äôre in the business of unleashing human potential, driven by the ideas, energy and commitment of our people. That‚Äôs why we offer comprehensive benefits that encourage mental, physical and financial well-being for all VF associates. When it comes to benefits, we‚Äôre the total package.

  • A supportive feedback-based culture where respect and integrity guide us in what we do
  • An inclusive international environment where people of diverse backgrounds, lifestyles and nationalities love working together
  • Be part of an iconic lifestyle brand in a multi brand, multi countries organization
  • On site gym offering health and well-being initiatives
  • A discount card with 50% on all VF brands
  • Break out areas offering complimentary hot drinks

Free to Be, Inclusion &
column2:
Diversity

As a purpose-led, performance driven company, we strive to foster a culture of belonging based on respect, connection, openness and authenticity. We are committed to building and maintaining a workplace that celebrates the diversity of our associates, allowing them to bring their authentic selves to work every day.

As an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer, VF is committed to support disadvantaged groups whilst providing equal opportunities for both VF associates and applicants alike.

If you like what you have read and want to join our team then we would like to hear from you!

4236856702,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-analyst-consultant-artificial-intelligence-data-ai-insights-focus-at-deloitte-4236856702?position=21&pageNum=0&refId=TzNJypx31wjv8ugzn5AoVA%3D%3D&trackingId=KYAuGs%2Bg8d%2FANy52Xh5Yzg%3D%3D,Business Analyst/ Consultant - Artificial Intelligence & Data (AI & Insights Focus),Deloitte,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Job Description
You bring ambition, we provide opportunities.
Help our clients navigate the future with confidence and embrace decision making with clear data-driven choices

Deloitte AI & Data helps clients unlock the power of AI and data to deliver better human-centric solutions that catalyse growth and efficiencies. We enable them to leverage data, analytics, modern platforms, and data science & AI technologies to uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data, generate insights, and inform their decision-making.‚ÄØ

We help clients transform their business by designing and implementing data solutions to excel in their markets. Our role is to understand their business problems and use data-driven thinking and technology to achieve outcomes that drive their business forward.
How You Can Make An Impact
Develop data strategies that allow our clients to reach their business objectives across regulatory, cost, and revenue pillars
Design data & analytics transformations by providing architectural, technical and organizational thought leadership and guide clients in executing these transformations
Drive Data & AI use cases from business value concept to production
Develop and maintain trusted client relationships through project work or business development and expand your network both internally and externally
Support business development opportunities to generate new projects
Be a role model for people you work with by demonstrating strong work ethic, leadership, and subject matter competence
Grow expertise in different industry and subject matter areas and share your knowledge with the rest of Deloitte talent
Passionate individuals looking to make a career in Consulting
Ability to manage multiple activities in a high-paced environment and deliver independently
Strong Microsoft Power Point skills: Ability to design and shape meaningful presentations
Strong Conceptual Capability: Ability to consolidate diverse requirements into coherent solution designs, simplifying complex problems
Business-IT Translator: Proficient in leading requirement analysis and acting as the bridge between business needs and technical solutions
Technical design: Attention to detail and ability to convey technical specifics of solution design in oral or written form and in 1-1 meetings as well as workshops
Familiarity with Python. Experience with R is a plus
First practical experience with Generative AI, AI, Machine Learning and/or Analytics solutions is recommended
Experience with data science workbench tools such as Snowflake, Databricks and Dataiku is a plus

column2: fluency in German and/or French is highly preferred to facilitate communication with diverse teams and stakeholders

column1: First relevant experience in consulting, tech companies, or industry-specific roles, particularly in data-driven fields
Previous experience in the Banking, Insurance, Life Science or Healthcare sector is advantageous

Become part of a diverse and multinational team of 50+ highly motivated individuals located in our Zurich, Geneva, or Basel offices. We specialise in AI & data ‚Äì how to structure it, how to source it, how to transform it, how to store it, and how to consume it. Join our fast-paced and fun team, working alongside highly talented colleagues on varied and exciting projects, with access to excellent and continuous learning opportunities.

Deloitte AI & Data is the leading data & analytics consulting team in Switzerland. You will have a chance to work with outstanding colleagues and have access to variety of clients, vendors, and technologies. Our business is growing fast and there are plenty market opportunities to develop career in the direction that you want.

We will help you grow both personally and professionally: through our trainings, mentoring programmes, and on-the-job learning, but also by working with clients and vendors across different industries.

At Deloitte, your ideas create impact and spark meaningful change for our clients, people and society. Your unique expertise, background and perspective helps us find new ways into the most complex challenges so we can brighten the futures of those our work affects. At Deloitte, you can build a career that inspires and energises you. At Deloitte, you can choose your impact.

In Switzerland, we provide industry-specific services in the areas of Audit & Assurance, Tax & Legal, Strategy, Risk & Transactions Advisory, and Technology & Transformation. With close to 3,000 employees at six locations, we serve companies and organisations of all sizes in all industry sectors. We offer meaningful and challenging work, an inclusive and supportive environment where you can be your best self and where you will never stop growing. You will benefit from flexible and hybrid working conditions, wellbeing and parental programmes as well as many opportunities to connect, collaborate and learn.

Join us and become part of a global network of like-minded people dedicated to making a difference, whether by addressing climate change or improving 100 million futures by 2030. Want to know more about opportunities at Deloitte? Visit www.deloitte.com/ch/careers .
We look forward to hearing from you! Please click on ‚Äúapply now‚Äù to submit a complete application, including CV, cover letter, references and degree certificates.
If you have any questions, please contact Jules at talent@deloitte.ch

We consider all qualified applicants for employment regardless of race, ethnicity, religious beliefs, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability, in accordance with applicable law. Research shows that women are less likely to apply for roles unless they match all the criteria

Develop, optimize, and manage large-scale data pipelines using Cloudera tools (Impala, Hive, Spark, HDFS, Sqoop).

Perform data wrangling, cleansing, and performance tuning of queries.
Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and application teams to deliver robust data solutions.
Implement data governance, security, and best practices in data engineering processes.
Monitor and troubleshoot job performance and data quality issues.
Automate workflows and data pipelines using Unix shell scripting.
Develop complex SQL/PL-SQL queries for data extraction, reporting, and analysis.
Strong experience with Cloudera/Hadoop ecosystem: Impala, Hive, Spark, HDFS, Sqoop.
Proficiency in Unix/Linux and shell scripting.
Understanding of data architecture and data pipeline orchestration.
Experience working with structured and unstructured data at scale.
Familiarity with performance tuning and optimization in big data environments.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop, optimize, and manage large-scale data pipelines using Cloudera tools (Impala, Hive, Spark, HDFS, Sqoop).
  • Work with large datasets to extract, transform, and load (ETL) data efficiently.
  • Perform data wrangling, cleansing, and performance tuning of queries.
  • Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and application teams to deliver robust data solutions.
  • Implement data governance, security, and best practices in data engineering processes.
  • Monitor and troubleshoot job performance and data quality issues.
  • Automate workflows and data pipelines using Unix shell scripting.
  • Develop complex SQL/PL-SQL queries for data extraction, reporting, and analysis.
