4235393271,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/it-systems-support-engineer-at-avaloq-4235393271?position=6&pageNum=2&refId=ILBFkecQy%2FRxtrgGk2wGmw%3D%3D&trackingId=326wpCL8t5K%2FYwqV3L9LCQ%3D%3D,IT Systems Support Engineer,Avaloq,"Bioggio, Ticino, Switzerland","Company Description

Founded and headquartered in Switzerland, Avaloq is continuously expanding its global footprint with around 2,500 colleagues in 12 countries, and more than 170 clients in 35 countries. We are an industry-leading provider of wealth management technology and services for financial institutions around the world, including private banks and wealth managers, investment managers, as well as retail and neo banks. Our research led approach and continual innovation is powered by the passion and creativity of our colleagues.

We are always looking for talented people to join us on our mission to orchestrate the financial ecosystem and democratize access to wealth management. Avaloq offers the opportunity to work closely with some of the world‚Äôs leading financial institutions as we jointly develop and shape careers. Championing a collaborative, supportive and flexible work environment empowers our colleagues to reach their full potential.
We are seeking a skilled IT Systems Support Engineer with expertise in Java applications deployed on Kubernetes.
In this role, you will be responsible for maintaining, troubleshooting, and optimizing application environments to ensure reliability, scalability, and performance.
Familiarity with the Avaloq ecosystem is highly desirable and will be considered a strong asset.
Monitor, maintain, and support Java-based applications running on Kubernetes clusters
Troubleshoot and resolve application performance issues, ensuring minimal downtime
Collaborate with project managers and developers to implement best practices for deployment and system management
Enhance system scalability, resilience, and performance through proactive measures
Manage system alerts and incidents, providing timely resolutions and detailed reports
Work closely with clients and stakeholders to ensure application requirements are met

Experience working in or supporting the Avaloq ecosystem (ACP, Community API, FixBridge)

We realize that managing work life balance is a challenge we all face in our daily lives and in order to support with this we are pleased to offer hybrid and flexible working for most of our Avaloqers to maintain work life balance and still continue our fantastic Avaloq culture in our global offices.

In Avaloq we are proud to embrace diversity and understand the success of our business is built on the power of different opinions, we are whole heartedly committed to fostering an equal opportunity environment and inclusive culture where you can be your true authentic self.

We hire, compensate and promote regardless of origin, age, gender identity, sexual orientation or any other fantastic traits that make us all unique, we have done our best to write this advert in an inclusive and neutral way.

Please be aware that we will not accept speculative CV submissions for any of our roles from recruitment agencies, and any unsolicited candidate submissions will be exempt from any payment expectations.

Company Description

Founded and headquartered in Switzerland, Avaloq is continuously expanding its global footprint with around 2,500 colleagues in 12 countries, and more than 170 clients in 35 countries. We are an industry-leading provider of wealth management technology and services for financial institutions around the world, including private banks and wealth managers, investment managers, as well as retail and neo banks. Our research led approach and continual innovation is powered by the passion and creativity of our colleagues.

We are always looking for talented people to join us on our mission to orchestrate the financial ecosystem and democratize access to wealth management. Avaloq offers the opportunity to work closely with some of the world‚Äôs leading financial institutions as we jointly develop and shape careers. Championing a collaborative, supportive and flexible work environment empowers our colleagues to reach their full potential.

Job Description

We are seeking a skilled IT Systems Support Engineer with expertise in Java applications deployed on Kubernetes.

In this role, you will be responsible for maintaining, troubleshooting, and optimizing application environments to ensure reliability, scalability, and performance.

Familiarity with the Avaloq ecosystem is highly desirable and will be considered a strong asset.

Your key tasks

  • Monitor, maintain, and support Java-based applications running on Kubernetes clusters
  • Troubleshoot and resolve application performance issues, ensuring minimal downtime
  • Collaborate with project managers and developers to implement best practices for deployment and system management
  • Enhance system scalability, resilience, and performance through proactive measures
  • Manage system alerts and incidents, providing timely resolutions and detailed reports
  • Work closely with clients and stakeholders to ensure application requirements are met
  • Provide technical support and guidance to internal teams

Qualifications

  • 3+ years of experience in IT systems support or a similar role
  • Proficiency in Java application support and troubleshooting
  • Hands-on experience with Kubernetes and related tools (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana)
  • Strong understanding of containerization and CI/CD pipelines
  • Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g. AWS, Azure, OCI) and hybrid cloud environments
  • Proficient with Linux systems and shell scripting
  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
  • Strong communication and collaboration abilities

It would be a real bonus if you have

  • Experience working in or supporting the Avaloq ecosystem (ACP, Community API, FixBridge)
  • Knowledge of financial systems or FinTech environments
  • Certification in Kubernetes (CKA or CKAD)

Additional Information

We realize that managing work life balance is a challenge we all face in our daily lives and in order to support with this we are pleased to offer hybrid and flexible working for most of our Avaloqers to maintain work life balance and still continue our fantastic Avaloq culture in our global offices.

In Avaloq we are proud to embrace diversity and understand the success of our business is built on the power of different opinions, we are whole heartedly committed to fostering an equal opportunity environment and inclusive culture where you can be your true authentic self.

We hire, compensate and promote regardless of origin, age, gender identity, sexual orientation or any other fantastic traits that make us all unique, we have done our best to write this advert in an inclusive and neutral way.

Please be aware that we will not accept speculative CV submissions for any of our roles from recruitment agencies, and any unsolicited candidate submissions will be exempt from any payment expectations.

Start date: Ideally 01.09.2025 or as soon as possible

The UEFA Academy Programme Coordinator plays a key role in the design, coordination and delivery of educational initiatives across UEFA. This position involves close collaboration with various UEFA divisions and units to ensure that learning programmes are strategically aligned, pedagogically sound and operationally effective.
Acting as the primary liaison between the UEFA Academy and other UEFA divisions/units to co-develop and implement educational programmes
Serving as a learning and development business partner, engaging in frequent consultations with other divisions and units to support the development of educational initiatives

Coordinating the pedagogical and logistical delivery of existing flagship initiatives, including: UEFA Football Law Programme, Fight the Fix, Sustainability in Football compact course and Innovation in Action
Coordinating the creation and delivery of bespoke educational programmes tailored to the needs of external stakeholders (e.g. national associations, clubs, private organisations)
Ensuring each programme is aligned with the UEFA Academy‚Äôs standards of excellence and stakeholder expectations
For each programme, the Programme Coordinator's role typically includes:
Co-designing and refining the programme's structure, content and pedagogical approach in cooperation with internal and external partners
Producing support materials and resources for the programme
Overseeing promotion and the recruitment process
Coordinating logistical elements, including venue booking, accommodation, catering, transport and event set-up
Managing the programme's budget, ensuring cost-effectiveness and financial accountability
More generally, optimising the learning journey of programme participants and maximising the impact of the programme on both participants and their organisations
At least three years of experience in vocational education and/or learning and development
Experience in international organisations, ideally in sports
Experience in organising seminars and other types of events
Any other major international language: A strong asset
Knowledge of AI tools and able to use them confidently
Comfortable and energised working in multicultural environments
Ability to handle tight deadlines and stressful situations
Available and willing to travel for official trips
Broad curiosity and eagerness to learn
Highly collaborative and committed to the success of others
Willingness to experiment, take risks and continuously challenge oneself

UEFA welcomes applications from all, actively working to ensure that we are an inclusive employer that finds the best candidate for our positions, regardless of aspects such as sex, gender identification, disability, age, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity or nationality.

Job information

Division/Unit: National Associations / UEFA Academy

Contract type: Permanent

Start date: Ideally 01.09.2025 or as soon as possible

Application deadline: 02.06.2025

Main goal

The UEFA Academy Programme Coordinator plays a key role in the design, coordination and delivery of educational initiatives across UEFA. This position involves close collaboration with various UEFA divisions and units to ensure that learning programmes are strategically aligned, pedagogically sound and operationally effective.

Key Responsibilities

Coordinating programmes across divisions

  • Acting as the primary liaison between the UEFA Academy and other UEFA divisions/units to co-develop and implement educational programmes
  • Serving as a learning and development business partner, engaging in frequent consultations with other divisions and units to support the development of educational initiatives
  • Coordinating the pedagogical and logistical delivery of existing flagship initiatives, including: UEFA Football Law Programme, Fight the Fix, Sustainability in Football compact course and Innovation in Action

Developing on-demand education

  • Coordinating the creation and delivery of bespoke educational programmes tailored to the needs of external stakeholders (e.g. national associations, clubs, private organisations)
  • Ensuring each programme is aligned with the UEFA Academy‚Äôs standards of excellence and stakeholder expectations

Programme Coordination Responsibilities

For each programme, the Programme Coordinator's role typically includes:

  • Co-designing and refining the programme's structure, content and pedagogical approach in cooperation with internal and external partners
  • Producing support materials and resources for the programme
  • Overseeing promotion and the recruitment process
  • Coordinating logistical elements, including venue booking, accommodation, catering, transport and event set-up
  • Managing the programme's budget, ensuring cost-effectiveness and financial accountability
  • More generally, optimising the learning journey of programme participants and maximising the impact of the programme on both participants and their organisations

Requirements

Experience:

  • At least three years of experience in vocational education and/or learning and development
  • Experience in international organisations, ideally in sports
  • Experience in organising seminars and other types of events

Education:

  • Master‚Äôs degree

Languages:

  • English: Proficient
  • French: A strong asset
  • Any other major international language: A strong asset

Other requirements:

  • Knowledge of AI tools and able to use them confidently
  • Excellent presentation skills
  • Strong project management skills
  • Comfortable and energised working in multicultural environments
  • Ability to handle tight deadlines and stressful situations
  • Service-orientated
  • Available and willing to travel for official trips
  • Broad curiosity and eagerness to learn
  • Highly collaborative and committed to the success of others
  • Willingness to experiment, take risks and continuously challenge oneself

Want to stay updated on our latest job opportunities, events, and behind-the-scenes insights? Join us on LinkedIn.

UEFA welcomes applications from all, actively working to ensure that we are an inclusive employer that finds the best candidate for our positions, regardless of aspects such as sex, gender identification, disability, age, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity or nationality.

Optiml is revolutionizing real estate with our Real Estate Decision Intelligence (REDI) software‚Äîa new category of AI-powered technology that helps decarbonize buildings while optimizing asset & portfolio performance.
Since our launch in April 2024, we have been scaling across Europe and the US, receiving significant industry recognition and winning three major PropTech awards, including:
üèÜ 2024 ULI Europe PropTech of the Year
We are backed by $6M in pre-seed funding from top-tier US and EU funds, including Innovation Endeavors (the fund of former Google CEO Eric Schmidt), Planet A, BitStone, and Kompas.

We are seeking a motivated, independent, and detail-oriented Executive Assistant (Admin / Support) with Accounting background to support our growing ETH Zurich Spin-off. You‚Äôll play a pivotal role in assuring that our company functions as well as our innovative product.

You‚Äôd be excited to work in a dynamic, friendly, fast-growing startup. You speak & write in German and English on a professional level. You bring a systems- and process-oriented mindset, excellent organizational skills, and good time management. You want to take responsibility for office operations and accounting, plus a few ad-hoc tasks (e.g. travel coordination, team event organization) that may change on a weekly basis. Your superpower is that you tame the chaos, because you live & breathe structure and never lose the overview. Sounds like you? Read on‚Ä¶

Accounting tasks, including booking of bills /invoices, payments to suppliers, monitoring and reconciliation of bank accounts, expense management, recording and control of cash flows and payments in Xero, etc. ‚Üí all of this required for the countries of Switzerland, EU countries (e.g. Germany), United Kingdom, and the US

Planning and coordinating events and social occasions for Optiml team

column2: ability to solve challenges quickly and effectively

comparis.ch is the leading comparison platform in Switzerland. We have been comparing the prices and products of health insurers, other insurance companies, telecom providers and banks for over 25 years and offer the largest Swiss online marketplace for cars and property. Our comprehensive comparisons ensure transparency for our users and help them make the right decisions. With over 80 million visits each year, we rank among the most widely used websites in Switzerland. Four out of five people recognize us as THE independent comparison platform in Switzerland.

Are you curious about machine learning and AI, and want to see how it all works in a real company? We‚Äôre looking for an open-minded and motivated intern to join our data team for 6 to 12 months. This is your chance to dive into real projects, bring your own ideas to the table, and learn how AI is used to solve practical problems.
Help develop and improve machine learning models, especially in the area of Generative AI.
Work on a variety of use cases and support the implementation and optimization of ML algorithms.
Get involved in preparing training data: exploring, cleaning, and organizing data so it‚Äôs ready for our models.
Play a part in rolling out and shaping AI tools across the company.
Curiosity and a genuine interest in finding data-driven solutions.
Currently studying computer science, data science, or something similar.
Some experience with at least one programming language (like Python, Scala, or Java).
An interest in modern AI models (like large language models) is a plus.
In return, here is what you can expect from us

At Comparis, we believe that empowered employees deliver the best results. We cultivate a culture of transparency, mutual respect and trust. Firm believers in lifelong learning, we are always trying out new things and continuously developing ‚Äì both as individuals and as a team. We also offer flat hierarchies, considerable autonomy and creative freedom, as well as a skilled and motivated team that will advise and support you in your work and make it easy for you to push your own boundaries. Finally, we offer flexible working hours and the freedom to work from almost anywhere you choose. Whether you're enjoying a workation in the Portuguese Algarve, collaborating from a caf√© in Barcelona, or connecting from a mountain chalet in the Swiss Alps, our diverse team of talented professionals spans across Europe, creating an inclusive and dynamic work environment
Then don't hesitate and apply for our position today. If you have any questions, Daphne, our People Management Lead, will be happy to help. We look forward to receiving your application!
Note for recruiters: For this position, we only consider direct applications.

Hi! We‚Äôre Yalo! We‚Äôre on a mission to revolutionize how businesses sell in an omnichannel way with our intelligent sales platform and intelligent agents powered by cutting-edge AI. Imagine a world where businesses seamlessly connect with their customers across every channel‚Äîoffering personalized experiences, anticipating needs, and delivering what they want with ease. That‚Äôs the reality we‚Äôre building at Yalo.

Born in Latin America and driven by its spirit of innovation, we‚Äôre transforming sales for businesses around the globe. From empowering businesses in emerging markets to helping enterprises scale intelligently, we‚Äôre redefining how companies engage with their customers and drive growth.

At Yalo, we believe the future of sales is personalized, omnichannel, intelligent, and conversational. Join us as we empower businesses to build stronger relationships and achieve remarkable results worldwide!

We're looking for a Data Analyst ‚Äì Customer Data Sharing to join our Data & Intelligence team. This person will be responsible for owning and executing the delivery of data products to our B2B customers. The role bridges the gap between internal data assets and external customer needs, ensuring data is delivered accurately, securely, and in a scalable way. You‚Äôll play a critical role in enabling our customers to unlock value from data‚Äîwhile reducing the operational burden on the core Data team.

As a Data Analyst ‚Äì Customer Data Sharing, you‚Äôll step into a high-impact role where your work directly powers how our customers access and extract value from data. While our core product team focuses on other priorities, we‚Äôve built a scalable but customizable process for customer-facing data deliveries‚Äîand now we need someone like you to own and elevate it.

You‚Äôll be the go-to expert for external data sharing, helping us turn what‚Äôs currently a pain point into a strength. You‚Äôll partner with cross-functional teams and our most strategic customers to deliver clean, secure, and insightful data products‚Äîwhile implementing best practices around data quality, privacy, and scalability. This is an opportunity to take ownership, bring structure to ambiguity, and build a foundation for a function that will grow with the company.
If you‚Äôre passionate about making data useful and actionable, and want to leave your mark in a fast-moving startup, this is the role for you.
What are the responsibilities for this role? üß†
Own and manage end-to-end execution of customer data sharing requests.
Build, transform, and deliver secure, high-quality datasets based on internal standards and customer needs.
Collaborate with Solution Architects, Delivery Engineering, and Customer Success to understand and prioritize data sharing requests.
Maintain and evolve documentation, templates, and a scalable process for recurring or customized data deliveries.
Ensure compliance with data governance, privacy, and security guidelines in all shared datasets.
Identify opportunities for automation or tooling to streamline manual work and improve turnaround time.
Support the monetization of data services by ensuring delivery quality and operational sustainability.
2‚Äì4 years of experience working in Data Analytics, BI, or related roles.
Strong SQL and data modeling skills.
Experience with Python for data manipulation or automation.
Familiarity with modern data stack tools (Databricks, BigQuery, dbt, Looker, GCS).
Understanding of data governance and security best practices for external data sharing.
Experience translating business requirements into technical data solutions.
Ability to manage multiple parallel projects and prioritize based on impact and deadlines.
Soft Skills That Matter To Usü´Ä
Customer Obsession: Always aiming to deliver value and a positive experience to our customers.
Ownership: Comfortable owning a process end-to-end and accountable for outcomes.
Proactive Mindset: Takes initiative to spot inefficiencies and drive improvements.
Collaboration: Works effectively across teams with clear communication.
Adaptability: Thrives in evolving contexts and builds solutions that scale with growth.
Detail-Oriented: Produces accurate and reliable work in a high-stakes environment.
% of data sharing requests delivered on time.
% of data sharing deliveries compliant with privacy/security standards.
Number of reworks or quality issues reported post-delivery.
Internal stakeholder satisfaction (e.g., Solution Architects, CS).
Revenue contribution or cost coverage from monetized data sharing agreements.
Competitive rewards on the market range
You and nothing else limit your career here

At Yalo, we are dedicated to creating a workplace that embodies our core values: caring, initiative, excellence, and simplicity. We believe in the power of diversity and inclusivity, where everyone's unique perspectives, experiences, and talents contribute to our collective success. As we embrace and respect our differences, we strive to create something extraordinary for the benefit of all.

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer, providing equal opportunities to individuals regardless of race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristic. Our commitment to fairness and equality is a fundamental pillar of our company.

At Yalo, we uphold a culture of excellence. We constantly challenge ourselves to go above and beyond, delivering remarkable results and driving innovation. We encourage each team member to take initiative and make things happen, empowering them to bring their best ideas forward and contribute to our shared goals.

The Group is guided everyday by its purpose of unleashing human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future. It is a responsible and diverse organization of over 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong 55-year heritage and deep industry expertise, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to address the entire breadth of their business needs, from strategy and design to operations, fueled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering and platforms. The Group ‚Ç¨22.5 billion in revenues in 2023.

La CRI √® Societ√† volontaria di soccorso ed assistenza, ausiliaria dei pubblici poteri in campo umanitario.

L'Associazione della Croce Rossa Italiana fa parte del Movimento Internazionale della Croce Rossa e Mezzaluna Rossa. Nelle sue azioni a livello internazionale si coordina con il Comitato Internazionale di Croce Rossa (CICR) e con la Federazione Internazionale di Croce Rossa e Mezzaluna Rossa (FICR).
In quanto Associazione di diritto privato, non trovano applicazione le disposizioni previste in materia di concorsi pubblici.
Sede di lavoro: Roma, Comitato Nazionale
Tipologia contrattuale: T. indeterminato cat. D - CCNL CRI

Scopo della funzione: La risorsa sar√† inserita all'interno dell'U.O. Risorse Umane ‚Äì Servizio Trattamento Economico e si dovr√† occupare della gestione delle presenze, paghe, contributi e adempimenti connessi, nonch√© di tutte le attivit√† relative all'amministrazione del personale.
Nell‚Äôambito degli scopi della funzione sopra delineati assicura, a titolo esemplificativo e non esaustivo, i seguenti compiti e responsabilit√†:
Elaborazione dei cedolini paga: gestione completa del ciclo payroll, dall‚Äôacquisizione dei dati fino alla chiusura del cedolino con adempimenti contributivi e fiscali
Amministrazione del personale: gestione delle presenze, ferie, malattie, infortuni e maternit√†.
Rapporti con enti previdenziali e assicurativi: gestione delle comunicazioni obbligatorie con INPS, INAIL, Agenzia delle Entrate e altri enti

Gestione di tutti gli eventi relativi al personale che possono avere un impatto sull'elaborazione dei cedolini paga (monitoraggio presenze, gestione timbrature e assegnazione badge, malattie, infortuni, detrazioni, maternit√†, etc.)
Gestione delle relazioni con il team HR: supporto nell‚Äôelaborazione di reportistica interna.

Titolo di studio ed esperienza: Laurea triennale ed almeno tre anni di esperienza professionale nel ruolo o diploma di scuola superiore di secondo grado con almeno 5 anni di esperienza professionale nel ruolo.
Conoscenza dei principali CCNL e della normativa sul lavoro
Conoscenza dei principali eventi relativi alla gestione del personale (malattie, infortuni, detrazioni, maternit√†, etc) e della relativa gestione
Conoscenza degli adempimenti post paghe e delle dichiarazioni mensili/annuali (INPS, INAIL, CU, 770, etc)
Conoscenza del pacchetto Office (con particolare riferimento all'applicativo Excel)
Conoscenza della suite Infinity Zucchetti e degli applicativi Presenze Project, Paghe Web e Analytics.
Abilitazione alla professione di consulente del lavoro
Capacit√† relazionali, attitudine al lavoro in team e puntualit√† nella gestione delle scadenze
Precisione, affidabilit√† e buone doti organizzative.
Le candidature dovranno pervenire entro e non oltre le ore 12:00 del 29 maggio 2025

Ciascun candidato potr√† presentare la propria candidatura esclusivamente attraverso la registrazione sulla piattaforma In-Recruiting, compilando il web form pubblicato sul sito istituzionale dell‚ÄôAssociazione, avendo cura di inserire tutti i dati richiesti ed allegare copia aggiornata del CV, documento di identit√† e foto, pena l'esclusione
all‚Äôinvio della candidatura, il candidato ricever√† un messaggio, all'indirizzo e-mail indicato, di avvenuta registrazione all'annuncio.

Per poter proseguire l'iter di selezione, ogni partecipante dovr√† effettuare un test preselettivo, che trover√† alla sezione ‚ÄúQuestionari‚Äù della propria pagina personale di In-Recruiting, consistente in 30 quiz, con tre opzioni di risposta di cui una sola corretta, sulle materie di cultura generale, ragionamento numerico-verbale, conoscenza generale di Croce Rossa Italiana ed inglese, da svolgere in 25 minuti e comunque entro e non oltre 1 ora dall‚Äôavvenuta registrazione all'annuncio

saranno ammessi alla successiva fase di selezione i candidati che abbiano conseguito il punteggio minimo del 60% delle risposte esatte (ossia almeno 18/30 punti) e consegnato il test nei tempi previsti dall‚Äôiter selettivo (un'ora e 25 minuti dalla registrazione all'annuncio)

ai fini del superamento della fase preselettiva, in caso di invio multiplo del test da parte del candidato, verr√† ritenuto valido solo e soltanto il primo test inviato, i successivi non verranno presi in considerazione
il test una volta avviato non potr√† essere interrotto e/o sospeso e non sar√† inoltre possibile avviarlo nuovamente
non √® possibile candidarsi all'annuncio pi√π volte utilizzando indirizzi e-mail diversi, pena l'esclusione dalla selezione

eventuali problematiche di natura tecnica che dovessero insorgere in fase di registrazione o di svolgimento del test preselettivo devono essere comunicate in tempo reale all'indirizzo e-mail recruiting@cri.it, al fine di consentire la verifica e la risoluzione della problematica

l‚Äôesito del test preselettivo non concorre alla formazione del punteggio complessivo valido per la graduatoria finale, ma verr√† utilizzata ai soli fini di accesso alle fasi successive di selezione.
I candidati saranno chiamati a svolgere una o pi√π prove di selezione le cui modalit√† verranno comunicate a mezzo e-mail contestualmente alla convocazione.

In caso di superamento delle prove di selezione e di verifica del possesso dei requisiti, i candidati saranno ammessi ad un colloquio tecnico-motivazionale, nel quale verranno approfonditi e valutati il background professionale, le competenze e l‚Äôesperienza nello svolgimento delle attivit√† richieste dalla job description pubblicata

al termine dei colloqui, chi avr√† superato positivamente le prove di selezione ed il colloquio e risulter√† in possesso dei requisiti obbligatori sar√† inserito in una lista di idonei che rimarr√† valida 24 mesi e che potr√† essere utilizzata per la copertura di eventuali posizioni analoghe che dovessero risultare vacanti all‚Äôinterno dell‚ÄôAssociazione. Il punteggio di ciascun candidato idoneo sar√† derivante dalla somma del punteggio ottenuto nella/e prova/e di selezione.
Saranno considerate valide le sole candidature che risulteranno in possesso dei requisiti obbligatori al momento della presentazione della stessa

La Croce Rossa Italiana (CRI) √® un‚ÄôAssociazione di diritto privato senza fini di lucro e di interesse pubblico, posta sotto l'alto patronato del Presidente della Repubblica ed iscritta di diritto nella sezione Organizzazioni di Volontariato del registro unico nazionale del Terzo settore, applicandosi ad essa, per quanto non diversamente disposto dal D.Lgs. n. 178/2012, il Codice del Terzo Settore (D.Lgs. n. 117/2017).

La CRI √® Societ√† volontaria di soccorso ed assistenza, ausiliaria dei pubblici poteri in campo umanitario.

L'Associazione della Croce Rossa Italiana fa parte del Movimento Internazionale della Croce Rossa e Mezzaluna Rossa. Nelle sue azioni a livello internazionale si coordina con il Comitato Internazionale di Croce Rossa (CICR) e con la Federazione Internazionale di Croce Rossa e Mezzaluna Rossa (FICR).

In quanto Associazione di diritto privato, non trovano applicazione le disposizioni previste in materia di concorsi pubblici.

4232543633,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/saint-laurent-department-manager-at-saint-laurent-4232543633?position=36&pageNum=0&refId=igycZkl0b3iIWhz7bXMQjQ%3D%3D&trackingId=qlLS4HQDGbF6rCfBM3ujYw%3D%3D,SAINT LAURENT Department Manager,Saint Laurent,"Rome, Latium, Italy","

Founded in 1961, Yves Saint Laurent was the first couture house to introduce the concept of luxury pr√™t-√†-porter in a 1966 collection called ‚ÄòRive Gauche‚Äô, synonymous with youth and freedom. This shift represented a first critical step in the modernization of fashion and revolutionized the socio-cultural landscape.

In 1999, the luxury goods division of the Kering Group acquired Yves Saint Laurent and, under the creative direction of Anthony Vaccarello since April 2016, continues to position the house at the summit of the luxury universe.
Today, Saint Laurent collections include women‚Äôs and men‚Äôs ready-to-wear, shoes, handbags, small leather goods, jewelry, scarves, ties and eyewear.

Reporting to the Assistant Store Director the Department Manager is a professional in the category they oversee and is responsible for promoting brand engagement to customers in order to guarantee the quantitative and qualitative goals assigned for the department involved.¬†

He/she represents the company and is a proactive sales professional who operates according to the policies fixed by the Store and Assistant Director. He/ She leads, motivates, coaches the team of the Department, is responsible of his/ her Department staff development and of their assigned target and tasks achievement.
Assure the recruitment, development and retainment of customers
Implement action plans defined with the HQ and Store director and guarantee follow up at store level
Communicate high quality relevant feedback and reporting to the Assistant Store Director / Store Director or staff
Create and maintain a positive and motivating work environment
Motivate and challenge the team on a daily basis in your department
Promote the culture of the brand internally and externally
Build a network of people who have an impact on local and international luxury
business in order to promote customer loyalty, especially with Top Clients and VIPs.
Ensure store atmosphere upholds brand image
Ensure that all the processes are in compliance with legal, safety, internal
requirements, sustainability, HR and stock organization
Challenge current processes to ensure efficiency and effectiveness in your
Commitment to take part in an innovative project
Product sensitivity and a strong market and fashion trends knowledge, a good general culture level
Significant experience in the sale of luxury goods or retail: customer portfolio
Managerial experience (Ability to provide constructive, straightforward feedback and coach your team to success)
High sensitivity to customers experience and loyalty
Being organized and able to prioritize tasks based on the needs of the business
Excellent interpersonal skills and a passion for providing excellent customer service
A positive attitude and a willingness to learn and improve

Saint Laurent is committed to building a diverse workforce. We believe diversity in all its forms ‚Äì gender, age, nationality, culture, religious beliefs and sexual orientation ‚Äì enriches the workplace. It opens up opportunities for people to express their talent, both individually and collectively and it helps foster our ability to adapt to a changing world. As an Equal Opportunity Employer we welcome and consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of their background

Summary

Founded in 1961, Yves Saint Laurent was the first couture house to introduce the concept of luxury pr√™t-√†-porter in a 1966 collection called ‚ÄòRive Gauche‚Äô, synonymous with youth and freedom. This shift represented a first critical step in the modernization of fashion and revolutionized the socio-cultural landscape.
In 1999, the luxury goods division of the Kering Group acquired Yves Saint Laurent and, under the creative direction of Anthony Vaccarello since April 2016, continues to position the house at the summit of the luxury universe.
Today, Saint Laurent collections include women‚Äôs and men‚Äôs ready-to-wear, shoes, handbags, small leather goods, jewelry, scarves, ties and eyewear.

Job Description

Role

Reporting to the Assistant Store Director the Department Manager is a professional in the category they oversee and is responsible for promoting brand engagement to customers in order to guarantee the quantitative and qualitative goals assigned for the department involved.
column2:
He/she represents the company and is a proactive sales professional who operates according to the policies fixed by the Store and Assistant Director. He/ She leads, motivates, coaches the team of the Department, is responsible of his/ her Department staff development and of their assigned target and tasks achievement.

Mission

A Business developer:

Assure the recruitment, development and retainment of customers

Implement action plans defined with the HQ and Store director and guarantee follow up at store level

Communicate high quality relevant feedback and reporting to the Assistant Store Director / Store Director or staff

A Talent Leader and Developer:

Create and maintain a positive and motivating work environment

Motivate and challenge the team on a daily basis in your department

A Brand Promoter:

Promote the culture of the brand internally and externally

Build a network of people who have an impact on local and international luxury

business in order to promote customer loyalty, especially with Top Clients and VIPs.

Ensure store atmosphere upholds brand image

A Process Manager:

Ensure that all the processes are in compliance with legal, safety, internal

requirements, sustainability, HR and stock organization

Challenge current processes to ensure efficiency and effectiveness in your

department

Profile

  • Commitment to take part in an innovative project
  • Product sensitivity and a strong market and fashion trends knowledge, a good general culture level
  • Significant experience in the sale of luxury goods or retail: customer portfolio
  • Managerial experience (Ability to provide constructive, straightforward feedback and coach your team to success)
  • High sensitivity to customers experience and loyalty
  • Precision, organizational skills
  • Being organized and able to prioritize tasks based on the needs of the business
  • Adaptability, openness, listening abilities, curiosity
  • High availability, responsiveness
  • Product and Fashion sensitivity
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and a passion for providing excellent customer service
  • A positive attitude and a willingness to learn and improve

Saint Laurent is committed to building a diverse workforce. We believe diversity in all its forms ‚Äì gender, age, nationality, culture, religious beliefs and sexual orientation ‚Äì enriches the workplace. It opens up opportunities for people to express their talent, both individually and collectively and it helps foster our ability to adapt to a changing world. As an Equal Opportunity Employer we welcome and consider applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of their background

Regular

Schedule

4240143422,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-data-analyst-at-msx-international-4240143422?position=43&pageNum=0&refId=igycZkl0b3iIWhz7bXMQjQ%3D%3D&trackingId=6GzVzyczwOfCIROA%2FtAbtg%3D%3D,Business Data Analyst,MSX International,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Company Description
With over 5,000 employees based in more than 80 countries across the globe, our teams provide industry leading expertise that spans:
Building trust since 1931, our proven track record means that we now partner with almost every car manufacturer on the market.
To empower Movers and Makers to thrive in our ever-changing world
To harness our expertise in mobility, the creativity of our global teams,
and the power of technology, to craft tailored and innovative solutions
To enhance every journey in the world of mobility
Are you an automotive fan and have a passion for data analysis? Do you enjoy collecting and analyzing data to detect improvements? MSXI has the job for you!
MSX is looking for a proactive and enthusiastic Business Data Analyst to join our team in Rome.

As part of our team, you will support the data management and analysis processes as well as the development and deployment of our Data and AI literacy program. Your primary responsibilities will include collecting, organizing, and interpreting data to help guide decision-making processes. Your key tasks will be:
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations that provide insights into Lean program performance and business operations
Document processes, findings, and recommendations clearly and effectively for both technical and non-technical audiences

We would love to welcome a new colleague passionate about the automotive field, oriented to teamwork and taking the good dose of initiative to achieve results. Our ideal Business Data Analyst has a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related technical field, as well as:
3+ years experience as a Business Analyst, with background in data analytics and AI
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail
Entry level knowledge of SQL, ETL processes, and data modeling
Experience with BI tools and data visualization platforms such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
Experience of planning complex schedules of activities
If you‚Äôre ready to make an impact and contribute to our company‚Äôs success, apply now!

At MSX, our employees are the force behind our success. We are dedicated to empowering and encouraging our people and offer flexible working methods to suit all. We are a Disability Confident Committed organisation who takes pride in our diverse workforce.
In Joining MSX, You Can Enjoy
You can learn more about MSX International on our website: www.msxi.com

MSX is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy or maternity. As users of the disability confident scheme, we guarantee to interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for the vacancy.

    Job Description

    Business Data Analyst

    40 hours per week, Monday-Friday

    Rome, hybrid

    Are you an automotive fan and have a passion for data analysis? Do you enjoy collecting and analyzing data to detect improvements? MSXI has the job for you!

    MSX is looking for a proactive and enthusiastic Business Data Analyst to join our team in Rome.

    The Role

    Responsibilities

    As part of our team, you will support the data management and analysis processes as well as the development and deployment of our Data and AI literacy program. Your primary responsibilities will include collecting, organizing, and interpreting data to help guide decision-making processes. Your key tasks will be:

    • Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations that provide insights into Lean program performance and business operations
    • Provide data-driven recommendations to stakeholder
    • Document processes, findings, and recommendations clearly and effectively for both technical and non-technical audiences

    Qualifications

    About you

    About

    We would love to welcome a new colleague passionate about the automotive field, oriented to teamwork and taking the good dose of initiative to achieve results. Our ideal Business Data Analyst has a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or a related technical field, as well as:

    • 3+ years experience as a Business Analyst, with background in data analytics and AI
    • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail
    • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
    • Entry level knowledge of SQL, ETL processes, and data modeling
    • Experience with BI tools and data visualization platforms such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
    • Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a dynamic and fast-paced environment
    • Experience of planning complex schedules of activities
    • Fluent level of English

    If you‚Äôre ready to make an impact and contribute to our company‚Äôs success, apply now!

    What‚Äôs in it for you?

    At MSX, our employees are the force behind our success. We are dedicated to empowering and encouraging our people and offer flexible working methods to suit all. We are a Disability Confident Committed organisation who takes pride in our diverse workforce.

    In Joining MSX, You Can Enjoy

    • Competitive salary
    • Company laptop and phone
    • Lunch voucher

    Working Pattern

    • 40 hours per week
    • Monday ‚Äì Friday
    • Rome - hybrid

    You can learn more about MSX International on our website: www.msxi.com

    Additional Information

    MSX is an equal opportunities employer and positively encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, religion or belief, marital status, or pregnancy or maternity. As users of the disability confident scheme, we guarantee to interview all disabled applicants who meet the minimum criteria for the vacancy.

Join our next generation

Vuoi fare un lavoro che sia davvero significativo e di impatto? In KPMG avrai l‚Äôopportunit√† di aiutare i clienti, la societ√†, le colleghe e i colleghi ad affrontare e risolvere le sfide pi√π attuali e complesse. KPMG Advisory offre servizi di consulenza alle imprese per affiancarle nella trasformazione del business model, nel miglioramento e nella digitalizzazione dei processi, nell'analisi e nella gestione dei rischi, nonch√© supporto nelle operazioni di finanza straordinaria.
Nel particolare, entrerai a far parte del Team di Lighthouse di Roma.
La Lighthouse √® il centro di eccellenza di KPMG Advisory che offre soluzioni di Data & Analytics sul mercato.

Unendoti al team, svilupperai soluzioni innovative attingendo dalle nostre competenze globali. Combinerai informatica, matematica, statistica e business per creare analisi predittive, presentandole e comunicandole con professionalit√† e competenza. Opererai in un ambiente orientato all'innovazione tecnologica, occupandoti di Data Science, Advanced Analytics, Predictive Maintenance, Natural Language Processing, Econometrics e molto altro! Abbiamo ricevuto riconoscimenti internazionali per quanto riguarda la nostra capacit√† di interpretare e gestire i dati.
Integrazione dei dati: capire quali fonti di dati sono importanti e come devono essere trattate al fine di potenziare nuovi strumenti e metodologie Data Driven
Modellazione: sviluppo di nuovi modelli Statistici e di Machine Learning ad hoc per soddisfare le richieste e i requisiti aziendali
Piattaforme di analisi avanzate: Sviluppo di pipeline ML complete, dall'ingestione dei dati alle applicazioni frontend

Incontri ed eventi orientati al business: concentrandosi fortemente sulla condivisione con gli utenti aziendali dei dettagli del progetto, si costruisce la fiducia nello strumento e nella metodologia utilizzata per svilupparlo.
Come As You Are - Le tue competenze e caratteristiche
Questa opportunit√† √® perfetta per te se:
Possiedi una Laurea in Data Science, Statistica, Matematica/Ingegneria Matematica, o altra ritenuta attinente
Hai una buona conoscenza dei principali linguaggi di programmazione come Python, R, SAS

Hai competenze nella comprensione del ciclo di vita dei modelli: preparazione dei dati dell'ultimo miglio, sviluppo di modelli statistici e di intelligenza artificiale e distribuzione in un'infrastruttura cloud
Hai una buona conoscenza di: Data Warehouse, estrazione, manipolazione e preparazione dei dati

Hai competenze di base di Data Visualization, con soluzioni Enterprise (es. PowerBI) o soluzioni open-source come ggplot o plotly, e magari anche di visualizzazione di dati geografici tramite sistemi GIS e/o librerie geografiche (geopandas)
Hai conoscenze generali di statistica economica (grandezze macroeconomiche, contabilit√† Istat, numeri indice, serie storiche economiche e finanziarie, statistica territoriale) e di econometria
Sai consultare le fonti statistiche ufficiali (Istat, Eurostat, Banca d‚ÄôItalia, Fondo Monetario Internazionale, Banca Mondiale, OCSE, ecc.)
Hai competenze di base con le principali piattaforme cloud (Azure, AWS)
Hai una buona padronanza della lingua inglese, preferibilmente con esperienze di studio e/o lavoro all'estero.
Your Future With Us - Cosa troverai in KPMG
Un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, equo e che rispetta, incoraggia e valorizza le diversit√†
Un contesto stimolante e dinamico che incentiva la creativit√† e il lavoro di squadra
Modalit√† di lavoro ibrida, per promuovere un sano equilibrio tra vita lavorativa e personale
Programmi di formazione e sviluppo avanzati per rimanere sempre aggiornati
Together for Better ‚Äì I nostri valori e il nostro impegno

Leadership, lavoro in team, rispetto di ogni individualit√†, approfondimento continuo, trasparenza, impegno verso la comunit√†, integrit√†: questi sono i Valori di KPMG che danno vita a un ambiente aperto allo scambio di idee e di conoscenza, che permette ai nostri professionisti di esprimere tutto il loro potenziale.

Grazie all‚Äôimpegno nel favorire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, il nostro Network ha ottenuto le certificazioni ISO 30415, che attesta la conformit√† del Sistema di Gestione per la Diversit√† e l‚ÄôInclusione, e UNI PdR 125, che certifica la parit√† di genere. All‚Äôinterno del nostro Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - trovi riassunte tutte le azioni che stiamo portando avanti su tematiche ambientali, sociali e di governance (ESG).

I tuoi dati saranno trattati nel pieno rispetto delle disposizioni del Regolamento (UE) n. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ""GDPR"") e successive modifiche. Per ulteriori informazioni, consultare l'informativa sulla privacy di KPMG.
KPMG Advisory S.p.A. garantisce le pari opportunit√†.
We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

Do you want to do work that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG you will have the opportunity to help clients, society, and colleagues address and solve the most current and complex challenges. KPMG Advisory provides consulting services to companies to assist them in business model transformation, process improvement and digitization, risk analysis and management, and support in extraordinary finance transactions.
Specifically, you will join the Lighthouse Team in Rome.
Lighthouse is KPMG Advisory's center of excellence offering Data & Analytics solutions in the market.

Joining the team, you will develop innovative solutions drawing on our global expertise. You will combine computer science, mathematics, statistics and business to create predictive analytics, presenting and communicating them with professionalism and expertise. You will work in a technology innovation-oriented environment, dealing with Data Science, Advanced Analytics, Predictive Maintenance, Natural Language Processing, Econometrics and more! We have received international recognition for our ability to interpret and manage data.
Specifically, you will be responsible for:
Data Integration: understanding which data sources are important and how they should be treated in order to enhance new Data Driven tools and methodologies
Modeling: developing new ad hoc Statistical and Machine Learning models to meet business demands and requirements
Advanced Analytics Platforms: Development of complete ML pipelines, from data ingestion to frontend applications
Business-oriented meetings and events: Strong focus on sharing project details with business users builds confidence in the tool and the methodology used to develop it.
Come As You Are - Your Skills And Characteristics.
This opportunity is perfect for you if:
You hold a Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics/Mathematical Engineering, or other deemed relevant
You have a good understanding of major programming languages such as Python, R, SAS
You have skills in understanding the model lifecycle: last mile data preparation, statistical and artificial intelligence model development and deployment in a cloud infrastructure
You have a good understanding of: Data Warehouse, data extraction, manipulation and preparation

You have basic skills in Data Visualization, with Enterprise solutions (e.g., PowerBI) or open-source solutions such as ggplot or plotly, and perhaps also in visualization of geographic data using GIS systems and/or geographic libraries (geopandas)
You have general knowledge of economic statistics (macroeconomic quantities, Istat accounting, index numbers, economic and financial time series, spatial statistics) and econometrics
You know how to consult official statistical sources (Istat, Eurostat, Bank of Italy, International Monetary Fund, World Bank, OECD, etc.)
You have basic skills with the main cloud platforms (Azure, AWS)
You have a good command of the English language, preferably with study and/or work experience abroad.
Your Future With Us - What you will find at KPMG.
An inclusive, equitable work environment that respects, encourages and values diversity
A stimulating and dynamic environment that encourages creativity and teamwork
Hybrid work mode to promote a healthy work-life balance
Advanced training and development programs to stay current
Initiatives focusing on mental and physical well-being.
Together for Better - Our Values and Commitment.

Leadership, teamwork, respect for each individuality, continuous deepening, transparency, commitment to the community, integrity: these are KPMG's Values that give rise to an environment open to the exchange of ideas and knowledge, enabling our professionals to reach their full potential.

As a result of our commitment to fostering an inclusive work environment, our Network has obtained ISO 30415 certification, which certifies compliance of the Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and UNI PdR 125, which certifies gender equality. Inside our Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - you will find summarized all the actions we are taking on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues.

Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) No. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ‚ÄúGDPR‚Äù) as amended. For more information, please see KPMG's privacy policy.
KPMG Advisory S.p.A. guarantees equal opportunities.

column24: • You have skills in understanding the model lifecycle: last mile data preparation, statistical and artificial intelligence model development and deployment in a cloud infrastructure
column25: • You have a good understanding of: Data Warehouse, data extraction, manipulation and preparation
column26: • You have basic skills in Data Visualization, with Enterprise solutions (e.g., PowerBI) or open-source solutions such as ggplot or plotly, and perhaps also in visualization of geographic data using GIS systems and/or geographic libraries (geopandas)
column27: • You have general knowledge of economic statistics (macroeconomic quantities, Istat accounting, index numbers, economic and financial time series, spatial statistics) and econometrics
column28: • You know how to consult official statistical sources (Istat, Eurostat, Bank of Italy, International Monetary Fund, World Bank, OECD, etc.)
column29: • You have basic skills with the main cloud platforms (Azure, AWS)
column30:
• You have a good command of the English language, preferably with study and/or work experience abroad.

    • Your Future With Us - What you will find at KPMG.

    • An inclusive, equitable work environment that respects, encourages and values diversity
column31: • A stimulating and dynamic environment that encourages creativity and teamwork
column32: • Hybrid work mode to promote a healthy work-life balance
column33: • Advanced training and development programs to stay current
column35:
• Initiatives focusing on mental and physical well-being.

    • Together for Better - Our Values and Commitment.

    Leadership, teamwork, respect for each individuality, continuous deepening, transparency, commitment to the community, integrity: these are KPMG's Values that give rise to an environment open to the exchange of ideas and knowledge, enabling our professionals to reach their full potential.

    As a result of our commitment to fostering an inclusive work environment, our Network has obtained ISO 30415 certification, which certifies compliance of the Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and UNI PdR 125, which certifies gender equality. Inside our Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - you will find summarized all the actions we are taking on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues.

    Join us!

    Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) No. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ‚ÄúGDPR‚Äù) as amended. For more information, please see KPMG's privacy policy.

    KPMG Advisory S.p.A. guarantees equal opportunities.

BI Management presso la sede di Roma.

Join our next generation

Vuoi fare un lavoro che sia davvero significativo e di impatto? In KPMG avrai l‚Äôopportunit√† di aiutare i clienti, la societ√†, le colleghe e i colleghi ad affrontare e risolvere le sfide pi√π attuali e complesse. KPMG Advisory offre servizi di consulenza alle imprese per affiancarle nella trasformazione del business model, nel miglioramento e nella digitalizzazione dei processi, nell'analisi e nella gestione dei rischi, nonch√© supporto nelle operazioni di finanza straordinaria.
Nel particolare, entrerai a far parte del Team di Lighthouse di Roma.
La Lighthouse √® il centro di eccellenza di KPMG Advisory che offre soluzioni di Data & Analytics sul mercato.

Unendoti al team, svilupperai soluzioni innovative attingendo dalle nostre competenze globali. Combinerai informatica, matematica, statistica e business per creare analisi predittive, presentandole e comunicandole con professionalit√† e competenza. Opererai in un ambiente orientato all'innovazione tecnologica, occupandoti di Data Science, Advanced Analytics, Predictive Maintenance, Natural Language Processing, Econometrics e molto altro! Abbiamo ricevuto riconoscimenti internazionali per quanto riguarda la nostra capacit√† di interpretare e gestire i dati.
Integrazione dei dati: capire quali fonti di dati sono importanti e come devono essere trattate al fine di potenziare nuovi strumenti e metodologie Data Driven
Modellazione: sviluppo di nuovi modelli Statistici e di Machine Learning ad hoc per soddisfare le richieste e i requisiti aziendali
Piattaforme di analisi avanzate: Sviluppo di pipeline ML complete, dall'ingestione dei dati alle applicazioni frontend

Incontri ed eventi orientati al business: concentrandosi fortemente sulla condivisione con gli utenti aziendali dei dettagli del progetto, si costruisce la fiducia nello strumento e nella metodologia utilizzata per svilupparlo.
Come As You Are - Le tue competenze e caratteristiche
Questa opportunit√† √® perfetta per te se:
Possiedi una Laurea in Data Science, Statistica, Matematica/Ingegneria Matematica, o altra ritenuta attinente
Hai una buona conoscenza dei principali linguaggi di programmazione come Python, R, SAS

Hai competenze nella comprensione del ciclo di vita dei modelli: preparazione dei dati dell'ultimo miglio, sviluppo di modelli statistici e di intelligenza artificiale e distribuzione in un'infrastruttura cloud
Hai una buona conoscenza di: Data Warehouse, estrazione, manipolazione e preparazione dei dati

Hai competenze di base di Data Visualization, con soluzioni Enterprise (es. PowerBI) o soluzioni open-source come ggplot o plotly, e magari anche di visualizzazione di dati geografici tramite sistemi GIS e/o librerie geografiche (geopandas)
Hai conoscenze generali di statistica economica (grandezze macroeconomiche, contabilit√† Istat, numeri indice, serie storiche economiche e finanziarie, statistica territoriale) e di econometria
Sai consultare le fonti statistiche ufficiali (Istat, Eurostat, Banca d‚ÄôItalia, Fondo Monetario Internazionale, Banca Mondiale, OCSE, ecc.)
Hai competenze di base con le principali piattaforme cloud (Azure, AWS)
Hai una buona padronanza della lingua inglese, preferibilmente con esperienze di studio e/o lavoro all'estero.
Your Future With Us - Cosa troverai in KPMG
Un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, equo e che rispetta, incoraggia e valorizza le diversit√†
Un contesto stimolante e dinamico che incentiva la creativit√† e il lavoro di squadra
Modalit√† di lavoro ibrida, per promuovere un sano equilibrio tra vita lavorativa e personale
Programmi di formazione e sviluppo avanzati per rimanere sempre aggiornati
Together for Better ‚Äì I nostri valori e il nostro impegno

Leadership, lavoro in team, rispetto di ogni individualit√†, approfondimento continuo, trasparenza, impegno verso la comunit√†, integrit√†: questi sono i Valori di KPMG che danno vita a un ambiente aperto allo scambio di idee e di conoscenza, che permette ai nostri professionisti di esprimere tutto il loro potenziale.

Grazie all‚Äôimpegno nel favorire un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, il nostro Network ha ottenuto le certificazioni ISO 30415, che attesta la conformit√† del Sistema di Gestione per la Diversit√† e l‚ÄôInclusione, e UNI PdR 125, che certifica la parit√† di genere. All‚Äôinterno del nostro Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - trovi riassunte tutte le azioni che stiamo portando avanti su tematiche ambientali, sociali e di governance (ESG).

I tuoi dati saranno trattati nel pieno rispetto delle disposizioni del Regolamento (UE) n. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ""GDPR"") e successive modifiche. Per ulteriori informazioni, consultare l'informativa sulla privacy di KPMG.
KPMG Advisory S.p.A. garantisce le pari opportunit√†.
We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

Do you want to do work that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG you will have the opportunity to help clients, society, and colleagues address and solve the most current and complex challenges. KPMG Advisory provides consulting services to companies to assist them in business model transformation, process improvement and digitization, risk analysis and management, and support in extraordinary finance transactions.
Specifically, you will join the Lighthouse Team in Rome.
Lighthouse is KPMG Advisory's center of excellence offering Data & Analytics solutions in the market.

Joining the team, you will develop innovative solutions drawing on our global expertise. You will combine computer science, mathematics, statistics and business to create predictive analytics, presenting and communicating them with professionalism and expertise. You will work in a technology innovation-oriented environment, dealing with Data Science, Advanced Analytics, Predictive Maintenance, Natural Language Processing, Econometrics and more! We have received international recognition for our ability to interpret and manage data.
Specifically, you will be responsible for:
Data Integration: understanding which data sources are important and how they should be treated in order to enhance new Data Driven tools and methodologies
Modeling: developing new ad hoc Statistical and Machine Learning models to meet business demands and requirements
Advanced Analytics Platforms: Development of complete ML pipelines, from data ingestion to frontend applications
Business-oriented meetings and events: Strong focus on sharing project details with business users builds confidence in the tool and the methodology used to develop it.
Come As You Are - Your Skills And Characteristics.
This opportunity is perfect for you if:
You hold a Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics/Mathematical Engineering, or other deemed relevant
You have a good understanding of major programming languages such as Python, R, SAS
You have skills in understanding the model lifecycle: last mile data preparation, statistical and artificial intelligence model development and deployment in a cloud infrastructure
You have a good understanding of: Data Warehouse, data extraction, manipulation and preparation

You have basic skills in Data Visualization, with Enterprise solutions (e.g., PowerBI) or open-source solutions such as ggplot or plotly, and perhaps also in visualization of geographic data using GIS systems and/or geographic libraries (geopandas)
You have general knowledge of economic statistics (macroeconomic quantities, Istat accounting, index numbers, economic and financial time series, spatial statistics) and econometrics
You know how to consult official statistical sources (Istat, Eurostat, Bank of Italy, International Monetary Fund, World Bank, OECD, etc.)
You have basic skills with the main cloud platforms (Azure, AWS)
You have a good command of the English language, preferably with study and/or work experience abroad.
Your Future With Us - What you will find at KPMG.
An inclusive, equitable work environment that respects, encourages and values diversity
A stimulating and dynamic environment that encourages creativity and teamwork
Hybrid work mode to promote a healthy work-life balance
Advanced training and development programs to stay current
Initiatives focusing on mental and physical well-being.
Together for Better - Our Values and Commitment.

Leadership, teamwork, respect for each individuality, continuous deepening, transparency, commitment to the community, integrity: these are KPMG's Values that give rise to an environment open to the exchange of ideas and knowledge, enabling our professionals to reach their full potential.

As a result of our commitment to fostering an inclusive work environment, our Network has obtained ISO 30415 certification, which certifies compliance of the Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and UNI PdR 125, which certifies gender equality. Inside our Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - you will find summarized all the actions we are taking on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues.

Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) No. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ‚ÄúGDPR‚Äù) as amended. For more information, please see KPMG's privacy policy.
KPMG Advisory S.p.A. guarantees equal opportunities.

We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

    I tuoi dati saranno trattati nel pieno rispetto delle disposizioni del Regolamento (UE) n. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ""GDPR"") e successive modifiche. Per ulteriori informazioni, consultare l'informativa sulla privacy di KPMG.

    KPMG Advisory S.p.A. garantisce le pari opportunit√†.

    We let the future guide us. Join our next generation

    Do you want to do work that is truly meaningful and impactful? At KPMG you will have the opportunity to help clients, society, and colleagues address and solve the most current and complex challenges. KPMG Advisory provides consulting services to companies to assist them in business model transformation, process improvement and digitization, risk analysis and management, and support in extraordinary finance transactions.

    Specifically, you will join the Lighthouse Team in Rome.

    Lighthouse is KPMG Advisory's center of excellence offering Data &
column19:
Analytics solutions in the market.

Joining the team, you will develop innovative solutions drawing on our global expertise. You will combine computer science, mathematics, statistics and business to create predictive analytics, presenting and communicating them with professionalism and expertise. You will work in a technology innovation-oriented environment, dealing with Data Science, Advanced Analytics, Predictive Maintenance, Natural Language Processing, Econometrics and more! We have received international recognition for our ability to interpret and manage data.

Specifically, you will be responsible for:

  • Data Integration: understanding which data sources are important and how they should be treated in order to enhance new Data Driven tools and methodologies
column20: • Modeling: developing new ad hoc Statistical and Machine Learning models to meet business demands and requirements
column21: • Advanced Analytics Platforms: Development of complete ML pipelines, from data ingestion to frontend applications
column22:
• Business-oriented meetings and events: Strong focus on sharing project details with business users builds confidence in the tool and the methodology used to develop it.

    • Come As You Are - Your Skills And Characteristics.

    This opportunity is perfect for you if:

    • You hold a Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics/Mathematical Engineering, or other deemed relevant
column23: • You have a good understanding of major programming languages such as Python, R, SAS
column24: • You have skills in understanding the model lifecycle: last mile data preparation, statistical and artificial intelligence model development and deployment in a cloud infrastructure
column25: • You have a good understanding of: Data Warehouse, data extraction, manipulation and preparation
column26: • You have basic skills in Data Visualization, with Enterprise solutions (e.g., PowerBI) or open-source solutions such as ggplot or plotly, and perhaps also in visualization of geographic data using GIS systems and/or geographic libraries (geopandas)
column27: • You have general knowledge of economic statistics (macroeconomic quantities, Istat accounting, index numbers, economic and financial time series, spatial statistics) and econometrics
column28: • You know how to consult official statistical sources (Istat, Eurostat, Bank of Italy, International Monetary Fund, World Bank, OECD, etc.)
column29: • You have basic skills with the main cloud platforms (Azure, AWS)
column30:
• You have a good command of the English language, preferably with study and/or work experience abroad.

    • Your Future With Us - What you will find at KPMG.

    • An inclusive, equitable work environment that respects, encourages and values diversity
column31: • A stimulating and dynamic environment that encourages creativity and teamwork
column32: • Hybrid work mode to promote a healthy work-life balance
column33: • Advanced training and development programs to stay current
column35:
• Initiatives focusing on mental and physical well-being.

    • Together for Better - Our Values and Commitment.

    Leadership, teamwork, respect for each individuality, continuous deepening, transparency, commitment to the community, integrity: these are KPMG's Values that give rise to an environment open to the exchange of ideas and knowledge, enabling our professionals to reach their full potential.

    As a result of our commitment to fostering an inclusive work environment, our Network has obtained ISO 30415 certification, which certifies compliance of the Diversity and Inclusion Management System, and UNI PdR 125, which certifies gender equality. Inside our Impact Plan - Our Impact Plan (kpmg.com) - you will find summarized all the actions we are taking on environmental, social and governance (ESG) issues.

    Join us!

    Your data will be processed in full compliance with the provisions of Regulation (EU) No. 679/2016 (General Data Protection Regulation - ‚ÄúGDPR‚Äù) as amended. For more information, please see KPMG's privacy policy.

    KPMG Advisory S.p.A. guarantees equal opportunities.
